tooltips.Description: Necrophos stills the hearts of his opponents, causing nearby enemy units to lose a percentage of their max health over time. Passively provides regen for 7 seconds for each unit Necrophos kills.
tooltips.scepter_description: Heartstopper Aura's Health Decay is increased by +50% of Necrophos's current health regeneration.
tooltips.Lore: Those who come within a short distance of Pticoza can feel pestilence and plague in the air.
tooltips.Note0: Damage won't disable items like Blink Dagger.
tooltips.Note1: Does not affect ancient creeps.

tooltips.Description: Necrophos turns into a large Death Pulse towards the target unit's position. Once it arrives to the location, the Death Pulse spreads towards nearby enemies and allies.

Stuns the target enemy hero, then deals damage based on how much life it is missing. If Necrophos kills an enemy this way, he'll permanently gain Health and Mana Regen. Any kill under this effect is credited to Necrophos.
tooltips.Lore: The amount of death and suffering in the air increases the power of Necrophos's plague magic.
tooltips.Note0: Damage is dealt at the end of the stun.

npc_dota_hero_warlock.Name: Warlock
npc_dota_hero_warlock.Short: Summons powerful demons to fight at his side

tooltips.Description: Binds several enemy units together, causing a percentage of the damage dealt to one of them to be felt by the others. Summons an imp from the corpse of any unit that dies while under the effects of Fatal Bonds that lasts for 15 seconds and explodes on death. Imps will automatically seek out nearby units, favoring fatally bonded heroes, and will explode when reaching their prey.
tooltips.Lore: An ancient incantation that links the vital energies of multiple lifeforms into one collective body.
tooltips.Note0: The shared damage type is the same as the type of damage inflicted.
tooltips.shard_Description: Increases the power of all imps summoned by Warlock.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases the power of all imps summoned by Warlock.

tooltips.Description: Warlock whispers an incantation, healing a friendly unit or damaging an enemy unit over time.
tooltips.shard_description: Turns Shadow Word into a %shard_aoe% AoE Spell.
tooltips.Lore: Demnok's arcane arts have a myriad of uses, allowing them to be powerful friendly enchantments or damaging curses.

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - A powerful slowing and damaging current that grows stronger as it's channeled. Lasts up to 10 seconds. Enemies are slowed for 3.0 seconds after leaving the area or the spell ends.
tooltips.Lore: Demnok manipulates space-time, impairing entire armies.
tooltips.Note0: The slow increase is based on length of the channel, not the duration an enemy was standing in the area.
tooltips.shard_description: While channeling, Warlock spawns an imp every 2 seconds that lasts for 15 seconds and explode dealing damage to all enemies around them upon death.

tooltips.Description: Summons a Golem from the depths, stunning enemies for 0.8 seconds. The Golem lives 60 seconds, takes reduced damage from spells, has increased Slow Resistance, has Permanent Immolation and Flaming Fists on attack.
tooltips.scepter_description: Calls 2 Golems with reduced stats and bounty.
tooltips.Lore: Demnok unleashes the captive spirit in his Dreadwood staff, causing destruction in enemy ranks.
tooltips.Note0: This ability destroys trees in its area of effect.

talent_3.name: +10 Upheaval Attack Speed per second on Allies

talent_8.name: 80% Magic Resistance for Chaotic Offering Golems

npc_dota_hero_beastmaster.Name: Beastmaster
npc_dota_hero_beastmaster.Short: Summons beasts to aid his hunt

tooltips.Description: Beastmaster sends his axes flying and calls them home again, slicing through enemy units and trees along their path.  Each axe can hit an enemy once, and amplifies subsequent damage from Beastmaster and his units.
tooltips.Lore: While learning to maneuver in nature alone, the Beastmaster also mastered the use of a pair of tomahawks, adept at cutting down trees as well as adversaries.
tooltips.Note0: This ability destroys trees.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Wild Axes to have no cooldown and can be used again once they come back.

tooltips.Description: Beastmaster calls forth a Boar to aid in the battlefield. The Boar has a passive poison attack that slows attack and movement speeds.
tooltips.Lore: After befriending the strange beast of his childhood, Beastmaster has learned to call to animals in times of need.

tooltips.Description: Beastmaster summons a hawk that circles around Beastmaster and dive-bombs at enemies with a base attack rate of every 4s, damaging and rooting them. Attack rate increases with the Hawk's attack speed. Prioritizes heroes.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Call of the Wild Boar. Accessible by toggling auto-cast.
tooltips.shard_description: Reduces Hawk cooldown by -10s and summons an additional Hawk.
tooltips.Lore: After befriending the strange beast of his childhood, Beastmaster has learned to call to animals in times of need.
tooltips.attack_Description: Order all hawks to dive bomb the selected target

tooltips.Description: Untaps the inner fury of nearby allies, passively increasing their attack speed.
tooltips.Lore: Beastmaster's ability to incite the innate strength of animals was seen in the mauling of the king of Slom.
Nature's rage is timeless, and for those who know the secrets, it's easy to stir the echoes of ire that rejoiced in the downfall of Slom.
tooltips.Description: Attacks from Beastmaster or a nearby unit he controls will cause him bang his drum, dealing damage to nearby units and  healing Beastmaster and units under his control for a portion of the damage dealt. Every attack decreases the interval between drum hits down to a minimum of 0.4s between hits after 20 attacks. If no attacks are made, the intervals gradually increase.\n\nUsing Primal Roar counts as 10/15/20 attacks, based on the current level of Primal Roar.

Beastmaster lets loose a deafening roar that stuns, and shoves open a path to its target. All units in the path of the roar are damaged, while units shoved aside by the roar have their movement and attack speed slowed. Additionally, Beastmaster and his units gain 40% movement speed for 3 seconds.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes anyone that attacks a Primal Roar target to deal 1.3x Critical Strike.
tooltips.Lore: The Beastmaster has learned to channel his primal instincts into an animalistic roar, causing devastation in the ranks of enemies.

talent_2.name: +2.5% Wild Axes Damage Amp Per Stack

talent_3.name: +20 Movespeed Aura to Beastmaster and his units

talent_6.name: +250 Max Health Aura to Beastmaster and his units

npc_dota_hero_queenofpain.Name: Queen of Pain
npc_dota_hero_queenofpain.Short: Blinks in to deal massive magical damage

tooltips.Description: Hurls a poisoned dagger which deals large initial damage, and then deals damage over time. The poisoned unit has its movement speed slowed for 15 seconds.  An instance of damage is dealt every 3.0 seconds. Queen of Pain relishes in the pain inflicted, healing every time the enemy takes damage. Creeps heal for half the damage only.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Causes Shadow Strike to become a %aoe_radius% AoE Spell, and have increased initial damage. When Shadow Strike ends or is re-applied to an enemy Hero, the target emits a Scream of Pain, hitting any nearby enemies.
tooltips.Lore: Akasha's envenomed dagger allows her to delight in the drawn out suffering of her victims.
tooltips.Note0: The affected unit slowly regains its original movement speed every second during the duration.
tooltips.Note1: Units afflicted by Shadow Strike can be denied by their allies when their HP drops below 25% of their maximum health.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Shadow Strike to become a +375 AoE Spell, and have increased initial damage. When Shadow Strike ends or is re-applied to an enemy Hero, the target emits a Scream of Pain, hitting any nearby enemies.

tooltips.Description: Short distance teleportation that allows Queen of Pain to move in and out of combat.
tooltips.shard_description: Releases a sonic boom when Queen of Pain blinks, at both her starting and ending locations. Deals 125 damage in a 300 AoE and silences the target for 1.75 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: The Secret Queen lives up to her title, making her pain impossible to escape.
tooltips.Note0: You can use Blink to dodge incoming projectiles.

tooltips.Description: The Queen of Pain lets loose a piercing scream around her, damaging nearby enemies.
tooltips.Lore: The sultry voice of Akasha beckons her opponents while stealing their souls.
tooltips.Note0: Scream Of Pain will hit invisible units.
tooltips.Note1: Scream Of Pain cannot be disjointed.

tooltips.Description: Creates a gigantic wave of sound in front of Queen of Pain, dealing heavy damage to all enemy units in its wake and pushing them back.
tooltips.Lore: Her most exquisite of all of torments, Akasha's Sonic Wave puts her poor foes out of their misery.
tooltips.Note0: Sonic Wave can hit units up to 1150 units away.

npc_dota_hero_venomancer.Name: Venomancer
npc_dota_hero_venomancer.Short: Deals damage over time with venomous attacks

tooltips.Description: Launches a ball of venom in a line, poisoning enemy units so that they take both initial damage and damage over time, as well as suffering slowed movement.  Venomous Gale deals damage every 3 seconds over its duration.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases travel range, and when Venomous Gale impacts enemy Heroes, it creates Plague Wards around them.
tooltips.Lore: A concoction of various stings, poisons, and toxins gathered from the jungles of Jidi Isle, victims surviving it are rare.
tooltips.Note0: Venomous Gale can be lethal. Units afflicted by Venomous Gale can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.
tooltips.Note1: Duration damage is dealt every %tick_interval% seconds.
tooltips.Note2: Slow starts at %movement_slow%%, and decreases as time passes.

tooltips.Description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks and slowing movement speed.
tooltips.Lore: The paralytic sting of the creature which caused his transformation now belongs to the Venomancer.
tooltips.Note0: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.
tooltips.Note1: Damage from Poison Sting does not interrupt healing from items, nor does it activate the cooldown on Blink Dagger.

tooltips.Description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
tooltips.Lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.
As Venomancer's own origins corroborate, some of Jidi's most horrifying dangers become apparent only with time.
tooltips.Description: Applies a weak poison that minorly slows and deals damage to its target. If this poison is dispelled in any way, the target will receive a large amount of damage and be stunned.

Whenever Venomancer dies or the effects of Venomous Gale end prematurely on an enemy hero, a spreading ring of poison erupts. Enemies hit by the poison will take non-lethal magic damage over time and have their magic resistance reduced. This effect can trigger every 10 seconds and cannot be refreshed.
tooltips.Lore: In the Acid Jungles, creatures releasing noxious poison to their attackers is common; Venomancer spreads this plague beyond the Jidi Isle.

tooltips.Description: Infects an enemy with a deadly plague that does an initial burst of damage and additional damage over time based on the unit's maximum health. The plague slows the target and nearby enemies based on their distance to the target. When the target dies or the debuff expires, all nearby enemies are infected with a noncommunicable version of the plague.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Scepter: Poison Nova is hidden in the ability panel when Scepter is aquired, but a buff icon will appear when the effect is off cooldown.

talent_7.name: Noxious Plague Aura reduces 200 Attack Speed

npc_dota_hero_faceless_void.Name: Faceless Void
npc_dota_hero_faceless_void.Short: Can freeze his enemies in time

tooltips.Description: Rushes to a target location while backtracking any damage taken the last 2.0 seconds.
tooltips.scepter_description: Applies a Time Lock to all units at the landing destination.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases range
tooltips.Lore: Darkterror tears a hole in time, passing through Claszureme, and appearing back in an instant.
tooltips.Note0: Faceless Void is invulnerable while using Time Walk.
tooltips.reverse_Description: Available for 1.5 seconds after landing Time Walk. If used in this period, you will reverse your time walk back to your previous cast location. Does not affect health or proc scepter hits.

tooltips.Description: Faceless Void traps all nearby enemies in a time dilation field for 8 seconds, extending their cooldowns and slowing their movement and attack speed by 7% for each cooldown extended. Deals bonus damage per second for each cooldown. The debuff does not tick down while inside Chronosphere.
tooltips.lore: For those facing off against Darkterror, each moment seems to stretch into eternity.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect item cooldowns.

tooltips.Description: Adds the chance for an attack to lock an enemy unit in time while attacking it a second time.
tooltips.Lore: The strike of the Faceless Void lands with dimension shifting force.
tooltips.Note1: Does not stack with Skull Basher.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: In Ability Draft, does stack with Skull Basher.

tooltips.Description: Available for 1.5 seconds after landing Time Walk. If used in this period, you will reverse your time walk back to your previous cast location. Does not affect health or proc scepter hits.

Creates a blister in spacetime, trapping all units caught in its sphere of influence and causes you to move very quickly inside it.  All ability and item cooldowns are frozen. Only Faceless Void and any units he controls are unaffected.  Invisible enemies in the sphere will be revealed.
tooltips.Lore: When a rift opens to Claszureme, all poor souls caught within will likely never return.
tooltips.Note0: Pauses all units and buildings, friendly or enemy, except those owned by Faceless Void.
tooltips.Note1: Faceless Void is never affected by Chronospheres with any owner.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Faceless Void can move freely within the Chronosphere without drafting Chronosphere and regardless of team.

tooltips.Description: Wraith King sears an enemy unit with spectral fire, dealing damage and stunning, then dealing damage over time and slowing the target. Summoned skeletons around the target will receive bonus movement and attack speed for the duration of the debuff.
tooltips.Lore: Ostarion calls on his damned lineage, laying waste to his opponents.
tooltips.Note0: If Wraith King has summoned skeletons, casting Wraithfire Blast on a target will order all of the skeletons to attack that target.

tooltips.Description:
Restore health based on the damage Wraith King deals when attacking enemy units. Can be cast to summon skeletons with Vampiric Spirit. For every two kills Wraith King or any unit he controls accrue on enemy units, Vampiric Aura adds a skeleton charge. Skeletons respawn once when killed.

 Skeletons deal more damage to heroes and less damage to buildings.

Lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 40%.
tooltips.Lore: Wraith King's blade drains his enemy's essence to feed his aura.
tooltips.Note0: Summoned skeletons will automatically attack any unit targeted by Wraithfire Blast.
tooltips.Note1: Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

tooltips.Description: Wraith King passively deals bonus damage on an attack with a cooldown.
tooltips.Lore: One blow to crush a foe.

tooltips.Description: Wraith King's form regroups after death, allowing him to resurrect when killed in battle.  Upon death, enemy units in a 900 radius will be slowed, and spawn 1 skeleton(s) to attack each nearby enemy hero. Can be self-cast to kill Wraith King instantly.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Reincarnation to have no mana cost and increases Skeleton Spawn count.
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces cooldown. If a nearby allied hero is slain, they will be transformed into a wraith and have their death delayed and gain bonus attack and movement speed. Heroes who die this way respawn at a faster rate.
tooltips.Lore: Conspirators against the Wraith King wonder why he never stays dead.
tooltips.Note0: Wraith King won't revive if he doesn't have enough mana.
tooltips.Note1: If Wraith King has an Aegis and Reincarnation off cooldown, Reincarnation will trigger first.
tooltips.Note2: Revives with full HP and Mana.
tooltips.Note3: Credit for allies whose death was delayed will go to whoever struck the original killing blow.
tooltips.Note4: Wraith Delay affects Wraith King's actual deaths, not Reincarnate deaths.

npc_dota_hero_death_prophet.Name: Death Prophet
npc_dota_hero_death_prophet.Short: Summons an army of ghosts to attack

tooltips.Description: Sends a swarm of winged beasts to savage enemy units in front of Death Prophet.
tooltips.Lore: Krobelus' many trips to the grave gather a flock of the damned.
tooltips.Note0: Can hit units up to 1110 range away.

tooltips.Description: Fires a projectile that slows enemy units in a target area and prevents them from casting spells.
tooltips.Lore: Peering into the veil of her opponent's demise, Krobelus sees a silent future.
tooltips.Note0: Doesn't prevent usage of items.

tooltips.Description: Creates a spirit link between Death Prophet and an enemy unit, draining health from the enemy.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases Spirit Siphon charges by 1 and causes enemies to be feared for 1.0 seconds if they are siphoned for 3 seconds consecutively.
tooltips.Note0: Cannot cast multiple on same target.
tooltips.lore: Krobelus willingly shows others the path she alone cannot follow.

tooltips.Description:
Unleashes evil spirits to drain the life of nearby enemy units and structures. Spirits need to return back to Death Prophet in order to attack again. At the end of the spell's duration, Death Prophet is healed in proportion to the damage dealt. Deals 50% damage to buildings. Lasts 40 seconds.
Passively grants Movement Speed.
tooltips.scepter_description: Whenever an enemy is affected by Death Prophet's spells or when she attacks an enemy, a ghost will fly out, slow and hit the enemy for an increased bonus of its usual damage then return to her with life.
tooltips.Lore: Over time, the banshee remnants of her previous lives return to haunt the present.
tooltips.Note0: Radius represents the area in which the spirits will acquire targets around Death Prophet.
tooltips.Note1: Spirit damage isn't reduced by damage block abilities.

npc_dota_hero_phantom_assassin.Name: Phantom Assassin
npc_dota_hero_phantom_assassin.Short: Blinks onto her foes with critical strikes

tooltips.Description: Throws a dagger slowing the enemy unit's movement speed, dealing 65+30% of Phantom Assassin's attack damage as physical damage and applying attack effects from items and abilities.
tooltips.Note0: If an attack effect is chance-based, the chance of its application will be the same as its chance to occur.
tooltips.Note1: Spell-immune enemies are not affected by Stifling Dagger's slow.
tooltips.Note2: Stifling Dagger grants vision around its location while it travels and upon impact.
tooltips.Lore: The first skill learned by the Sisters of the Veil often signals an incoming hit.

tooltips.Description: Teleports to a unit, friendly or enemy, and grants bonus attack speed while attacking if it's an enemy unit.
tooltips.Lore: Mortred's silken veil is the last thing her unfortunate target sees.

tooltips.Description: Phantom Assassin focuses inward, increasing her ability to evade enemy attacks. Can be activated to blur her body, causing her to be impossible to see until near enemy heroes, towers, or outposts.\n\nStacks diminishingly with other sources of Evasion.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Blur to have instant cast time and applies a dispel. Any time Phantom Assassin gets a hero kill, her abilities are refreshed. Reduces cooldown.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: With Scepter, only non-ultimate spells will refresh.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases your movement speed by 40% while in Blur's active.
tooltips.Lore: Meditation allows a Veiled Sister to carefully anticipate her opponents in combat.
tooltips.Note0: Attacking Roshan with a regular attack will dispel Blur.

tooltips.Description: Phantom Assassin releases sharp blades around her, dealing a percentage of each victim's max health on impact and applying Break.

Phantom Assassin refines her combat abilities, acquiring a chance of gaining Deadly Focus with each attack. When attacking with Deadly Focus, Phantom Assassin will consume the buff and guarantee a critical hit. Stifling Dagger has a bonus chance to cause Deadly Focus.
tooltips.Lore: A divine strike, Mortred honors her opponent by choosing them for death.

npc_dota_hero_pugna.Name: Pugna
npc_dota_hero_pugna.Short: Drains enemy life to heal himself

tooltips.Description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area.  Deals 65% damage to structures.
tooltips.Lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
tooltips.Note0: Damage is delayed by %delay% seconds.

tooltips.Description: A powerful banishing spell that slows a unit and renders it unable to attack or be attacked. Healing on affected allies is increased, while afflicted enemies take extra magic damage instead. Can be cast while channeling.
tooltips.Lore: A now-mastered relic from his childhood, Pugna delights in banishing others into the Nether Realm, whether for good, evil, or simple enjoyment.
tooltips.Note0: Only magical and pure damage can affect a unit under the effects of Decrepify.
tooltips.Note1: Doesn't slow allied units.
tooltips.Note2: Can be used on your Nether Ward.

tooltips.Description: Punga places a Nether Ward at the target location. The ward will fire at any enemy hero who casts a spell dealing base damage plus the damage multiplier of the mana spent by the enemy hero.
tooltips.Lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases cast range.
tooltips.Note0: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect.
tooltips.Note1: Nether Ward can be decrepified.
tooltips.Note2: Illusions and creeps deal 25% damage to Nether Ward.

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - When cast on an enemy, Pugna drains health from the target enemy unit to heal himself and granting vision over the target. If Pugna has full HP, and the enemy target is a Hero, Life Drain will restore mana instead.\n\nWhen cast on an ally, Pugna will drain his own health into his ally.
tooltips.shard_description: Life Drain can target your Nether Ward, causing life drain to refract to all enemy heroes within 700 units of the ward for 75% of its normal value. The effect is interrupted if the ward is destroyed.
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces cooldown by %abilitycooldown%s. When targeting an enemy hero, Pugna reduces their outgoing spell damage by +8% per second up to a maximum of +75% and increases his own, up to a maximum of +100%. When draining through a Nether Ward using Shard, the rate of increase/decrease is +4% instead. Debuff lasts +8 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Pugna has truly become more powerful than even the grandmaster of Oblivion.
tooltips.Note0: Illusions are destroyed on the first tick of damage.

tooltips.Lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.
tooltips.Description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage and gaining a bonus to her damage.  The damage and avoidance effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances.
tooltips.Note0: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges).
tooltips.Note1: Only instances of %damage_threshold% or more damage will trigger Refraction.
tooltips.Note2: Refraction is visible to enemies.

tooltips.Lore: Lanaya is as elusive as her covenant with the Hidden Temple.
tooltips.Description: Templar Assassin conceals herself, becoming invisible as long as she remains still.  If Meld's invisibility is broken by attacking an enemy, Lanaya will deal bonus damage to the enemy and reduce their armor for 12 seconds.
tooltips.Note0: Meld is broken by any action other than staying in position or channeling Psionic Projection.
tooltips.Note1: Meld's armor reduction does not work against towers.

tooltips.Lore: Her blades pierce the skin as much as the mind, furthering her understanding of the mystery that is reality.
tooltips.Description: Templar Assassin's psi blades slice through the attacked unit, splitting and damaging enemy units directly behind it, while gaining bonus attack range. For each unit it damages, the spill damage is reduced by a percentage.
tooltips.Note0: Split damage hits invisible units.
tooltips.Note1: Attack effects like Bash will only be applied to the main target.

tooltips.Description: Springs the trap nearest to Templar Assassin, slowing nearby enemies. \n\nIf the ability is in alt-cast state, springs the trap that is closest to the mouse cursor.
tooltips.teleport_Description: CHANNELED - Allows Templar Assassin to teleport to any Psionic Trap after channeling for NaN seconds, detonating it upon arrival as if it was fully charged and instantly dealing %extra_damage% bonus damage. Channeling Psionic Projection does not break Meld.
tooltips.teleport_Lore: In reward for her service, Lanaya has been granted access to secrets that unlock new techniques for her psionic gifts.

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Allows Templar Assassin to teleport to any Psionic Trap after channeling for 1 seconds, detonating it upon arrival as if it was fully charged and instantly dealing 200 bonus damage. Channeling Psionic Projection does not break Meld.
tooltips.Lore: In reward for her service, Lanaya has been granted access to secrets that unlock new techniques for her psionic gifts.
Calling upon the reach of the Hidden Temple, none escape the eye of the Templar.
tooltips.Description: Templar Assassin places mystical traps that invisibly monitor enemy movement. When sprung at her command, they deal a small amount of damage and exert a slowing influence of 30% in the area. Traps charge up to slow 60% after 3.5 seconds. Deals bonus damage when fully charged.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases max trap count and trap vision range.  When activated, traps now silence affected enemies.
tooltips.Note0: Traps last indefinitely.
tooltips.Note1: They have invisibility that fades in over %trap_fade_time% seconds, spell immunity, and 100 HP.
tooltips.Note2: Traps have 400/400 vision range and don't prevent neutral camps from spawning.

talent_3.name: Refraction Can Be Cast While Disabled

talent_4.name: +120 Psi Blades Attack and Spill Range

npc_dota_hero_viper.Name: Viper
npc_dota_hero_viper.Short: Poisonous toxins chip away armor and slow enemies

tooltips.Description: Intensifies Viper's venom, adding an effect to his normal attack that applies a stacking movement speed slow and magic resistance deduction while dealing damage over time. Stacks up to 5 times.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases max stacks, and causes Poison Attack to lower armor per stack and to affect buildings for reduced damage.
tooltips.Lore: The Netherdrake's inborn toxic breath quickly drains the vitality of its afflicted.

tooltips.Description: Viper releases a Nethertoxin at the targeted area. Units in that area take an increasing damage over time based on how long they remain in it. Units in it have their attack speed slowed.
tooltips.Lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.

tooltips.Description: Viper exudes an infectious toxin that damages and slows the attack speed of any enemy that damages it in a 1200 radius. The acid exudate also increases Viper's resistance to magic.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Corrosive Skin applies %effect_multiplier%x the damage and attack speed slow to enemies that are within %effect_multiplier_distance% distance of Viper.
tooltips.Lore: It is not unusual for sword and shield alike to corrode in the very hands of those who attack the Netherdrake.
tooltips.Note0: Stacks multiplicatively with other magic damage resistance sources.
tooltips.scepter_description: Corrosive Skin applies 2x the damage and attack speed slow to enemies that are within 500 distance of Viper.

tooltips.Lore: It was thought that Netherdrake wings touch ground only in death, but some surmise that those who've witnessed more intentional landings merely haven't survived to tell the tale.
tooltips.Description: Viper slams into the ground, disarming each enemy in a 500 AoE for 4 seconds and splattering everyone in a 1200 AoE with the effect of Corrosive Skin.
tooltips.Note0: Cannot be used while Leashed or Rooted.

tooltips.Description: Viper slows the targeted enemy unit's movement and attack speed while also disabling their passives and dealing poison damage over time.  The slowing effect reduces over the duration of the poison.
tooltips.Lore: Once used to slay his sadistic summoner, the most powerful of Netherdrake infections spreads through the veins of those foolish enough to cross Viper.
tooltips.scepter_description: Decreases mana cost and cooldown. Increases cast range.

npc_dota_hero_luna.Name: Luna
npc_dota_hero_luna.Short: Tears into her enemies with bouncing attacks

tooltips.Description: Calls a beam of lunar energy down upon an enemy, damaging and briefly stunning them.
tooltips.Lore: Selemene smites those who encroach upon the Nightsilver Woods.

tooltips.Description: Empowers Luna's glaives, causing her attacks to bounce between enemy units. Deals less damage with each bounce.
tooltips.Lore: Carefully sharpened, Luna's boomerang-like weapon cuts a wide swath through enemy numbers.
tooltips.shard_Description: Moon Glaives can be activated to create %rotating_glaives% glaives that rotate in a %rotating_glaives_movement_radius% radius around Luna for %rotating_glaives_duration% seconds, reducing damage she takes by %rotating_glaives_damage_reduction%%. Any unit that collides with a glaive will take %rotating_glaives_collision_damage%% of Luna's Attack Damage.
tooltips.Note0: Moon Glaives do not proc any attack modifier except Critical Strikes.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Moon Glaives work on all melee heroes.
tooltips.shard_description: Moon Glaives can be activated to create +4 glaives that rotate in a +175 radius around Luna for +7 seconds, reducing damage she takes by +25%. Any unit that collides with a glaive will take +75% of Luna's Attack Damage.

tooltips.Lore: The Goddess of the Moon smiles upon her kin.
tooltips.Description: Increases the attack damage for Luna and nearby allied heroes, with Luna receiving 200% of the attack damage bonus allies receive. At night Lunar Blessing is global, and Luna is blessed with increased vision range.
tooltips.shard_description: Lunar Blessing can be cast to smoke allied heroes within 800 range. Break Range and Bonus Movement Speed are stronger at night time. Additionally increases Eclipse Night time by 10s

tooltips.Lore: In times of great need, Selemene herself descends into the world, blocking out the light and hope of the opposed.
tooltips.Description: Showers random nearby enemies with strikes from Luna's current level of Lucent Beam. These beams do not stun their targets, and there is a maximum number of times that a single target can be struck. Also turns day into night for a short time.
tooltips.scepter_description: Allows Luna to cast Eclipse on an allied unit or herself and have its effects follow them, or cast it on an area. Also increases total beams, reduces duration, removes the limit on beams per unit, and makes the beams appear twice as fast.
tooltips.Note0: Eclipse doesn't work if Luna doesn't have any points in Lucent Beam.
tooltips.Note1: Beams will stop if Luna is killed.
tooltips.Note2: Will not hit invisible units.
tooltips.Note3: There is a %beam_interval% seconds gap between beams, %beam_interval_scepter% seconds with scepter.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Must draft Lucent Beam as well to work.

talent_5.name: 2 Moon Glaives fired on Lucent Beam

npc_dota_hero_dragon_knight.Name: Dragon Knight
npc_dota_hero_dragon_knight.Short: Transforms into a formidable ranged dragon

tooltips.Description: Unleashes a breath of fire in front of Dragon Knight that burns enemies and reduces the damage their attacks deal.\n\nApplies the debuff from Corrosive Breath and Frost Breath Dragon Form is of the corresponding level.
tooltips.Lore: Knight Davion's breath has become that of the mighty Eldwurm Slyrak, remembered for burning numerous other knights to a crisp.

tooltips.Description: Dragon Knight smites an enemy unit in melee range with his shield, stunning it while dealing damage based on their enemy max HP.  When in Elder Dragon Form, the cast range increases to 450.
tooltips.Lore: Davion's combination of dragon talents and knightly skills makes him a vicious opponent in melee combat.

tooltips.Description: The life blood of the Dragon improves health regeneration and strengthens armor.
tooltips.Lore: Slyrak's blood still courses through Davion's veins, giving him twice the vitality of an ordinary knight.

tooltips.Description: Ignites an area, dealing damage over time that lingers on enemies in it. Has reduced cast range when melee.

Dragon Knight takes the form of one of three powerful elder dragons, increasing his speed and Dragon Tail's range, while granting him new powers.
LEVEL 1 Green Dragon - Corrosive Breath: attacks deal 25 poison damage per second for 3.0 seconds. Works on structures.
LEVEL 2 Red Dragon - Splash Attack: attacks damage all enemy units in a 350 radius for 75% damage, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.
LEVEL 3 Blue Dragon - Frost Breath: slows movement speed by 0% and attack speed by 0 of enemy units in Splash Attack range for 0 seconds, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.
tooltips.shard_description: Grants Elder Dragon Form the Fireball ability.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases the level of Dragon Knight's ultimate. Adds a 4th level, Black Dragon. Black Dragon has bonus Corrosive Damage, Splash Damage and Slow amount, 25% increased Magic Resistance and free pathing.
tooltips.Lore: The dormant dragon power springs forth from within Davion, combining the powers of a legendary knight with a legendary Eldwurm.
tooltips.Note0: Corrosive Breath poison damage is lethal.
tooltips.Note1: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Dragon Knight was in when the item was used.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard: Grants Fireball.

talent_6.name: +85% Breathe Fire Damage/Cast Range in Dragon Form

talent_8.name: +400 AoE Dragon Tail During Elder Dragon Form

npc_dota_hero_dazzle.Name: Dazzle
npc_dota_hero_dazzle.Short: Powerful healer who can briefly prevent death

tooltips.Description: Releases a cone of poison that strikes multiple enemy units. Deals damage over time and slows the targets. Anytime the targets get attacked by Dazzle, the debuff duration is refreshed and slow is increased.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Poison Touch to hex affected targets for +1.6 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
tooltips.Note0: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.
tooltips.Note1: Units afflicted by Poison Touch can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.

tooltips.Description: An ally blessed with Shallow Grave, no matter how close to death, cannot die while under its protection. Healing on that ally is also amplified for the duration based on the hero's HP.
tooltips.Lore: Only a seasoned acolyte of the Shadow can properly perform the rite of preventing death.
tooltips.Note0: HP cannot go below 1 while under the effects of Shallow Grave, but Axe's Culling Blade will still kill the hero.

tooltips.Description: Sends out a bolt of power that arcs between allies, healing them while damaging any enemy units standing nearby.  Dazzle is always healed by Shadow Wave.
tooltips.Lore: While it is a simplistic and routine rite among Shadow Priests, the Shadow Wave is also the most critical for success.
tooltips.Note0: Prioritizes allied heroes over creeps.
tooltips.Note1: If enemies are near multiple allied units affected by Shadow Wave, they will take multiple instances of damage.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Shadow Wave can now target and bounce between enemies in addition to allies. When bouncing to an enemy, they will take damage and heal nearby allies equal to %scepter_heal_pct%% of the normal healing and damage values. Dazzle will also perform an attack against any enemy that Shadow Wave bounces to.
tooltips.scepter_description: Shadow Wave can now target and bounce between enemies in addition to allies. When bouncing to an enemy, they will take damage and heal nearby allies equal to 150% of the normal healing and damage values. Dazzle will also perform an attack against any enemy that Shadow Wave bounces to.

tooltips.Description: Whenever a Unit is affected by Dazzle's spells they temporarily gain/lose armor.\n  The spell can be activated by spending health to decrease the remaining cooldown of all other abilities. Casting Bad Juju temporarily increases its health cost.
tooltips.Lore: Each invocation of the Nothl realm helps it further permeate the surroundings of our own.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Bad Juju also reduces item cooldowns.
tooltips.scepter_description: Bad Juju also reduces item cooldowns.

npc_dota_hero_rattletrap.Name: Clockwerk
npc_dota_hero_rattletrap.Short: Launches himself into enemies with his hookshot

tooltips.Description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun. Deals double damage to creeps.
tooltips.Lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
tooltips.Note0: Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled.

tooltips.Description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near. Allies in the cogs when they are created receive a magic damage barrier. Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Damage is increased by 50% of the mana burned.\n\nOnce a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
tooltips.Lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.
tooltips.Note0: Cogs can shock invisible units.

tooltips.Description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area. Upon impact, enemies in the area take damage and are briefly slowed. Rocket flare provides vision over the impact area for 6.0 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.

tooltips.Description: Supercharges Clockwerks abilities: Battery Assault affects all enemies in its range; Clockwerk's attack speed in Power Cogs is increased; Rocket Flares have a reduced cooldown and fire additional rockets to either side of the target; Hookshot stun radius and duration is increased; Jetpack moves faster. Clockwerk's movement and attack speed becomes slowed to a crawl after the duration runs out.
tooltips.Lore: Rattletrap understands the limitations of his armor. Just as he understands the risks of pushing past them in times of need.

tooltips.Description: Clockwerk activates a jetpack, gaining flying movement, flying vision, and bonus movement speed. Clockwerk has a severely-limited turn rate during this time and cannot attack. Jetpack is cancelled upon casting Hookshot.

Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location.  If the hook hits a unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage to everyone in a 175 radius around the hit target.  Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are damaged and stunned.
tooltips.Lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.
tooltips.Note0: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them.

npc_dota_hero_leshrac.Name: Leshrac
npc_dota_hero_leshrac.Short: Can deal heavy damage in an aura around himself

tooltips.Description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Split Earth to repeat in the same location 3 additional times, with a 5 second delay between each one. Each time the radius increases by 45. Split Earth echo location is visible to both teams.
tooltips.Lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.
tooltips.Note0: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect.
tooltips.Note1: There is a %delay% second delay before the effect is applied.

tooltips.Description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal pure damage to enemy units and structures.  The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take. Lasts 10 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.
tooltips.Note0: The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed.
tooltips.Note2: Can damage buildings, Spell Immune units, and invisible units.

tooltips.Description: Summons a lightning storm that blasts the target enemy unit, then strikes any nearby enemy units. Struck enemies have their move speed and attack speed slowed.
tooltips.Lore: The Tormented Soul's mastery of the elements is evident in the massive storms that strike down armies before him.

tooltips.Description: Causes Leshrac and all nearby enemies to turn ethereal, preventing them from attacking, slowing them, and making them take more magic damage. Increases Leshrac's speed rather than reducing it. Does not cause Leshrac to take amplified damage.
Creates waves of damaging energy around Leshrac, one per second, to damage nearby enemy units. Drains Leshrac's mana with each pulse.
tooltips.Lore: If necessary, the Tormented Soul can manipulate space time itself, ravaging lesser beings.

npc_dota_hero_furion.Name: Nature's Prophet
npc_dota_hero_furion.Short: Able to teleport to any location on the map at will

tooltips.Description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, damaging and trapping it in place and providing vision in a 250 radius.
tooltips.Lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.
tooltips.Note0: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground.
tooltips.Note1: Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.
tooltips.Note2: A Tango that consumes a tree created by Sprout provides the standard healing effects.

tooltips.Description: Teleports to any point on the map. After teleporting, Nature's Prophet gains stacks of bonus attack damage. Every attack consumes a stack of bonus damage to increase Nature Prophet's armor.
tooltips.Lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
tooltips.Note0: Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting.
tooltips.Note1: When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

tooltips.Description: Converts an area of trees into Treants under the command of Nature's Prophet.
tooltips.Lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
tooltips.Note0: Nature's Call can only create as many treants as there are trees in the target area.

tooltips.Lore: Though powerful, Nature's Prophet's gifts do not include all-sight, and he must rely heavily upon reconnaissance and aid from a long-standing network of stalwart friends.
tooltips.Description: Applies a curse on all enemy heroes within 1200 range, displaying them in fog, slowing them, and causing damage over time based on the number of trees within 250 radius. Treants count as trees for this purpose.
Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.
tooltips.scepter_description: Lowers cooldown by -25s. Entangles all enemies it hits. Duration scales from 2s up to 3.8s seconds at max bounce.
tooltips.Lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
tooltips.Note0: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision.
tooltips.Note1: Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

npc_dota_hero_life_stealer.Name: Lifestealer
npc_dota_hero_life_stealer.Short: Infests other units for mobility and strength

tooltips.Description: Launch into a maddened rage, becoming Debuff Immune, increasing magic resistance by 80%, and gaining increased movement speed.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: The madness and brutality of N'aix makes him a vicious and unrelenting foe in combat.
tooltips.Note0: Upon casting, many buffs and debuffs will be removed.

tooltips.Description: Lifestealer's attacks deal damage and provide heal for a percentage of his target's max health.
tooltips.Lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect Roshan.
tooltips.Note1: The heal is independent of the damage.
tooltips.Note2: Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

tooltips.Description: Passively causes Lifestealer's attacks to significantly slow enemy movement speed for 1.5 seconds. Grants you Attack Speed.

Lifestealer rends an enemy unit, slowing the victim's movement speed and allowing all allies to regain health for a percentage of the damage they deal to that unit. All damage dealt will steal life, including damage from spells. The victim recovers movement speed over the duration. Deals 2% of the target's max health per attack on the target from real heroes. After receiving 500 damage, the Open Wounds fester and spread to a non-infected random enemy within 700 radius.
tooltips.Lore: Fresh wounds and the scent of blood often draw out the scavengers to finish the job.
tooltips.Note0: Open Wounds slows over 8 different steps: 50% / 50% / 40% / 30% / 20% / 10% / 10% / 10%, with the slow decreasing one step per second.
tooltips.Note1: Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

tooltips.Lore: With this infestation, N'aix consumes the life blood of the host, restoring him back to full unholy power.
tooltips.Description: Lifestealer infests the body of a target unit, becoming undetectable, and healing for a portion of his max hitpoints every second while inside. He can then explode from the host body, dealing damage to nearby enemies. If the infested unit is an enemy creep or a neutral creep, he can take control of the unit's ability to move and attack. Does not work on enemy heroes.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Note0: Lifestealer gains experience while under the effects of Infest.
tooltips.Note1: Creeps that are controlled while Infested gain Infest's movement speed bonus.
tooltips.Note2: Infest Level 2 and 3 can be used on Ancient creeps.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases cast range and reduces cooldown to =20s.  Infest may target enemy heroes for a short duration, disarming them and attacking them from the inside while increasing Lifestealer's regeneration rate.

npc_dota_hero_dark_seer.Name: Dark Seer
npc_dota_hero_dark_seer.Short: Pulls and manipulates his enemies' positions

tooltips.Description: Dark Seer creates a vacuum over the target area that sucks in enemy units, disrupting them and dealing damage.
tooltips.Lore: Ish'Kafel modifies the center of gravity to a place of his choosing.
tooltips.Note0: This ability interrupts channeling.
tooltips.Note1: Pulls units over %duration% seconds before dealing damage.
tooltips.Note2: Trees near the center of the vacuum will be destroyed.

tooltips.Description: Surrounds the target unit with a bristling shield that damages enemy units in an area around it.
tooltips.shard_description: When Ion Shell is cast on an enemy, it slows them for %enemy_target_slow%%, the radius is increased by %enemy_target_bonus_radius% and Ion Shell's cooldown is reduced by %enemy_target_cooldown_reduction%s. The enemy is also pulled at a rate of %pull_strength% units toward any other unit affected by Ion Shell.
tooltips.Lore: The Dark Seer slices holes into the 'Land Behind the Wall,' causing prismatic energy to seep forth.
tooltips.Note0: Deals small amounts of damage in %tick_interval% second intervals.
tooltips.Note1: Doesn't damage the target it is cast on.
tooltips.Note2: If cast on a unit that already has Ion Shell, the new Shell replaces the old one.

tooltips.Description: Charges a target friendly unit with power, giving it a brief burst of phased movement speed. Allows the unit to reach maximum movement speed and cannot be slowed.
tooltips.shard_Description: Surged units leave behind a %trail_radius% radius trail that lasts %trail_duration%s, slows enemies around it by %trail_move_slow%% and deals %trail_damage% damage per second in %trail_damage_interval%s intervals. Can be put on alt-cast to disable the trail.
tooltips.Lore: Ish'Kafel once used his speed of mind to navigate the maze between the walls.
tooltips.Note0: Units with Surge cannot be slowed unless the Surge effect is removed.
tooltips.shard_description: Surged units leave behind a +150 radius trail that lasts 7s, slows enemies around it by -50% and deals 35 damage per second in 0.5s intervals. Can be put on alt-cast to disable the trail.

tooltips.Description: Passive ability. Causes Dark Seer's next attack on a hero to have True Strike, knock a replica out of the victim, damaging and stunning them based on how far Dark Seer has moved in the past 3.0 seconds. Max power is reached after 1100 distance moved.

Raises a wall of warping light that slows, damages, and creates replicas of any enemy hero who crosses it. Enemy replicas serve at the Dark Seer's will. Replicas last until they are destroyed, or until the wall's duration ends.
tooltips.Lore: The Dark Seer, while unable to return to his natural realm, can channel part of the prismatic wall with powerful strength of mind, sowing confusion amongst enemy ranks.
tooltips.Note0: Doesn't create illusions from other illusions.
tooltips.Note1: There cannot be more than one illusion per player per wall.
tooltips.Note2: Wall of Replica will not slow spell-immune enemies.

npc_dota_hero_clinkz.Name: Clinkz
npc_dota_hero_clinkz.Short: Stalks invisibly to ambush lone enemies

tooltips.Description: Clinkz gains attack speed and has bonus attack range. Any current Burning Skeleton Archers skeletons within a 1200 radius of Clinkz also gain bonus attack range and 50% of the attack speed bonus. \n\n Casting Strafe does not break Skeleton Walk invisibility.

Clinkz throws a projectile filled with tar at the target enemy, dealing Magic damage on impact. After impact, the tar spills onto the ground and stays there for 5 seconds. Any enemy that walks across it gets slowed, and attacks from Clinkz or his Burning Army Skeleton Archers will deal bonus physical damage.\n\n When the Tar Bomb hits, any Burning Army skeletons within attack range will attack the target.

Clinkz consumes the target enemy creep or friendly skeleton and creates a Burning Skeleton Archer in their place, healing and gaining max health. Does not take Clinkz out of Skeleton Walk. 

Archers are immobile and die within several attacks from a hero. Skeletons deal a percentage of Clinkz' damage. Attack range is equal to Clinkz's attack range. Only one archer can be summoned from Death Pact at a time.

 Skeletons deal 25% less damage to buildings
tooltips.scepter_Description: Increases Skeleton Archer Hits to Kill.
tooltips.Lore: Sutherex' bond of life and death has become a part of Clinkz, and his old bones are refreshed with repetition of the pact on lesser beings.
tooltips.Note0: If the target is an enemy, Clinkz will gain the correct experience and gold.
tooltips.Note1: Increases Clinkz' current and max HP.
tooltips.Note2: When the duration ends, max HP returns to normal, but current HP stays the same.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Scepter: Access Burning Army by toggling auto-cast on Death Pact.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases Skeleton Archer Hits to Kill.

tooltips.Description: Summons a row of Burning Skeleton Archers in the target location.
tooltips.Lore: Existing on the brink of life and death, Clinkz has learned to temporarily bridge the gap between the two.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Searing Arrows must be drafted for skeleton archers to have the extra damage.

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Clinkz channels and shoots multiple piercing arrows in the target direction that hit all enemy units dealing a percentage of Clinkz' attack damage and applying attack modifiers, and dousing enemies with Tar Bomb slow.
tooltips.Lore: It's hard to say whether the blur around the Bone Fletcher is from his flaming heart or his speed with the quiver.
tooltips.Note0: Bonus Attack Range increases the length of Burning Barrage.

tooltips.Description: Clinkz moves invisibly through units until the moment he attacks or uses items. Leaving Skeleton Walk creates Burning Skeleton Archers
tooltips.Lore: With a burst of fire and puff of smoke, the Bone Fletcher was nowhere to be seen.
tooltips.Note0: Has a fadetime of %fade_time% seconds.

npc_dota_hero_omniknight.Name: Omniknight
npc_dota_hero_omniknight.Short: Tanky frontliner who protects and heals his allies

tooltips.Description: Instantly heals a friendly unit and damages all nearby enemy units.
tooltips.Lore: Priests of the Omniscience are adept at removing impurities from fellow warriors.

tooltips.Description: Grants Debuff Immunity to the target, as well as bonus Strength and HP Regen based on the amount of Debuffs on them.
tooltips.Lore: The All Seeing One casts down his protection over those that Purist calls friend.

tooltips.Description: Omniknight fires his hammer to a target to deal pure damage based on a percentage of his base damage and slows the target.
tooltips.shard_description: Omniknight is healed for %bonus_heal_pct%% of the damage dealt by Hammer of Purity. Every %bonus_attack_cooldown% seconds, his next attack will fire a Hammer of Purity at the target.

tooltips.Description: Omniknight calls upon a Guardian Angel that grants a target ally immunity from physical damage.
tooltips.Lore: The All Seeing One casts down his protection over those that Purist calls friend.
tooltips.scepter_description: Grants one extra charge and global cast range. Always casts a Guardian Angel on self as well as the selected target

npc_dota_hero_enchantress.Name: Enchantress
npc_dota_hero_enchantress.Short: Enchants neutral creeps to do her bidding

tooltips.Description: Places an enchantment on each attack while activated, causing it to deal additional damage based on how far away the target is.  The farther the target, the greater the damage dealt. Deals double damage to creeps and illusions.
tooltips.Lore: While Aiushtha favors peaceful means, she is capable of a magical onslaught from a distance, her spears gaining energy from the natural life around her.
tooltips.Note0: The damage is capped at %distance_cap% distance.
tooltips.Note1: Distance to target is measured when the projectile hits.

tooltips.Description:
Enchantress charms an enemy. If the enemy is a hero, they are slowed and damaged for 5s.

 If the enemy is a creep, she brings it under her control, increasing its attack damage and max health. Enchantress can control up to 1 creeps at a time for up to 30s. 

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Enchantress can control multiple creeps at a time.
tooltips.Lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
tooltips.Note0: Illusions can be converted.

tooltips.Description: A cloud of wisps heals Enchantress and any friendly units nearby. Lasts 9 seconds.
tooltips.shard_description: Adds %shard_permanent_wisp_count% permanent Nature's Attendants that follow Enchantress around.
tooltips.Lore: Whimsical spirits of the woods possess a healing power that is quite subtle, but gains strength in numbers.
tooltips.Note0: Units with full HP will not be selected for the heal.

tooltips.Description: Leaps backward, dodges incoming projectiles, and launches an Impetus attack on the 2 furthest enemy units within Enchantress' attack range + 100.
tooltips.Lore: Sproink is as Sproink does.

tooltips.Description: Enchantress roots an enemy unit. All creeps, ally, enemy and neutral within a radius will gain bonus movement and attack speed and attack the chosen target for 6 seconds.
Enchantress beguiles her enemies, slowing their attacks when she is attacked.
tooltips.Lore: After attacking Aiushtha, most opponents are overwhelmed with guilt having attacked such a natural beauty.
tooltips.Note0: All units who directly attack Enchantress will get slowed.
tooltips.Note1: The slow is applied on the attacking unit when the attack starts, not when damage is applied.

npc_dota_hero_huskar.Name: Huskar
npc_dota_hero_huskar.Short: Sacrifices his health to deal more damage

tooltips.Description: In a fiery rage, knocks all nearby enemies away from you to a fixed distance, dealing damage and disarming them.
tooltips.shard_description: Lowers Inner Fire cooldown and causes it to apply a movement speed slow and heal Huskar for a percentage of the damage dealt to enemies.
tooltips.Lore: Not even Huskar's own flesh can contain the unending expansion of his life force.

tooltips.Description: Huskar sets his spears aflame, dealing damage over time with his regular attack.  Multiple attacks will stack additional damage.  Each attack drains some of Huskar's health.
tooltips.Lore: The Sacred Warrior ignites his weaponry after marking it with his own blood - causing far greater pain than he himself feels.
tooltips.Note0: Burning Spear stacks additively when used multiple times on one target.  There is no cap.
tooltips.Note1: Huskar cannot kill himself with this skill.

tooltips.Description: Huskar's injuries feed his power, giving increased attack speed, magic resistance and health regen based on missing health. Health regen is a percentage of your strength.
tooltips.Lore: After losing his birthright, Huskar gained a lethality in physical combat that is only heightened as his own blood is spilled.
tooltips.Note0: Bonuses are provided linearly, no bonus at Full HP and full bonus at strictly less than 10% HP.

tooltips.Description: Huskar draws upon his health to break an enemy's life, leaping at a target to shatter a percentage of that hero's current health and slow both their movement and attack speed.  While leaping, Huskar is Debuff Immune and has 50% increases magic resistance.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Forces the enemy target to attack Huskar and increases cast range.
tooltips.Lore: No matter the danger, Huskar thrusts himself into melees that only he can survive.
tooltips.Note0: If Huskar is disabled during the charge or the target moves more than 1400 units in 0.015 seconds, the charge stops.
tooltips.Note1: Slow works on Spell Immune units.
tooltips.Note2: Life Break cannot be disjointed.

npc_dota_hero_night_stalker.Name: Night Stalker
npc_dota_hero_night_stalker.Short: Enpowered by the shadows of nightfall

tooltips.Description: Creates a damaging void that slows an enemy unit and deals damage. At night, Void also mini-stuns, interrupting channeling abilities, and the slowing effect lasts longer.
tooltips.scepter_description: Void becomes an area of effect ability. Increases the mini-stun duration and leaves behind a void zone. While in the zone, all of Night Stalker's abilities are empowered with their night time effect.
tooltips.Lore: Balanar creates a vortex of infinite night, tearing opponents violently into the eternal darkness that once was.
tooltips.Note0: Void does not ministun enemies during the day.

tooltips.Description: Night Stalker horrifies all nearby enemies, causing them to become silenced and take damage over time while near him.  The effect lasts longer at night.
tooltips.Lore: A vision of the twisted maw of Balanar etches itself into the minds of the poor souls unlucky enough to cross his path.

tooltips.Description: Night Stalker is in his element at night, attacking and moving with great swiftness.
tooltips.shard_description: Hunter in the Night may be cast on a creep, instantly killing it and restoring some of Night Stalker's maximum health and mana. Cannot target ancients during the daytime.
tooltips.Lore: The hunting prowess of Balanar improves as the night beckons.

tooltips.Description: Night Stalker smothers the sun and summons instant darkness, so that he might use his powers at their fullest. Refreshes the cooldown of all non-ultimate abilities when cast. Night Stalker gains flight and bonus damage during this time. Has unobstructed vision.
tooltips.Lore: It is a humbling sight to see when the mightiest of warriors become afraid of the dark.

talent_4.name: +25% Hunter in the Night Status Resistance

talent_7.name: +100 Hunter In The Night Attack Speed

npc_dota_hero_broodmother.Name: Broodmother
npc_dota_hero_broodmother.Short: Hunts with her army of spiderlings

tooltips.Description: A violent lust for vital fluids increases Broodmother's attack damage and gives her a vampiric attack. Lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 40%.
tooltips.shard_Description: Increases duration. While Hunger is active, the bonus damage is increased by %shard_damage_per_tick%% every %shard_damage_tick_interval%s.
tooltips.Lore: While most of her prey is wrapped in silken cocoons and saved for her young, the Broodmother herself has a taste for wandering heroes.
tooltips.Note0: Fully stacks with other sources of lifesteal.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases duration. While Hunger is active, the bonus damage is increased by +4% every 1s.

tooltips.Description: Spins a large web that grants Broodmother a passive movement speed increase, increases her Turn Rate, and boosts regeneration while in its vicinity, as well as giving free movement. Spin Web charges restore every %abilitychargerestoretime% seconds, with a max of %AbilityCharges% charges. Spin Web can be cast from anywhere as long as the new web touches an existing web. Webs never expire, and can be manually destroyed. When the maximum limit of webs is exceeded, the oldest web disappears. The movement bonus is proportional to the unit's HP
tooltips.Lore: Weaving a bed of silken fibers, Arachnia's web both protects her and her offspring, as well as giving advancing opponents a sense of foreboding.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases movement speed, and increases Spin Web max count
tooltips.Note0: Also affects Spiderling and Spiderites.
tooltips.Note1: Grants full movement speed bonus at 100% HP, 0% movement speed bonus at 1HP

tooltips.Description: Deals impact damage, then slows the target and causes them to miss some attacks. Units that attack the target deal bonus magic damage.
tooltips.shard_description: Silken Bola becomes an area of effect spell and increases miss chance.

tooltips.Lore: The slightest tremor of her web is all Arachnia needs to find her prey.
tooltips.description: Broodmother may create up to %count% invisible web lines touching any existing web. Enemy Heroes that cross the web line will spring the trap, becoming rooted, revealed in fog, and take damage over time.  Multiple Heroes can trip on the same line until it's destroyed after being initially triggered.  Broodmother's team is alerted via the minimap when an enemy has triggered the snare.
tooltips.Description: Broodmother may create up to 5 invisible web lines touching any existing web. Enemy Heroes that cross the web line will spring the trap, becoming rooted, revealed in fog, and take damage over time.  Multiple Heroes can trip on the same line until it's destroyed after being initially triggered.  Broodmother's team is alerted via the minimap when an enemy has triggered the snare.
Broodmother injects her young into an enemy unit, dealing damage. The spiderlings will hatch if the target is killed while under this influence.
tooltips.Lore: Black Arachnia continues to raise her young, even amidst the field of combat.  The brood quickly learns how to support their mother.
tooltips.Note0: If the target is killed within %buff_duration% seconds of being hit with this skill, the Spiderlings will spawn.
tooltips.Note1: Units killed by Spiderlings will then give birth to Spiderites, smaller and less powerful versions of the Spiderlings.

npc_dota_hero_bounty_hunter.Name: Bounty Hunter
npc_dota_hero_bounty_hunter.Short: Loots and collects bounties off of his enemies

tooltips.Description: Hurls a deadly shuriken at an enemy unit, dealing damage and briefly slowing the target.  The shuriken will bounce to any Tracked units who are within a 1200 radius of each other.  Deals bonus damage to Tracked targets.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases cast range and applies Jinada on hit.
tooltips.Lore: While the shuriken may be small, Gondar's precise aim can cause critical damage.

tooltips.Description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, dealing bonus damage and stealing some unreliable gold.
tooltips.Lore: Gondar's vast experience ensures he never walks away from a transaction empty-handed.

tooltips.Description: Bounty Hunter becomes invisible and gains the ability to move through other units until he attacks or uses an ability.  If he breaks the invisibility with an attack, that attack will stun the target for a short duration.
tooltips.Lore: The court jesters present during King Goff's assassination can recount no other image than a dancing shadow.
tooltips.Note0: Will not break most channeling of spells upon activation.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard: Access Friendly Shadow by toggling auto-cast on Shadow Walk.
tooltips.ally_Description: Applies Shadow Walk and all of it's bonuses to the target ally. Allied fade time is %fade_time%s. Does not break Bounty Hunter's invisibility when cast.

tooltips.Description: Applies Shadow Walk and all of it's bonuses to the target ally. Allied fade time is 1.0s. Does not break Bounty Hunter's invisibility when cast.

Tracks an enemy hero, granting True Sight of the target, and information on how much gold it is carrying. Bounty Hunter moves fast when near the tracked unit and deals critical strikes when attacking it. If the target dies, Bounty Hunter and nearby heroes collect a bonus bounty of gold. Casting Track does not take you out of invisibility.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows Track to be ground targeted, creating a Bear Trap. After 3 seconds, the trap becomes invisible and active. Walking over the trap applies Track. Traps have 400 vision. Max Traps: 8. Ground targeting with Track has bonus 1200 range.
tooltips.Lore: Using his elevated senses of sight and smell, Gondar's hits have quite a good chance of success.
tooltips.Note0: Bounty Hunter will get the bonus gold if the target dies while Track is active, regardless of how it died.
tooltips.Note1: Track's effect is only visible to allies.
tooltips.Note2: You can see the amount of gold the target is carrying by mousing over the debuff icon above the target's ability bar.
tooltips.Note3: Bonus gold is reliable gold.

npc_dota_hero_weaver.Name: Weaver
npc_dota_hero_weaver.Short: Rewinds time to reverse damage and position

tooltips.Description: Weaver launches a swarm of 12 young Weavers that latch on any enemy unit in their path, attacking and reducing armor until it is killed.
tooltips.Lore: Skitskurr opens a gap in the space time fabric, allowing young Weavers to slip through and aid him in combat.
tooltips.Note0: When a beetle latches on a target, it will remain there until it is killed or the duration expires.
tooltips.Note1: Beetles are Spell Immune, but can be killed in %destroy_attacks% attacks from a unit. Heroes deal double damage to beetles.
tooltips.Note2: Beetles provide vision.
tooltips.shard_description: Reduces cooldown by 2 seconds, and causes The Swarm to latch onto and reveal invisible units.

tooltips.Description: Weaver shifts out of visibility, gaining max movement speed --doing harm to any enemies it passes through.
tooltips.shard_Description: Shukuchi puts a mark on enemies it damages that last %geminate_attack_mark_duration% seconds. %shukuchi_attack_delay%s after Weaver exits Shukuchi, enemies with a mark within %shukuchi_attack_mark_radius% range will also be attacked with a secondary Geminate attack
tooltips.Lore: As the Weavers worked in the fabric of creation, small wormholes allowed them to slip through time to better work their craft.
tooltips.Note0: Can only damage the same unit once per cast.
tooltips.shard_description: Shukuchi puts a mark on enemies it damages that last +4.6 seconds. +0.2s after Weaver exits Shukuchi, enemies with a mark within +1200 range will also be attacked with a secondary Geminate attack

tooltips.Description: Allows Weaver to dispatch two attacks at once.
tooltips.Lore: Skitskurr's relationship with time is somewhat variable, causing his actions to be witnessed - and felt - more than once.
tooltips.Note0: Additional attacks leave Weaver 0.25 seconds after the previous one, and have no range limit.
tooltips.shard_description: Geminate Attack will also hit units within 1200 range of the original target that have The Swarm beetles attached to them.

tooltips.Description: Weaver warps backward to whatever position it was in five seconds earlier--regaining the HP and mana from that time. No effect on cooldown, gold or experience.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.Lore: If Skitskurr does not deem the current reality of the world to fit his desires, he simply crawls back in time to right what was wronged.
tooltips.Note0: Removes most negative buffs from Weaver.
tooltips.Note1: Time Lapse disjoints projectiles.
tooltips.scepter_description: Time Lapse may target allied Heroes with 500 cast range.

npc_dota_hero_jakiro.Name: Jakiro
npc_dota_hero_jakiro.Short: Freezes and burns enemies with magic

tooltips.Description: An icy blast followed by a wave of fire launches out in a path in front of Jakiro. The ice slows enemies, while the fire delivers damage over time.
tooltips.Lore: Pyrexae dragons have tremendously dangerous breath for each branch of the species; combining them is unimaginable.
tooltips.Note0: Can hit units up to 1025 range away.
tooltips.Note1: Has a %fire_delay% second interval between each breath.

tooltips.Description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
tooltips.Lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.
tooltips.Note0: It takes %path_delay% seconds for the path to reach its full extent.
tooltips.Note1: The stun is removed once Ice Path is destroyed.

tooltips.Description: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
tooltips.Lore: The left maw of Jakiro opens, laying waste to any in its path.
tooltips.Note0: Works on both units and buildings.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard does NOT grant Liquid Frost ability.

tooltips.Description: Jakiro adds a frost effect to his attack. Enemies hit are slowed for 4.0 seconds and are damaged for a percent of their max health plus a base amount every 1 second for %duration% seconds.
Jakiro exhales a wide line of lasting flames, which deals damage per second to any enemy units caught in the fire.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases Macropyre duration, width and causes it to deal Pure damage. Jakiro emits two walls of ice along the edges of the Macropyre that slow any enemies trying to cross them by 60%.
tooltips.Lore: Ice and fire combine to rip the battlefield to shreds with extreme temperatures.
tooltips.Note0: Units hit by Macropyre will continue to be affected after they leave the area for %linger_duration% additional seconds.

npc_dota_hero_batrider.Name: Batrider
npc_dota_hero_batrider.Short: Can lasso an enemy away from his team

tooltips.Description: Drenches an area in sticky oil, amplifying damage from Batrider's attacks and abilities and slowing the movement speed and turn rate of enemies in the area.  Additional casts of Sticky Napalm continue to increase damage, up to 10 stacks. Applies a small amount of damage with each cast.
tooltips.Lore: It's not uncommon to hear the Rider cackle while he increases the flammability of his opponents.
tooltips.Note0: All damage from Batrider gets amplified, except for Radiance, Orb of Venom, Urn of Shadows, and Spirit Vessel.
tooltips.Note1: Sticky Napalm does not require turning to cast.
tooltips.Note2: Sticky Napalm deals %creep_damage_pct%% damage to creeps.
tooltips.shard_description: Flaming Lasso no longer disarms you. Every other attack applies a stack of Sticky Napalm.

tooltips.Description: Hurls an explosive cocktail that explodes when it reaches the target location, knocking back, slowing and dealing damage over time to enemies in the area.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Flamebreak to have two charges and apply a Sticky Napalm charge on impact.
tooltips.Lore: A molotov cocktail is the weapon of choice for Batrider.

tooltips.Description: Batrider takes to the skies, laying down a trail of flames from the air.  The fire damages any enemies it touches, and destroys trees below Batrider.
tooltips.Lore: When an enemy escapes into the Yama Raskav Jungle, most would cut through the brush to find the fugitive.  Batrider just chooses to destroy the jungle along with his foes.
tooltips.Note0: During this the Batrider can fly above units, trees and impassable terrain.
tooltips.Note1: If duration ends when above impassable terrain, the Batrider can get stuck.
tooltips.Note2: The trail persists through Batrider's death.

tooltips.Description: Lassoes an enemy and drags them in Batrider's wake. Dragged units cannot move, attack, or use abilities.  Teleporting or blinking will break the lasso.
tooltips.scepter_description: Flaming Lasso grabs both its target, as well as the target's nearest allied hero within +650 units. The secondary target is tethered to the first.
tooltips.Lore: Few dare to ask to ride on the bat, as Batrider gives them free of charge.
tooltips.Note0: Killing the target or the Batrider will break the lasso before its expiration.
tooltips.Note1: If Batrider moves more than 425 units in 0.05 seconds the lasso breaks.
tooltips.Note2: Batrider cannot attack while using Flaming Lasso.

npc_dota_hero_chen.Name: Chen
npc_dota_hero_chen.Short: Converts creeps to his cause, building an army

tooltips.Description: Forces an enemy unit to move slower and for allies to attack it more quickly. Chen can attack the Penitence target with bonus attack range.
tooltips.Lore: Although Chen's brand of animal enthrallment isn't quite strong enough to control the minds of enemy heroes, it still tests their resolve in combat.

tooltips.Description: Chen takes control of an enemy or neutral creep and receives gold equal to its bounty. If the persuaded creep's base health is naturally below the health minimum, its base health will be raised to the health minimum. Converted creeps will have increased movement speed and bonus damage.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows Holy Persuasion to target Ancient creeps. Can control up to 1/2/3 Ancient creeps based on Hand of God's level. Additionally levels up some abilities of creeps by 1 level.
tooltips.scepter_description: Grants persuaded creeps Martyrdom ability. Sacrifice the life of this unit to heal an ally or damage an enemy with the current level of Hand of God.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Max number of Ancient creeps controllable equal to level of ultimate.
tooltips.Lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
tooltips.Note0: Persuading a new creep above max unit count causes the oldest persuaded creep to die.
tooltips.Note1: Can target Ancient creeps when Chen has Aghanim's Shard.
tooltips.Note2: The health of creeps already under Chen's control does not update to the new level upon leveling Holy Persuasion further.
tooltips.Note3: Fully restores the creep's mana upon converting.

tooltips.Description: Passively provides an aura that grants increased health regeneration. Can be cast on allies to provide them with bonus armor and increasing the healing they receive.\n\nIf cast on Chen, all units controlled by Chen will be teleported to him. Taking damage from enemy heroes or their units will cancel the teleport.
tooltips.Lore: Chen's zeal is infectious, blessing his allies with vitality and compelling them to his side.

tooltips.Description: Heals all allied heroes on the map as well as all units under Chen's control. A large heal is applied at first and a slow heal over time is applied for 8 seconds afterwards.
tooltips.Lore: Using the mental link with his thralls, Chen calls down restoration and well-being to those who share his fanaticism.
tooltips.Note0: Can heal invulnerable and hidden/banished allies.

talent_7.name: Hand of God applies a Strong Dispel

talent_8.name: +200/+10 Hand of God Heal/Heal Over Time

npc_dota_hero_spectre.Name: Spectre
npc_dota_hero_spectre.Short: Haunts her enemies and teleports to her target

tooltips.Description: Spectre flings a dagger to draw a Shadow Path, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed of any enemies along the trail. Units hit by the dagger also trail a Shadow Path. While treading the path, Spectre phases through otherwise impassable terrain. Spectral Dagger applies an instance of Desolate to targets with no allied units within 400 radius of them.
tooltips.Lore: Mercurial's dagger eclipses the physical plane in shadow, a state in which mortals cower, but spectres thrive.
tooltips.Note0: There is a %dagger_grace_period% second grace period after leaving the path where no collision is preserved.

tooltips.Description: Deals bonus damage whenever Spectre attacks an enemy that does not have any allied units within a 400 radius around them.
tooltips.Lore: Often times, warriors find themselves alone with a vision of Mercurial - the fated question is if it is the true Spectre.
tooltips.Note0: Damage is dealt before Spectre's attack.
tooltips.Note1: Spectre's illusions also have Desolate.

tooltips.shard_description: Dispersion can be activated to increase damage dealt by reflection by +100% for +5s. Cooldown +25. Manacost +50.
tooltips.Description: Damage done to Spectre is reflected on her enemies, leaving her unharmed. The effect lessens with distance.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Haunt must also be drafted for Shard upgrade to work.
tooltips.Lore: A daunting task lies before enemies of Mercurial - killing a shadow with blade and magic.
tooltips.Note0: The reflected damage is not dealt to Spectre.
