tooltips.Note1: Illusions don't get this ability.
tooltips.Note2: Damage is reflected before reductions, and is returned as the same damage type.

tooltips.Description: Spectre exchanges places with a chosen Haunt and casts the current level of Spectral Dagger on the haunt's target.
tooltips.Lore: The scattered shadows unite into the one true Spectre.

tooltips.Description: Creates a spectral nemesis to attack each enemy hero. Illusions spawned from this ability follow the same rules as Shadow Step illusions and can also be swapped to by using Reality.
tooltips.Lore: At the height of combat, Mercurial's physical manifestation shatters, and the shadowy pieces haunt those who still cling to life.
tooltips.single_Description: Creates a spectral nemesis to haunt a single visible enemy hero. At any moment during the duration, Spectre can use Reality to exchange places with any haunting illusion.\n\nHaunt illusions are uncontrollable, take extra damage, and deal less damage than Spectre herself.  They ignore terrain.
tooltips.single_Lore: With great focus of will, Mercurial can sometimes limit the extent of her division.

tooltips.Description: Creates a spectral nemesis to haunt a single visible enemy hero. At any moment during the duration, Spectre can use Reality to exchange places with any haunting illusion.\n\nHaunt illusions are uncontrollable, take extra damage, and deal less damage than Spectre herself.  They ignore terrain.
tooltips.Lore: With great focus of will, Mercurial can sometimes limit the extent of her division.

npc_dota_hero_doom_bringer.Name: Doom
npc_dota_hero_doom_bringer.Short: Can prevent a single enemy from using abilties and items

tooltips.Description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed and gaining armor temporarily while it digests the creep. If alt-cast is deactivated, Doom will not acquire the creep's abilities. Duration is equal to the cooldown.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows Devour to be cast on enemy heroes, reducing their maximum health by 15%  for the duration of the devour and provides Doom with a passive basic ability they have.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Devour will only acquire the passive abilities that the creep possessed. If Rearm is drafted and cast, this ability's cooldown will not be reset.
tooltips.Lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.
tooltips.Note0: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold.
tooltips.Note1: If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.

tooltips.Description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames which damage enemies, while also granting him increased movement speed.
tooltips.shard_Description: Heals Doom and his controlled units for %heal_pct%% of the damage dealt.
tooltips.Lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.
tooltips.Note0: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location.
tooltips.shard_description: Heals Doom and his controlled units for +60% of the damage dealt.

tooltips.Description: Doom swings his burning sword, igniting the enemy. Stuns for 0.6 seconds and applies a 4.0 second burn that deals a base damage plus a percentage of the target's Max HP as damage per second.
tooltips.shard_description: Infernal Blade stun duration is increased. If the enemy's level is a multiple of 3, or above level 24, they will be stunned for a longer duration and take bonus damage.
tooltips.Lore: Lucifer shares the fire branding bestowed upon him at the time of his exile.
tooltips.Note0: Interrupts channeling abilities.

tooltips.Description: This slot will be replaced with abilities acquired using Devour.
This slot will be replaced with abilities acquired using Devour.
Inflicts a curse that dispels an enemy Hero and prevents them from casting spells or healing in any way, while taking damage over time.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Allies in a +300 radius around the doomed target also suffer the effects of Doom. Allows Doom to be self-cast to affect enemies around himself.
tooltips.Lore: When a name is tolled from the bell of Vashundol, doom is sure to follow.

talent_6.name: +2% Infernal Blade Max HP As Damage

npc_dota_hero_ancient_apparition.Name: Ancient Apparition
npc_dota_hero_ancient_apparition.Short: Launches a powerful icy blast from anywhere on the map

tooltips.Description: Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.
tooltips.Note0: Deals damage every half second.

tooltips.Description: Creates a vortex of icy energy that deals damage, slows and increases magic damage done to enemies in its range.
tooltips.Lore: Frozen, caustic winds are at the whim of Kaldr, chilling the field of battle.
tooltips.Note0: Provides vision in a small area where it is placed.

tooltips.Description: Enhances Ancient Apparition's attack with increased range, heavy magic damage, and movement slow.
tooltips.Lore: The Ancient Apparition's eternal knowledge brings a frigid enchantment to his attacks.
tooltips.scepter_description: Removes cooldown and reduces manacost by -50%%.

tooltips.Description: Launches a tracer toward any location on the battlefield, which must be triggered again to mark the area to be blasted by a damaging explosion of hail. The further the tracer travels, the larger the explosion will be. Enemies caught in the explosion, or who touch the icy ball of hail as it travels, are Frostbitten, taking damage and prevented from regenerating or healing. If a Frostbitten unit's health drops below a certain percentage, they will instantly shatter.
tooltips.shard_description: Freezes enemies hit with the current level of Cold Feet for +60% of the duration.
tooltips.Lore: Ice storms from ages past flow through Kaldr's frosty limbs, crashing into the world and turning its inhabitants into monuments to his eternal power.
tooltips.Note0: Upon cast, this ability is replaced by Release, used to stop the tracer on the target area.
tooltips.Note1: The area of effect is %radius_min% + %radius_grow%*TimeTraveled, capped at %radius_max%.  The freeze area along the path is %path_radius%.
tooltips.Note2: Kill will be granted to the source of the damage that triggers the shatter.
tooltips.Note3: The shatter effect doesn't work on illusions.
tooltips.Note4: The HP Freeze prevents most kinds of healing, including the fountain, except Sunder, Time Lapse and Supernova.
tooltips.release_Description: Releases the ice blast to explode at the tracer's current location.

npc_dota_hero_ursa.Name: Ursa
npc_dota_hero_ursa.Short: Deals more damage with every hit to the same foe

tooltips.Description: Ursa leaps forward 250 units and slams the earth, causing a powerful shock to damage and slow all enemy units in a nearby area for 4 seconds.
tooltips.shard_description: Earthshock applies a 1.5 second Enrage on Ursa when cast.
tooltips.Lore: The very steps of a male ursine shake the ground as well as the resolve of opposing warriors.
For a behemoth of his size, Ursa is deceptively nimble.
tooltips.Description: Using his skill in combat, Ursa gains increased attack speed and slow resistance for a number of subsequent attacks.
tooltips.Note0: Overpower isn't removed by Black King Bar.
tooltips.Note1: Missing an attack still consumes a charge of Overpower.

tooltips.Lore: In nature, the wounded rarely survive the attacks of hungry predators.
tooltips.Description: Ursa's claws dig deeper wounds in the enemy, causing consecutive attacks to the same enemy to deal more damage.  If the same target is not attacked after 8 seconds, the bonus damage is lost.

tooltips.Lore: Ulfsaar succumbs to his ancient spirit, becoming the most ferocious creature on the battlefield.
tooltips.Description: Ursa goes into a frenzy, providing damage reduction and status resistance. Removes any existing debuffs.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces cooldown and allows Ursa to use Enrage while disabled.

npc_dota_hero_spirit_breaker.Name: Spirit Breaker
npc_dota_hero_spirit_breaker.Short: Charges down enemies from anywhere on the map

tooltips.Lore: Barathrum erupts from the darkness with unwieldy force.
tooltips.Description: Spirit Breaker fixes his sight on an enemy unit and starts charging through all objects.  All enemy units passed through and the targeted unit will be hit by a Greater Bash.  If the targeted unit dies, Spirit Breaker will change his target to the nearest enemy unit to that location.
tooltips.Note0: Spirit Breaker passes through trees, cliffs, and units.
tooltips.Note1: The charge indicator is visible only to allies.
tooltips.Note2: Spirit Breaker gains shared vision of the target.
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces Charge of Darkness cooldown and makes it pierce debuff immunity.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: No other units will be hit by Greater Bash if it's not drafted as well. Target of Charge of Darkness will be stunned on impact even without Greater Bash.

tooltips.Description: Spirit Breaker gains movement speed and status resistance to ram through enemies. Can be used while charging.
tooltips.Lore: Barathrum warps the fabric of reality around him, lessening its influence on his physical form.
The signature strike of Barathrum's ghostly ball and chain.
tooltips.Description: Gives a chance to stun and knockback an enemy unit on an attack. Deals a percentage of movement speed as damage. Deals 1.3x damage to creeps.
tooltips.Note0: Does not stack with Skull Basher.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: In Ability Draft, does stack with Skull Basher.

tooltips.Lore: Barathrum's unyielding focus forms a pocket of planar convergence from which not even the most powerful arcane energies can escape.
tooltips.Description: Barathrum distorts the fabric of planar space, increasing his own magic resistance and redirecting the first targeted enemy hero spell in a radius towards him. Effect ends when the first spell is redirected.

tooltips.Lore: Barathrum temporarily returns to the realm from where he came, bringing with him the retribution of both worlds.
tooltips.Description: Spirit Breaker slips into the nether realm, reappearing next to his hapless victim. Upon reappearing, a Greater Bash of the current level occurs and deals bonus damage. Knocks back for double the normal distance.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Nether Strike to grant spell immunity, and deal extra damage and apply Break.
tooltips.Note0: Spirit Breaker appears behind the target to deliver the bash.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Greater Bash must be drafted for stun.  Bonus damage still applies without Greater Bash.

npc_dota_hero_gyrocopter.Name: Gyrocopter
npc_dota_hero_gyrocopter.Short: Barrages with his cannon and homing missiles

tooltips.Description: Launches a salvo of rockets at nearby enemy units in a radius around the Gyrocopter. Gyrocopter has increased resistance to slows during this time.  Lasts 3 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Aurel's new craft has an increased payload for rockets, enhancing their rapid-fire capabilities.
tooltips.Note0: Rocket Barrage can't hit units Gyrocopter has no vision over.

tooltips.Description: Fires a homing missile to seek the targeted enemy unit. The missile gains speed over time, dealing damage and stunning when it impacts the target. Enemy units can destroy the missile before it reaches its target.
tooltips.shard_description: Homing Missiles now constantly fires the current level of Rocket Barrage in a 700 area of effect after 1.0 second of being cast. This Rocket Barrage prioritizes the Homing Missile target.
tooltips.Lore: The biggest missile Aurel could possibly attach to his craft, The Bomb™ has carefully calculated aerodynamics and explosives for maximum impact.
tooltips.Note0: Towers do half damage to the missile.
tooltips.Note1: The crosshair effect is visible to allies only.
tooltips.Note2: The missile will follow and hit invisible units.

tooltips.Description: Gyrocopter's attacks hit all enemy units in an area around it for a limited number of attacks.  Only the main target of attacks will receive attack bonuses such as Critical Strike.  Lasts 12 seconds or until the attacks are used.
tooltips.scepter_description: Adds a Side Gunner that at random attacks enemy units near Gyrocopter. When Flak Cannon is active, side gunner attacks 2 units instead. Prioritizes furthest unit away within its range.
tooltips.Lore: This newly revamped Gyrocopter has attached enough armaments to assault in a 360 degree radius.
tooltips.Note0: Attack range for the primary attack is unchanged.

tooltips.Description: Call down 3 aerial missile strikes that slow and damage enemy units in a target area. Each strike is 500 distance from the previous one and is delayed by 1.0s
tooltips.Lore: 'Bombs Away!'
tooltips.Note0: The visual indicator is visible to allies only.

talent_8.name: -30s Call Down Cooldown and Global Range

npc_dota_hero_alchemist.Name: Alchemist
npc_dota_hero_alchemist.Short: Earns extra gold from unit kills and bounty runes

tooltips.Description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take damage per second and have their armor reduced.
tooltips.Lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.

tooltips.throw_Description: Throw it before it blows up!
tooltips.Lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.
tooltips.Description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. Alchemist is faster while charging the concoction. After 5.0 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
tooltips.Note0: While brewing, this ability is replaced by Unstable Concoction Throw.  Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing.
tooltips.Note1: A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. This timer is visible to enemies.
tooltips.Note2: You can deny yourself with this skill.
tooltips.Note3: Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed and once thrown Unstable Concoction stops brewing.
tooltips.Note4: Unstable Concoction explosion damages heroes and creeps.

tooltips.Description: Alchemist coats his weapons with an acid that applies a stacking slow and status resistance reduction to enemies hit. Slow and Status resistance increases when Alchemist is under the effect of Chemical Rage.
Alchemist throws a potion at an ally, applying a basic dispel and giving them attack speed, movement speed and HP regen.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

Alchemist synthesizes additional gold from his enemies and bounty runes. With each kill, Alchemist earns base bonus gold and extra bonus gold. If Alchemist kills another unit which yields gold within the next 36 seconds, an additional instance of Extra Bonus Gold is added to the total. Additionally, causes bounty runes to yield more gold.
tooltips.Lore: While it is not a mountain, Razzil has mastered the conversion of smaller compounds to line his pockets.

tooltips.Description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and health regeneration.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Alchemist melts down Aghanim's Scepter to grant an allied hero all Aghanim's Scepter upgrades. Alchemist will gain bonus damage and spell amplification for each gifted Scepter.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Greevil's Greed ability.
tooltips.Lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.
tooltips.Note0: Has a %transformation_time% second transformation time, which can be used to dodge projectiles and stuns.

talent_3.name: Acid Spray grants armor to allies

npc_dota_hero_invoker.Name: Invoker
npc_dota_hero_invoker.Short: Weaves magic with an array of spell combos

tooltips.Description: Allows manipulation of ice elements. Passively grants +1 Strength per level. Each Quas instance imbues Invoker's spells with Spell Lifesteal.
tooltips.Note0: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.
tooltips.Note1: Spell Lifesteal for the spell is calculated on cast. Changing orbs afterwards has no effect.

tooltips.Description: Allows manipulation of storm elements. Passively grants +1 Agility per level. Each Wex instance provides increased cooldown reduction and movement speed.
tooltips.Note0: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

tooltips.Description: Allows manipulation of fire elements. Passively grants +1 Intelligence per level. Each Exort instance imbues Invoker's spells with Spell Amplification.
tooltips.Note0: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.
tooltips.Note1: Spell Amplification for the spell is calculated on cast. Changing orbs afterwards has no effect.

tooltips.Description: Casting Invoke will replace this slot with one of ten unique spells based on Invoker's currently active Quas, Wex, and Exort buffs.
Casting Invoke will replace this slot with one of ten unique spells based on Invoker's currently active Quas, Wex, and Exort buffs.

Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated to create a new spell for Invoker to use. Invoke cooldown is reduced by 0.3 seconds for each orb level. \n\n Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.
tooltips.Lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
tooltips.Note0: The arrangement of instances does not matter.
tooltips.Note1: Invoke will not cost mana or go on cooldown if the only effect is to swap the positions of existing spells.

npc_dota_hero_silencer.Name: Silencer
npc_dota_hero_silencer.Short: Can silence all enemies on the map

tooltips.Lore: Nortrom's lack of incantations is less of a problem for him than it is for his adversaries.
tooltips.Description: Curses the target area, dealing damage and causing enemy heroes to take damage over time and slowing their movement speed. Silenced enemies take 1.5x slow and damage. Anytime affected enemies cast a spell, the duration is increased. The duration is paused as long as the target is silenced.
tooltips.Note0: Affects creeps.

tooltips.Lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.
tooltips.Description: Silencer enchants his glaives with his wisdom, dealing additional damage based on his Intelligence. Silencer temporarily steals his target's Intelligence with each hit. If Silencer kills an enemy hero, he permanently steals 2 Intelligence.
tooltips.Note0: To permanently steal Intelligence, Silencer doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within %permanent_int_steal_range% range of Silencer.
tooltips.Note1: The enemy does not need to have the Glaives of Wisdom debuff for Silencer to permanently steal Intelligence.
tooltips.shard_description: Every +4 attacks, Glaives silence the enemy hit for +1.75 seconds. Additionally, it increases the Intelligence stolen per attack by 2 and per kill to +2.

tooltips.Lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
tooltips.Description: Enchants a target, providing vision of them and causing them to be damaged and silenced if they cast a spell or if the enchantment timer expires. Deals extra damage based on the difference in intelligence between Silencer and the target.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Last Word to become an AoE ability.
tooltips.Note0: Channeling abilities will trigger this effect once the caster finishes its channel.

tooltips.Lore: With a shock to the ground, all magic and sound pauses, and Nortrom fulfills his prophecy.
tooltips.Description: Silencer stops all sound, preventing enemy heroes and units on the map from casting spells.
tooltips.Note0: This skill works on invisible and Debuff Immune units, but gaining debuff immunity will remove its effect.

npc_dota_hero_obsidian_destroyer.Name: Outworld Devourer
npc_dota_hero_obsidian_destroyer.Short: Can imprison a hero, making them invulnerable

tooltips.Description: Adds extra pure damage to Outworld Destroyer's attacks, based on his remaining mana pool.
tooltips.Lore: Harbinger's outworldly knowledge allows it to tap into the ebb and flow of all spiritual energy, infusing it into his being.
tooltips.Note0: The damage is calculated after the mana cost is spent.

tooltips.Description: Places a target unit into an astral prison. The hidden unit is invulnerable and disabled. When the astral prison implodes, it deals damage to the target and steals a percentage of their max mana.
tooltips.shard_description: Grants additional Mana Capacity steal to Astral Imprisonment. Also allows allies to move at +70% movement speed during Astral Imprisonment (they are visible, but untargettable and can't perform any other actions).
tooltips.Lore: Locked away in the pocket between this world and the Outworld, victims realize their infantile knowledge and mortality.
tooltips.Note0: Imprisoned units can still be hit by Sanity's Eclipse.
tooltips.Note1: Max mana steal does not increase Outworld Destroyer's current mana values or directly reduce the victim's mana values.

tooltips.Description: Passively grants a chance to restore a percentage of your max mana each time you cast an ability.
tooltips.shard_description: Casting Astral Imprisonment on an ally will trigger Essence Aura on them and grant then 300 max mana for 10 seconds.
tooltips.scepter_description: Damage that would bring Outworld Destroyer below 20% health triggers a strong dispel. In addition, when the effect is triggered Outworld Destroyer consumes of all his mana to create an all damage barrier equal to 70% of his maximum mana that lasts for 15 seconds. This effect can occur every 80 seconds and cannot be refreshed.
tooltips.Lore: The Outworld is awash in arcane energy, inclined to diffuse through any of Harbinger's rifts.

tooltips.Description: Unleashes a psychic blast that deals damage to enemies based on the difference between your mana and the target's mana. Sanity's Eclipse can hit units trapped by Astral Imprisonment. Deals bonus damage to illusions. Affected Heroes gain a Mana Allergy Debuff for 7 seconds, healing Outworld Destroyer every time they cast a spell.
tooltips.Lore: When an Outworld crystal ruptures, cataclysmic energies are released, and the reverberations of this power are felt interdimensionally.
tooltips.Note0: Does not damage creeps or neutral units.

tooltips.Lore: The very enchantment that twisted his being also summons canine familiars.
tooltips.Description: Summons two wolves to fight for Lycan.  Level 3-4 wolves have Permanent Invisibility, and level 4 wolves have Cripple that gives 20% chance to cripple the target, causing 8 damage per second and lose 60 attack speed for 4 seconds.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes one of your creep waves to include one uncontrollable wolf that moves with the wave. Additionally, wolves spawned this way may Cripple towers.
tooltips.Note1: Spirit Wolves have 70% magic damage resistance.
tooltips.Note2: Using this spell will replace currently active Spirit Wolves.
tooltips.critical_strike_Description: Gives %maim_chance%% to cripple the target, causing %maim_damage% damage per second and lose %maim_attack_speed% Attack Speed for %maim_duration% seconds.

tooltips.Lore: Blood-curdling wolf cries signal to opponents that Banehallow is among them.
tooltips.Description: Strikes fear into enemies, reducing armor and attack damage of all enemies within 2000 range of Lycan and his wolves. Non-hero controlled units flee for a short time. At night Howl's armor and attack damage reductions are global.

tooltips.Lore: His animalistic symbiosis with canine kind gives Banehallow enhanced reflexes and hunting capabilities.
tooltips.Description: Increases the HP regeneration and damage of Lycan and all units under his control.

Lycan bites an ally, granting them Shapeshift properties. Lycan and the bitten target gain 30% Lifesteal and share the healing effect of Lifesteal with each other as long as they are within 1200 range of each other.
tooltips.Note0: Wolf Bite cooldown matches the cooldown of the current level of Shapeshift.
tooltips.Lore: Does this bite look infected?
Forever a slave to his lycanthropy, Banehallow has come to accept his curse, and embrace his own savagery.
tooltips.Description: Lycan assumes his lupine form, granting him and his units critical strikes and added vision at night. During Shapeshift, Lycan and all units under his control move at increased speed, cannot be slowed and have a 40% chance to deal a critical strike doing 160% damage.
tooltips.Note0: Hex doesn't remove Lycan's movement speed.
tooltips.Note1: Lycan has a smaller collision size in this state.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Ranged heroes will lose attack range during Shapeshift, though bonus range abilities can modify that (i.e. Arctic Burn)

npc_dota_hero_brewmaster.Name: Brewmaster
npc_dota_hero_brewmaster.Short: Splits into three elemental spirits with unique abilities

tooltips.Lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.
tooltips.Description: Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy units.

tooltips.Lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!
tooltips.Description: Drenches himself and an area in alcohol, causing enemy units to move slower and ignite once they take any spell damage. Duration is increased by 3 seconds when enemies are ignited. While Brewmaster is Brewed Up, His Drunken Brawler Stances are stronger. Dealing or receiving magic damage extends Brewmaster's Brewed Up duration.

tooltips.Lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
tooltips.Description:
Brewmaster can switch stances based on the elements he controls, gaining passive bonuses that improve against enemies when Brewed Up.
Earth Brawler - Grants 1 armor and 5% Magic Resistance. Bonuses are 2.5x when Brewed Up.
Storm Brawler - Grants 15% evasion and 5% Bonus Move Speed. Bonuses are %active_multiplier%x when Brewed Up.
Fire Brawler - Grants 20% chance to critical strike for 120% of your attack damage and 10 Attack Speed. Crit Chance and Attack Speed is %active_multiplier%x when Brewed Up.
 <font color="#662375">Void Brawler - Grants 5% bonus Status Resistance to Brewmaster and applies a 10% Slow for 2s on attack. Slow and Status Resistance are %active_multiplier%x when affected by Cinder Brew.
tooltips.Note0: Stacks diminishingly with other sources of Evasion.

tooltips.Lore: Mangix doesn't hold to it by rule, but he vaguely recalls an old master musing that, if one could manage, scaring up a companion was always preferable to drinking alone.
tooltips.Description:
Creates a Brewling based on Brewmaster's current Drunken Brawler Stance. If the Brewling moves 1600 range away from Brewmaster, it can no longer cast spells and is slowed by 50%. Otherwise, all of the Brewling spells have a 100% cooldown penalty. 

A new Brewling cannot be resummoned for 3s if the current one takes damage from enemy Heroes or hero-controlled units. If the Brewling dies, the ability goes on cooldown for 70 seconds.

Only one Brewling can exist at a time. If Brewmaster uses Primal Split, the existing Brewling disappears.

tooltips.Lore: It isn't clear whether Mangix is consciously aware of his potent bond with nature, as it often occurs in the midst of a drunken stupor.
tooltips.Description: Splits Brewmaster into elements, forming 4 specialized warriors, adept at survival, each with their own abilities. If any of them survive until the end of their summoned timer, the Brewmaster is reborn.
tooltips.shard_Description: Increases Primal Split duration and allows it to be cancelled early.
tooltips.Note0: The Earth Element will carry all auras that the Brewmaster has, as well as True Sight.
tooltips.Note1: The Fire Element has phased movement.
tooltips.Note2: When the spell ends, Brewmaster will take the place of an element in this order, assuming they are alive: Earth, Storm, Fire.
tooltips.scepter_description: Primal Split has 2 charges and can be canceled at any time. Charge replenish time is equal to the normal cooldown.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases Primal Split duration and allows it to be cancelled early.

talent_4.name: +1x Brewed Up multiplier for Drunken Brawler

talent_8.name: Cinder Brew applies Fear when ignited

npc_dota_hero_shadow_demon.Name: Shadow Demon
npc_dota_hero_shadow_demon.Short: Stacks exponential poison damage against his foes

tooltips.Description: Banishes the targeted unit from the battlefield for a short duration.  Upon returning, two illusions of the banished unit with bonus base damage are created under Shadow Demon's control.
tooltips.Lore: The pain of deception comes not while it happens, but when it is revealed.

tooltips.Description: Whenever the target takes damage, all enemies, including the target itself if it is an enemy, within 675 range of the target also receive a portion of that damage. Can target enemy and allied units. Effect is paused if the target is hidden by Disruption.

tooltips.abilitydraft_note: In Ability Draft, Shadow Poison Release works by toggling auto-cast off, either by right-clicking the ability, or using the alt-hotkey combo.  Auto-cast state will be on if there are any units with Shadow Poison applied.
tooltips.Description: Deals damage in a line, and afflicts enemy units with a poison effect. The poison deals 1/2/4/8/16 times the stack damage based on the number of stacks on the target, up to 5 stacks. Additional stacks cause 50 damage each.  This deferred damage is dealt when Shadow Poison's duration is expired, or the Release sub-ability is used.
tooltips.Lore: The ever growing influence of the Shadow Demon can pollute the most valiant and pure of heroes.
tooltips.Note0: Shadow Poison can affect units under Disruption.
tooltips.release_Description: Releases the poison to do damage on all affected enemies. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Shadow Poison.

tooltips.Description: Releases the poison to do damage on all affected enemies. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Shadow Poison.

Cleanses the target allied unit, removing negative buffs for the duration.  At the end of the duration, the unit is healed. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Demonic Cleanse.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Cooldown is removed, replaced with 2 charges that replenish every 60 seconds.
tooltips.Note0: Can be cast on invulnerable units.
tooltips.Note1: Negative buffs are continously removed from the target for the duration of the Cleanse.

tooltips.Description: Purges the target enemy unit, removing positive buffs, and slowing the target for the duration.  The unit slowly regains its speed until the end of the duration, upon which damage is dealt.  Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Demonic Purge.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Cooldown is removed, replaced with 2 charges that replenish every 60 seconds. Also causes Demonic Purge to break its target's passive abilities while active.
tooltips.Lore: Once Shadow Demon no longer has any need for his collected cultist, he releases it from its subservience - and its life.
tooltips.Note0: The slow starts at 100.0% and decreases over time to 20.0%.
tooltips.Note1: Positive buffs are continously removed from the target for the duration of the Purge.
tooltips.Note2: Can be cast on invulnerable units.

npc_dota_hero_lone_druid.Name: Lone Druid
npc_dota_hero_lone_druid.Short: Commands a powerful spirit bear in battle

tooltips.Lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.
tooltips.Description: Summons a powerful Spirit Bear companion that can equip items.  If the bear moves 1100 distance away from the Lone Druid, it cannot attack.  Lone Druid suffers 20.0% of his max health as backlash damage if the Spirit Bear dies.\nSpirit Bear has the Return, Demolish and Entangling Claws abilities.
tooltips.Note0: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes.
tooltips.Note1: Spirit Bear has 0 base attributes and does not gain them with level. Attributes from buffs or items fully affect the bear as they would for Universal heroes.
tooltips.Note2: Spirit Bear cannot gain experience. Spirit Bear health and damage increase by 90 and 5 respectively with Lone Druid's level.
tooltips.Note3: Spirit Bear has its own Aghanim's Scepter and Shard upgrades.
tooltips.return_Description: Channels for %channel_tooltip% seconds and then teleports the Spirit Bear back to the Lone Druid.
tooltips.return_scepter_Description: Allows Spirit Bear to attack at any range from Lone Druid, and to survive if Lone Druid dies.
tooltips.entangle_Description: Attacks have a chance to cause roots to burst from the ground, immobilizing the attacked enemy unit, and dealing damage per second.
tooltips.entangle_Note0: Entangled units can't use Blink abilities, and are revealed if they are invisible.
tooltips.demolish_Description: Increases the power of the Spirit Bear, causing it to deal more damage to buildings and have additional magic resistance.
tooltips.defender_Description: Spirit Bear absorbs %damage_share%% of the damage dealt to Lone Druid.
tooltips.fetch_Description: Grabs the Target Ally, Enemy or Rune, and uncontrollably drags them towards Lone Druid for the duration. Enemies receive damage every %tick_rate%s. When dragging a unit, they are Rooted and the Spirit Bear is slowed by %self_slow%%.

tooltips.Description: Links Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear, sharing a percentage of their armor with each other, increasing the attack speed of both and causing damage dealt by the Spirit Bear to heal Lone Druid.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Lone Druid severs his link to his Spirit Bear, and connects to the target allied hero, sharing the Spirit Link bonuses with them for %duration%s. Armor sharing and attack speed are increased by %active_bonus%%. Damage done by the ally heals Lone Druid, as well as the other way around.\n\n The Spirit Bear is feared for the duration of the transformation, unless he has his own Aghanim's Scepter.
tooltips.Lore: Sylla is emboldened by the presence of his companion, his vitality replenished with each swipe of the Spirit Bear's claws.
tooltips.scepter_description: Lone Druid severs his link to his Spirit Bear, and connects to the target allied hero, sharing the Spirit Link bonuses with them for 20s. Armor sharing and attack speed are increased by 35%. Damage done by the ally heals Lone Druid, as well as the other way around.\n\n The Spirit Bear is feared for the duration of the transformation, unless he has his own Aghanim's Scepter.

tooltips.Lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.
tooltips.Description: Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear roar fiercely causing nearby enemies to flee towards their base in terror. Their movement speed is increased by 20%.
tooltips.bear_Description: Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear roar fiercely causing nearby enemies to flee towards their base in terror. Their movement speed is increased by %bonus_speed%%.
tooltips.shard_description: Applies a basic dispel and grants allies in an area around the caster bonus movement and attack speed. Replicates between Lone Druid and Spirit Bear regardless of castability on the other.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Note0: An entangled hero will not be able to move.
tooltips.bear_Note0: An entangled hero will not be able to move.
tooltips.Note1: Cooldown is shared with Spirit Bear.
tooltips.bear_Note1: Cooldown is shared with Lone Druid.

tooltips.Lore: The mighty bear is the king of the forest, possessing the throne through raw power.
tooltips.Description: Lone Druid learns to morph himself into a raging bear, losing his ranged advantage, but gaining increased bonus armor and health, and improved versions of Entangling Claws and Demolish.
tooltips.Note0: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Lone Druid was in when the item was used.
tooltips.battle_cry_Lore: When Sylla cries in the forest, the reverberations are felt for a great distance.
tooltips.battle_cry_Description: Adds attack damage and armor to the Lone Druid as well as any nearby units under his control.

talent_8.name: +1000 True Form and Spirit Bear Health

npc_dota_hero_chaos_knight.Name: Chaos Knight
npc_dota_hero_chaos_knight.Short: Has strong but random damage output

tooltips.Description: Throws a mysterious bolt of energy at the target unit. It stuns for a random duration and deals random damage.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases  the cast range of Chaos Bolt, and causes it to create a Phantasm illusion to attack the target.
tooltips.Lore: Even Chaos Knight cannot predict this manifest of unholy energy.
tooltips.Note0: The stun duration and damage values dealt are inversely related.
tooltips.Note1: Nearby illusions will mimic the cast animation.

tooltips.Description: Teleports Chaos Knight, any illusions he has, and the target unit to a point along the line between him and the target. Reduces armor of the enemy unit for 6 seconds.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows Reality Rift to be cast on any enemy hero that is within 1200 range of you or one of your illusions. Gathers all of your illusions and your hero and teleports them to the target enemy.
tooltips.Lore: Armageddon rides between the planes, bringing Chaos Knight to his victim wherever he may hide.
tooltips.Note0: Chaos Knight and the target unit are made to face each other, and Chaos Knight and his phantasms are issued an attack order against the target.

tooltips.Description: Chaos Knight and his illusions' attacks have a chance to deal a critical strike of varying strength with bonus lifesteal. Deals 2.0x damage to creeps, but lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 70%.
tooltips.Lore: Chaos Knight's unwieldy power bludgeons those who stand before him, crushing the thickest of armors.

tooltips.Description: Summons several phantasmal copies of the Chaos Knight from alternate dimensions. The phantasms are strong illusions that deal 100% damage, but take 325% damage.\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Creates an illusion of allied heroes globally. Creates an additional illusion for Chaos Knight as well.
tooltips.Lore: Drawing on his battles fought across many worlds and many times, phantasms of the Chaos Knight rise up to quell all who oppose him.
tooltips.Note0: Removes most negative buffs from Chaos Knight.
tooltips.Note1: Chaos Knight is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing him to dodge stuns and damage.
tooltips.Note2: Strong Illusions are not instantly killed by spells.

tooltips.Description: Tosses a net at the target point, rooting down all enemy units in an area around it.
tooltips.Lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.
tooltips.Note0: Affects invisible units, revealing them.
tooltips.Note1: Does not work on Debuff Immune units or Roshan.

abilities.name: Poof
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_POINT | | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_UNIT_TARGET | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NORMAL_WHEN_STOLEN | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_ROOT_DISABLES | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_ALT_CASTABLE

tooltips.Description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for %abilitycastpoint% seconds, damaging the enemy in both the departure and arrival locations. \n\nIf the ability is in alt-cast state, all Meepos will also cast Poof to the target. When cast on the ground, all Meepos except the selected one will Poof to the closest location.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: In AD, can poof to any friendly unit within 2000 range.
tooltips.Lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
tooltips.Note0: Can be cast through the minimap.
tooltips.Note1: Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

tooltips.Description: Steals health from the enemy with each strike and heals all other Meepos for that amount.
tooltips.shard_description: Ransack now has a 30% chance on hit to apply a Geostrike debuff, slowing enemies by 20% and dealing 20 DPS for 4 seconds. Instances from multiple Meepos stack.
tooltips.Lore: So you gonna need that, or...?

tooltips.Description: Digs into the ground for a short duration, dispelling Meepo and causing him to become invulnerable and untargetable for 3s. Restores 25% of his max health over that duration.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

Primary Meepo mounts all other Meepos in a 600 radius around him on top of his shoulders. While in this form, he gains 40% of the other Meepo stats and can Fling them at enemies, dealing damage and slowing them.\n\n When cast, Earthbind generates additional nets and Poof deals bonus damage based on the amount of Meepos riding on top.
tooltips.fling_description: In MegaMeepo form, Meepo flings the topmost meepo towards a target within a %AbilityCastRange% range, dealing damage and slowing their movement speed.

tooltips.shard_description: Divided We Stand can be cast as long as there's a Meepo within %fling_radius% radius of yourself. Causes that Meepo to fling you towards a target within a %AbilityCastRange% range, dealing damage and slowing their movement speed. Mana Cost: %AbilityManaCost%
tooltips.Description: Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience, attributes and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Divided We Stand grants all Meepos bonus Magic Resistance.
tooltips.Lore: Do I know you?
tooltips.Note0: Clones can't use Arcane Boots, Guardian Greaves.

talent_5.name: Earthbind grants True Strike on Targets

npc_dota_hero_treant.Name: Treant Protector
npc_dota_hero_treant.Short: Calls upon the forest to root his foes

tooltips.Description: Creates vines towards the target location. Vines slow down and deal damage to enemies that walk through. Vines deal 50% more damage if they touch a tree. Does half damage to creeps.
tooltips.Lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.

tooltips.Description: Treant plants a life-sapping seed in an enemy unit, draining its health, while simultaneously slowing it. The seed heals friendly units around it.
tooltips.Lore: Rooftrellen nurtures the beings under his stewardship, sustained by the lifeforce of trespassers into his sacred ground.

tooltips.Description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which heals the target and provides bonus armor.
tooltips.Lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.

tooltips.Description: Treant Protector enchants a tree, which grants him unobstructed vision in that location. If Overgrowth is cast, units within a radius of an enchanted tree will be entangled and damaged. Passively causes all trees to respawn much faster.
tooltips.Note0: Being entangled by Overgrowth through enchanted trees from Eyes in the Forest does damage.
tooltips.Note1: If the enemy has True Sight, they will be able to see which trees are enchanted.
tooltips.Lore: One can never be too certain who, or what, might need protecting.

tooltips.Description: Provides Treant with Tree Walking whenever he hasn't taken damage for 3 seconds. While nearby trees or affected by Nature's Grasp, Treant gains bonus movement speed.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Treant to move faster and become invisible with Nature's Guise and root enemies upon attacking. Deals damage over time and roots for longer if the attack was near a tree.
tooltips.Lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.
tooltips.Note0: While affected by Nature's Guise, Treant can move unobstructed through other trees.

tooltips.Description: Summons an overgrowth of vines and branches around Treant that deal damage to afflicted enemies and prevent them from moving, blinking, going invisible, or attacking.
tooltips.Lore: Rooftrellen calls the ancestral spirit of nature, releasing its power through all of his kin.
tooltips.Note0: Works on Debuff Immune units, but if units gain debuff immunity after the effect starts, they'll break free.

npc_dota_hero_ogre_magi.Name: Ogre Magi
npc_dota_hero_ogre_magi.Short: Uses a touch of luck to amplify his skills

tooltips.Description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing damage and stunning the target.
tooltips.Lore: The Ogre Magi is easily amused, entertained for hours by playing with fire.
tooltips.Note0: When Multicast, Fireblast hits the same target each time with a %multicast_delay% seconds interval.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Scepter: Access Unrefined Fireblast by toggling auto-cast on Fireblast.

tooltips.Description: Drenches the target and another random unit in volatile chemicals, causing it to burst into flames. The target is in immense pain, taking damage and moving more slowly.
tooltips.Lore: Batter up!
tooltips.Note0: Multicast makes this spell have a chance to cast multiple times at random enemy units in a %ignite_multicast_aoe% area of effect.
tooltips.Note1: Ignite hitting an already affected unit adds to the burn duration.

tooltips.Description: Incites a frenzy in a friendly unit, increasing its movement speed and attack speed. Gives bonus attacks speed if cast on Ogre himself. Can be cast on towers.
tooltips.Lore: 'Running's not as fun as hitting... Not one bit fun.'
tooltips.Note0: When multicast, nearby allies will be selected randomly in an %multicast_bloodlust_aoe% area of effect to receive Bloodlust.

tooltips.Description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing 150 + 1.5x Ogre's Strength in damage and stunning the target. Its mana cost is 35% of Ogre Magi's current mana.
tooltips.Lore: The 'who-casts-spell-first' argument between himself is solved simply by both casting at once.
tooltips.Note0: When Multicast, Unrefined Fireblast hits the same target each time with a %multicast_delay% seconds interval.

tooltips.Description: Creates a shield around the target ally, absorbing a percentage of the damage of next 3 attacks from enemy heroes. When damage is absorbed, a fireball is launched at the attacker. Can be cast on towers.
tooltips.Note0: When multicast, nearby allies will be selected randomly in an %multicast_fireshield_aoe% area of effect to receive Fire Shield.

tooltips.description: Ogre Magi's max Intelligence is 0. He receives mana and mana regeneration from Strength. Increases Multicast chance by 1% for each 20 Strength Ogre has.
tooltips.Description: Ogre Magi's max Intelligence is 0. He receives mana and mana regeneration from Strength. Increases Multicast chance by 1% for each 20 Strength Ogre has.

talent_4.name: +2/0.01 Dumb Luck Mana/Mana Regen Per Strength

npc_dota_hero_undying.Name: Undying
npc_dota_hero_undying.Short: Summons hordes of zombies to attack his foes

tooltips.Description: Undying steals strength from all enemy heroes in an area, dealing base damage as he claims the enemy's strength for himself. Deals 2.0x damage to creeps.
tooltips.Lore: The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.
tooltips.Note0: The strength stolen stacks, but can't cause a hero to have strength below 1.
tooltips.Note1: The strength steal takes effect before the damage is dealt.
tooltips.Note2: Affects invisible units.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases strength steal.

tooltips.Description: Undying rips health away from all nearby units and uses it to heal an ally, or damage an enemy. Soul Rip can also be used to heal Tombstone.
tooltips.Lore: Even allies feel despair in Undying's presence.
tooltips.Note0: Can heal Tombstone, but can't heal or damage other buildings.
tooltips.Note1: Does not rip from invisible units, invulnerable units, units in the fog of war, or spell immune enemies.
tooltips.Note2: Does rip from spell immune allies, including zombies.

tooltips.Description: Summons a tombstone at the target point.  Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them.  Zombies have the Deathlust ability, which causes their attacks to slow the target, and if the target reaches below a certain amount of health, increases the attack and movement speed of the zombie.
tooltips.Lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.
tooltips.Note0: Tombstone is Spell Immune, but can be healed by Soul Rip.
tooltips.Note1: Zombies and Tombstone are Spell Immune.
tooltips.Note2: If their initial target dies or goes out of vision, the Zombie will die.
tooltips.zombie_deathstrike_Description: Slows enemy units on attack.  If the attacked unit's health goes below the threshold, the zombie receives enhanced movement and attack speed.
tooltips.shard_description: Tombstone can be cast on an allied hero to bunker inside of the tombstone. Heroes that enter the Tombstone cannot leave for 3 seconds nor can they re-enter after leaving. If the tombstone is destroyed with a hero inside, that hero gets stunned for 2 seconds.
tooltips.grab_Description: Load an ally into the nearest available tombstone.
tooltips.unit_grab_Description: Load an ally into this tombstone.

tooltips.Description: Undying transforms into a horrifying flesh golem. Gains a percentage increase to strength and imbues attacks with a slow and damage amplification.
tooltips.Lore: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.

npc_dota_hero_rubick.Name: Rubick
npc_dota_hero_rubick.Short: Steals the spells of his enemies to use against them

tooltips.Description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows you to target yourself or allies with Telekinesis. Throw range is 35% longer and throw delay is reduced to 0.5 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.
tooltips.Note0: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction.
tooltips.Note1: When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun.
tooltips.land_Description: Chooses the location the target will land when Telekinesis finishes.
tooltips.land_self_Description: Chooses the location you will land when Telekinesis finishes.

tooltips.Description: Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage. Each jump deals less damage.
tooltips.Lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.

tooltips.Description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane allows him to have a larger cast range and increased potency.
tooltips.Lore: Not every magus can be a Grand Magus...

tooltips.Description: Spells acquired with Spell Steal will replace this slot.
Spells acquired with Spell Steal will replace this slot.

Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies, and stolen spells last longer on enemies.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases the number of spells that can be stolen to 2. Increases cast range, and upgrades spells to their Scepter version.
tooltips.Lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.
tooltips.Note0: Cannot steal item abilities.
tooltips.Note1: Rubick will steal the Aghanim's Shard version of the ability, if he himself has an Aghanim's Shard.

npc_dota_hero_disruptor.Name: Disruptor
npc_dota_hero_disruptor.Short: Traps and silences foes in his static storm

tooltips.Description: Repeatedly strikes the targeted unit with lightning.  Each strike damages nearby enemy units in a small radius and slows enemy movement and attack speed by 100% for 0.4 seconds.  Provides vision of its target.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases the cast range and strike count of Thunder Strike. It can now also be ground targeted, where it will lie dormant for up to 7 seconds and attach to the first enemy that comes within the radius.
tooltips.Lore: Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.

tooltips.Description: Teleports the target hero back to where it was 4 seconds ago.  Instantly kills illusions. Deals damage based on distance glimpsed, with max damage dealt at 1400 distance.
tooltips.Lore: Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.
tooltips.Note0: The travel time is a function of the distance the target will travel.

tooltips.Description: After a short formation time, creates a circular barrier of kinetic energy that enemies can't pass.
tooltips.Lore: The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.
tooltips.Note0: Debuff Immune units can travel through the field.

tooltips.Description: Creates a damaging static storm that also silences all enemy units in the area for the duration.  The damage starts off weak, but increases in power over the duration.
tooltips.Lore: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.
tooltips.scepter_description: Mutes items.

tooltips.Description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units take damage, then are hurled into the air and stunned.
tooltips.Lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
tooltips.Note0: The spikes move at %speed% units per second, over %length% range.
tooltips.Note1: Impale cannot be blocked by Linken's Sphere.

tooltips.Description: Deals damages to the enemy equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence. Additionally deals damage equal to a percentage of damage the target received from Nyx in the past 15s.

When activated while above ground, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage. Activating Spiked Carapace will not break Vendetta invisibility.\n\nWhile Burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast.
tooltips.Lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.
tooltips.Note0: The damage is calculated after all reductions.
tooltips.Note1: Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.
tooltips.Note2: The damage reflected will have the same damage type as it had when it was dealt to Nyx.

tooltips.Description: Nyx Assassin buries himself beneath the battlefield over a short duration. Once burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast, the range of Mind Flare and Impale is increased, and Impale's cooldown is decreased. While burrowed, Nyx Assassin is stationary, unable to attack, and invisible. Nyx gains damage reduction from all damage sources.
tooltips.Lore: Some castes of zealot scarab are known to create small burrows to lie in wait, ready to ambush their prey.
tooltips.Note0: Casting Vendetta will cancel burrow.

tooltips.shard_description: Vendetta now moves faster, and a successful Vendetta attack now increases the target's spell damage taken.
tooltips.Description: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus.  If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, 50% of the target's max mana is removed and massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack. Nyx Assassin has 75 additional attack range and a 70% faster attack animation for this attack.
tooltips.Lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.
tooltips.Note0: Has a %fade_time% second fadetime.
tooltips.Note1: If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.

npc_dota_hero_naga_siren.Name: Naga Siren
npc_dota_hero_naga_siren.Short: Able to capitivate and disable enemies with her song

tooltips.Description: Creates multiple images of Naga Siren under her control.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Slithice, while being strong in her own right, is notoriously hard to track down.
tooltips.Note0: Naga Siren is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing her to dodge stuns and damage.
tooltips.Note1: Upon casting, most effects are removed from Naga Siren.
tooltips.Note2: Upon casting, existing Mirror Image illusions are destroyed.

tooltips.Description: Interrupts the target and traps them in place, preventing movement or blinking.
tooltips.Lore: The only way to escape the onslaught of a Slithereen is to never oppose one in the first place.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases cast range and projectile speed.  Allows Ensnare to target Spell Immune or sleeping units.

tooltips.Description: Every 6 attacks from naga and her illusions, the Naga Siren and her images will hit all nearby units with a damaging wave of water that lowers armor for 4.0 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: A torrent from the Deep Ones crushes the defenses of the Siren's enemies.
Even the youngest Slithereen are well schooled in trawling for prey with nothing but their wits and nets.
tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Naga Siren channels for up to %AbilityChannelTime% seconds, pulling all units affected by Naga's Ensnare in a 1400 range towards her at a speed of 200.
All enemies in range of the Naga Siren are put into a magical stasis where they cannot act or be attacked. Using Song of the Siren again will end the duration early.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases duration. Song of the Siren heals allies by +5% of their Max HP per second for its duration.
tooltips.Lore: Slithice's powerful voice enchants leagues of opponents, while calling her Slithereen kin in a time of need.
tooltips.Note0: Units affected by Song of the Siren are invulnerable and cannot take damage from any source.
tooltips.Note1: Doesn't affect Debuff Immune units.
tooltips.Note2: The area of the song follows Naga, so if she moves far enough away from affected units, they will wake up.
tooltips.cancel_Description: Release enemy units from your song so they can be targeted again.

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Illuminate to heal for 40% of its damage during daytime.
tooltips.Lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.
tooltips.Note0: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.

tooltips.Description: A blinding light flashes over the targeted area, knocking back and blinding the units in the area, causing them to miss some attacks. Knockback is 400 range over 0.6 seconds.
tooltips.Note0: Upon landing, units will destroy trees in a 150 radius.
tooltips.Lore: The Primordial light turns the tides of battle in favor of Ezalor and his allies.

tooltips.Description: Restores mana to the target unit and reduces cooldowns of all basic abilities currently on cooldown by a fixed amount. Is 25% more effective when used on himself.
tooltips.Lore: In the same vein, Ezalor bestows his harmony among others.
tooltips.Note0: Chakra Magic does not reduce the cooldown of Ultimate abilities

tooltips.Description: Weakens an enemy's magical resistance, and applies a slow that increases in strength the more the target moves.
Summons Ignis Fatuus at the targeted area. Alternates on and off, drawing enemies closer with its mesmerising flicker.
tooltips.Lore: Though he would not claim to 'know' them, Ezalor holds an uncanny influence over many powerful creatures always willing to come to his aid.
tooltips.Note0: Ignus Fatuus applies a non-interrupting pull towards it on all enemies within the radius.

tooltips.Description: Ezalor temporarily turns his body luminescent, gaining bonus movement speed, cast range, grants the Solar Bind ability, and allows Illuminate to be channeled by a separate spirit and heal allies.
tooltips.Lore: In a flash of light, Ezalor reveals his true nature.
tooltips.illuminate_Description: Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
tooltips.illuminate_Lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.
tooltips.illuminate_Note0: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.

abilities.name: Recall
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_POINT | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_CHANNELLED | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_UNIT_TARGET | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NO_TARGET | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_DONT_RESUME_ATTACK | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_SHOW_IN_GUIDES | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NOT_LEARNABLE

tooltips.Description: After a short delay, teleports the targeted friendly hero to your location.  If the targeted friendly hero takes player based damage during this time, the ability is interrupted. Chakra Magic is applied to both Keeper of the Light and Ally upon teleporting
tooltips.Lore: Walk towards the light.
tooltips.Note0: If Keeper of the Light dies, the spell effect is interrupted.
tooltips.Note1: Recall will interrupt channeling spells.
tooltips.Note2: You can disable help to prevent Keeper from casting this spell on you.
tooltips.Note3: Can be cast through the minimap, choosing the nearest friendly hero.

talent_6.name: +1.5s Solar Bind Stun when target is fully slowed

npc_dota_hero_wisp.Name: Io
npc_dota_hero_wisp.Short: Links to its allies to buff them

tooltips.Description: Tethers Io to an allied unit, granting bonus movement speed to both. When Io restores health or mana, the tethered unit gains a portion of that amount. The tether breaks when the allied unit moves too far away, or Io cancels the tether. Tether slows and damages enemies touching it.
tooltips.shard_description: Tether stuns enemies touching it for 1.75 seconds and deals 150 damage. Does not affect the same unit more than once every 7 seconds. Increases movement speed bonus by 8%.
tooltips.Lore: The benevolent touch of Io brings strength from between the planes.
tooltips.Note0: If you try to tether a unit that is 700 distance or further away from Io, he will latch on and pull himself closer to the tethered unit (to a distance of 300).
tooltips.Note1: The tethered unit will heal faster and will heal even if Io is at full health.
tooltips.Note2: Io's movement speed matches the tethered unit's.
tooltips.break_Description: Break the link to the tethered unit.

tooltips.Description: Summon five particle spirits that dance in a circle around Io. If a particle collides with an enemy hero, it explodes, damaging all enemy units in an area around it.  Creeps take minor damage from touching a particle spirit, but do not cause them to explode.  When its duration ends, any remaining Spirits explode.
tooltips.Lore: Io twists the particles of the universe with its unimaginable capabilities.
tooltips.Note0: After summoning, Io can call the spirits in and out.
tooltips.scepter_description: Spirits now passively spawn around Io constantly every second up to the max. Spirits colliding with enemy Heroes slows them briefly. Can be activated to explode spirits.
tooltips.in_Description: Sends the spirits closer to you. Can be toggled on and off.
tooltips.out_Description: Sends the spirits farther away from you. Can be toggled on and off.

tooltips.Lore: Drawing on the energy of matter from all worlds, Io begins the unravelling of time.
tooltips.Description: Io gains bonus attack speed, spell amplification, and HP Regen based on max health.  If Io is Tethered to an ally, that unit also gains the bonuses.
tooltips.shard_description: Grants Overcharge Slow Resistance. Io also gains Spell Lifesteal and can now share Spell Lifesteal with its tethered target.

abilities.name: Spirits In
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_TOGGLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IMMEDIATE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_SHOW_IN_GUIDES | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_CHANNEL | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN

tooltips.Description: Sends the spirits closer to you. Can be toggled on and off.

abilities.name: Spirits Out
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_TOGGLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IMMEDIATE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_SHOW_IN_GUIDES | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_CHANNEL | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN

tooltips.Description: Sends the spirits farther away from you. Can be toggled on and off.

tooltips.Lore: Io is the embodiment of the mystery of the universe.
tooltips.Description: Teleports Io and a tethered ally to any location. After the spell expires, Io and the tethered ally will return to their original location. Double-click to teleport to your team's base fountain.
tooltips.Note0: Enemies receive a visual indicator in the world and on the minimap of the target location during the cast delay.
tooltips.Note1: If Io is disabled during the cast delay, Relocate is cancelled.
tooltips.Note2: If an allied hero is Tethered, that hero will teleport along with you. You can break the tether at any time to prevent that hero from teleporting with you.
tooltips.Note3: Only heroes, creep heroes, and illusions can be relocated.

npc_dota_hero_visage.Name: Visage
npc_dota_hero_visage.Short: Scouts and attacks with his familiars

tooltips.Description: Visage drains the movement and attack speed of the targeted unit, gaining it for itself and nearby familiars.
tooltips.Lore: The warmth of the sun is never felt in the dark cold of the Narrow Maze.
tooltips.Note0: The two buffs can be removed separately by dispels.
tooltips.Note1: The speed gained is independent of the speed lost on the target.
tooltips.Note2: Familiars within %radius% range of Visage will also receive bonuses from Grave Chill.

tooltips.Description: Visage gathers charges of soul essence each time nearby heroes take more than 100 damage. When the essence is released, it deals base damage as well as damage for each gathered soul charge.
tooltips.Lore: The collected souls of the dead reach out to bring another into their fold.
tooltips.Note0: Charges are only gained for damage greater than %damage_min% and less than %damage_max% that is dealt by a player or Roshan.  Self-damage or Soul Assumption damage isn't counted.

tooltips.Description: Visage generates a layered barrier that protects him from damage.  If he receives damage from a player, one layer is removed, and takes time to recover.
tooltips.shard_Description: Grants Visage the ability to cast Gravekeeper's Cloak. Restores up to 25% of your health.
tooltips.Lore: Visage's tough scales share equal properties of ghost and stone, making it nearly impervious to blade and magical assault.
tooltips.Note0: Each time Visage receives damage greater than the Minimum Damage that was not self-inflicted and was from a player owned source, a layer is removed.
tooltips.Note1: Familiars within 900 range of Visage will receive the current damage reduction from Gravekeeper's Cloak.
tooltips.shard_description: Grants Visage the ability to cast Gravekeeper's Cloak. Restores up to 25% of your health.

tooltips.Description: After a short delay, the nearest Familiar turns into stone and smashes into the ground, stunning and damaging all targets in the area.  The Familiar becomes invulnerable, and will regain its health very rapidly.  After 6.0 seconds, the Familiar will automatically leave Stone Form.
tooltips.Note0: While Stone Form is not dispellable, the stun can be removed by strong dispels.

tooltips.Description: Turns Visage and familiars invisible, granting Visage bonus movement speed and upgrading its movement type to flying. When Visage or its familiars leave invisibility they deal more damage for a short duration. Lasts 35.0 seconds. Invisibility ends when attacking or casting.

Conjures blind Familiars to fight for Visage.  Familiars possess the Stone Form ability, that allows them to turn into stone, stunning enemies upon landing.  While in Stone Form, Familiars are invulnerable, and rapidly regenerate their health.  Familiars grant high bounty when killed.
tooltips.Lore: Guardians of the Narrow Maze, Necro'lic's Familiars stand watch over his domain.
tooltips.Note0: Casting Summon Familiars will replace any existing Familiars.
tooltips.Note1: Familiars within range of Visage will receive bonuses from Gravekeeper's Cloak and Grave Chill.
tooltips.stone_form_Description: After a short delay, the Familiar turns into stone and smashes into the ground, stunning and damaging all targets in the area.  The Familiar becomes invulnerable, and will regain its health very rapidly.  After %stone_duration% seconds, the Familiar will automatically leave Stone Form.

talent_6.name: +1 Armor Corruption to Visage and Familiars

npc_dota_hero_slark.Name: Slark
npc_dota_hero_slark.Short: Slips in and out of skirmishes

tooltips.Description: After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging most negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself.  Slark only takes 30% of the damage.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
tooltips.Note0: %delay% seconds after cast, a series of %total_pulses% pulses separated by %pulse_interval% seconds deal the damage.
tooltips.Note1: Each pulse also removes debuffs from Slark.
tooltips.Note2: You can't kill yourself with this skill.
tooltips.Note3: The pulses stop if Slark dies.

tooltips.Description: Slark leaps forward, leashing the first hero he connects with and applying Essence Shift Stacks.  That unit can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
tooltips.Lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
tooltips.Note0: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of %pounce_speed%, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled %pounce_distance% distance.
tooltips.Note1: Debuff Immune units cannot be leashed.
tooltips.Note2: Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location.
tooltips.scepter_description: Provides charges and increases range.

tooltips.Description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility. If Slark kills an affected enemy hero, he permanently steals 1 Agility.
tooltips.Lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.
tooltips.Note0: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1.
tooltips.Note1: Essence Shifted stats are returned to normal on death. The stat return for Slark and for the affected hero are separate.
tooltips.Note2: To permanently steal Agility, Slark doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within 300 range of Slark while having the Essence Shift debuff.

tooltips.Description: Creates a cloud at the target location. All allies inside the radius are hidden and affected by Shadow Dance.

When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection. Attacking, casting spells, and using items will not reveal Slark.  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
tooltips.Lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.
tooltips.Note0: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the passive movement and health regeneration bonuses are lost for %neutral_disable% seconds.
tooltips.Note1: The passive movement and health regeneration bonuses have a %activation_delay% second activation and deactivation delay.

talent_5.name: +1 Agility gain/stolen per Essence Shift Stack

npc_dota_hero_medusa.Name: Medusa
npc_dota_hero_medusa.Short: Immobilizes her enemies with her stone gaze

tooltips.Description: Medusa magically splits her shot into several arrows. These arrows deal a lower percent of her normal damage.\n\nThe extra targets will not receive other attack effects (such as critical strike).
tooltips.Lore: All who encounter the cursed Gorgon will feel her rage.
tooltips.Note0: Secondary targets will be the closest enemy units excluding the primary target.
tooltips.Note1: If illusions of Medusa are created while Split Shot is active, they will also have this ability.

tooltips.Description: A mystic snake made of energy jumps from target to target dealing damage. Damage and speed increases with each jump. After it reaches its last target, it returns to Medusa to replenish her with mana. The snake returns 14% mana based on the targets' total mana.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Mystic Snake to turn enemies hit into stone. Stone duration increases with each bounce of the Mystic Snake.
tooltips.Lore: The Gorgon's curse is her greatest strength.
tooltips.Note0: Mystic Snake cannot be disjointed.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard: Cold Blooded is hidden in the ability panel when Shard is aquired, but a buff icon will appear.\n\nStone Gaze must be drafted for Aghanim's Scepter upgrade to work.

tooltips.Description: Creates a shield that absorbs 98% of incoming damage in exchange for Medusa's mana. Illusions absorb less damage per point of mana. Provides bonus mana capacity.
tooltips.Lore: While Medusa was not gifted with eternal life upon birth, her curse bestowed her with impressive defensive powers.
tooltips.Note0: Absorbs damage before any damage reduction takes place, meaning that armor will not reduce the amount of mana needed to absorb damage.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Medusa begins the game with a level one Mana Shield if not drafted. Mana Shield's max level is 4 when drafted by other heroes.

tooltips.Description: When Medusa is targeted with a spell, a single-target Mystic Snake is sent back towards the enemy.

Any enemy units looking at Medusa will have their movement and attack speed slowed.  If 2.0 seconds of total time is accumulated looking at Medusa while Stone Gaze is active, that unit will turn to stone.  Petrified units are stunned, and take bonus physical attack damage.
tooltips.Lore: The beauty of Medusa is legendary.
tooltips.Note0: Regardless of when a unit receives the Stone Gaze buff while the ability is active on Medusa, it will still receive the full debuff duration.

talent_1.name: +15% Mystic Snake Turn and Movement Speed Slow

npc_dota_hero_troll_warlord.Name: Troll Warlord
npc_dota_hero_troll_warlord.Short: Swaps between ranged and melee attacks at will

tooltips.Description: While active, Troll Warlord swaps from using ranged to melee attacks. Melee attacks have a chance to ensnare, preventing the target from moving or using mobility spells. Berserker's Rage also grants additional movement speed, armor, and decreases base attack time.\n\nWhirling Axes has different functionality while Berserker's Rage is active.
tooltips.Lore: Like his anger, Troll Warlord's supply of axes is infinite.
tooltips.Note0: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Troll Warlord was in when the item was used.

tooltips.Description: Troll hurls a fistful of five axes in a cone shape over 950.0 range, slowing and damaging enemy units.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Whirling Axes (Ranged) to dispel enemies. Reduces cooldown and mana cost.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Only axes fueled by hate whirl with such a deadly spin.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect Roshan.

tooltips.Description: Troll hurls two axes around him in a close range area of effect, damaging enemy units and causing them to miss some attacks.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Whirling Axes (Melee) to dispel Troll Warlord. Reduces cooldown and mana cost.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Keep your enemies close.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect Roshan.

tooltips.Description: With each continuous blow on the same target, Troll gains increased attack speed.  If Troll changes targets, the stacks drop to zero.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases max Fervor stacks by %bonus_max_stacks% and grants Troll 20% + 4% chance per Fervor stack of firing an additional ranged attack to any unit within its ranged attack range plus 175.
tooltips.Lore: If at first you don't succeed, strike, strike again.

tooltips.Description: Troll unleashes a powerful battle trance, that forces you to continuously attack the closest enemy unit within 900 range, prioritizing heroes. Damage does not kill you during this mode. Grants you bonus lifesteal, attack speed and movement speed. Applies a Basic Dispel.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.shard_description: Casting Battle Trance now gives Troll Warlord a global aura that gives allied heroes (including himself) +60 Attack Speed.
tooltips.Lore: An adrenaline rush of pure hatred quickens your blades.
tooltips.Note0: Troll can still use his items and abilities while affected by Battle Trance, but not other commands.
tooltips.Note1: Troll can still be killed with Axe's Culling Blade.
tooltips.Note2: Troll is granted vision over the target.

npc_dota_hero_centaur.Name: Centaur Warrunner
npc_dota_hero_centaur.Short: Reflects damage back to his attackers

tooltips.Description: After a brief windup, Centaur Warrunner slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy units. During the delay, he is disarmed but can move.
tooltips.Lore: When the mighty hoof of the Warrunner touches soil, the tremors are felt far and wide.

tooltips.Description: Centaur strikes a mighty blow at melee range, damaging both himself and a small area around the target. Deals extra damage based on your strength. Centaur cannot die from Double Edge.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Double Edge to slow enemy heroes and increase Centaur's strength per hero hit for a short time. Duration refreshes per stack, up to a max of +5 stacks.
tooltips.Lore: In the spurs of combat, Bradwarden's vicious strikes sometimes cause self-inflicted collateral damage.
tooltips.Note0: Double Edge deals magic type damage to both the targets and himself.

tooltips.Description: Centaur counters all attacks, dealing damage back to the attacker. Returns a fixed amount plus a percentage of your strength. Deals half damage to towers.
tooltips.Lore: Bradwarden has no need to parry his opponent's attacks; his armor-like hide does it for him.
tooltips.Note0: Retaliate triggers when the attack hits.
tooltips.Note1: Retaliate deals damage to towers.

tooltips.Lore: The needs of Bradwarden's ample pride pale greatly in the face of his demand for victory.
