tooltips.Description: Centaur tosses an ally into a cart hitched behind him. While in the cart, the ally can still cast and attack normally, but cannot move independently or be targeted by opponents. Non-targeted effects can still affect the hitched ally. Increases the attack range of melee heroes by 200.
Centaur hitches a cart behind him. While active, Centaur gains the benefit of Stampede for the current level of Stampede, and can cast Hitch a Ride on a target ally.

Centaur leads all allies into a vicious charge causing them to move through units at max speed and slow any enemy units they trample. Trampled enemies take damage based on Centaur Warrunner's strength. Each enemy can be trampled once.
tooltips.Lore: The great belt of Omexe, which labels Bradwarden as the greatest warrior of his kind, incites his fellow gladiators to follow him into barbarous combat.
tooltips.scepter_description: Heroes affected by Stampede take reduced damage, and are able to run through obstructions, including trees and up cliffs. Enemies affected by Stampede are leashed. Increases duration.

npc_dota_hero_magnataur.Name: Magnus
npc_dota_hero_magnataur.Short: Charges in to reposition his enemies

tooltips.Description: Magnus sends out a wave of force, damaging enemy units in a line, pulling them towards him and slowing them for a brief period.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases range, and causes Shockwave to return towards the caster's original cast location after reaching max length, hitting enemies a second time for +75% of the damage.
tooltips.Lore: Mt. Joerlak was a somewhat unstable mass, and Magnus has learned to channel its reverberations.

tooltips.Description: Gives an allied unit bonus damage and cleave on attack. Magnus receives 50% larger bonus.
tooltips.Lore: With a deep bellow, Magnus displays his true power.
tooltips.Note0: The bonus damage is based only on base damage and damage from primary attributes.
tooltips.Note1: Cleave damage goes through spell immunity.
tooltips.Note2: Ranged units cannot Cleave.

tooltips.Description: Magnus rushes forward, goring enemy units on his massive tusk. Heroes hit on the way will be dragged to the destination, then damaged and affected by slowed movement and attack speed. The damage is increased based on distance traveled.
tooltips.Lore: Magnoceros horns are valuable in direct proportion to their danger to prospective merchants.

tooltips.Description: Magnus tosses any enemies in front of him, launching them to his rear. Enemies take damage, spend 0.6 seconds in the air, and are stunned while in the air and an additional amount of time after landing.
Magnus changes properties of matter, sucking all nearby enemies in front of him and stunning them with a powerful slam and dealing damage.
tooltips.Lore: Magnus fights with the fury of the erupting Mt. Joerlak.

talent_3.name: +10 All Stats per hero hit with Reverse Polarity

npc_dota_hero_shredder.Name: Timbersaw
npc_dota_hero_shredder.Short: Chops through the forest to face his foes

tooltips.Description: Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal bonus damage per tree destroyed.
tooltips.Note0: Universal Heroes will lose %stat_loss_univ%% of each attribute.
tooltips.Lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.

tooltips.Description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
tooltips.Lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.

tooltips.Scepter_description: Reactive Armor can now be activated to get max stacks and %initial_shield% damage barrier. Grants Timbersaw %shield_per_sec% + %shield_per_sec_per_enemy% barrier amount per second for each enemy hero within %radius% radius of Timbersaw up to a maximum of %max_shield%. After %duration% seconds, Timbersaw deals damage to every hero within %explosion_radius% radius equal to %base_explosion% + his remaining barrier amount and loses all of his barrier.
tooltips.Description: Each time Timbersaw is attacked, he gains increased health regen and armor. Hero attacks are counted as 3x the amount.
tooltips.Lore: The saw-suit is equipped to react to the slightest touch with fortified defenses.

abilities.name: Second Chakram
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_POINT | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_AOE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NOT_LEARNABLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_SHOW_IN_GUIDES

tooltips.Description: Launches a second independent Chakram.
tooltips.Lore: Cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut!
tooltips.Note0: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over %break_distance% distance away.
tooltips.Note1: Slow effects from two chakrams do not stack.

tooltips.Description: Releases a flame in the direction Timbersaw is facing. Applies a debuff that deals damage per second and slows enemy movement speed. Affects buildings for reduced damage.

Fires Timbersaw's main saw blade at the target location where it will spin in place, dealing damage in an area around it.  Enemies caught in the saw blade will move more slowly for every 5% of health missing. The blade deals damage and cuts down trees in its path when fired and retracted.  While active the ability costs mana, and Timbersaw loses the ability to attack.
tooltips.Lore: The ultimate in anti-flora weaponry.
tooltips.Note0: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over %break_distance% distance away.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases Chakram and Second Chakram damage per second.
tooltips.2_Lore: Cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut cut!
tooltips.2_Note0: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over %break_distance% distance away.
tooltips.2_Note1: Slow effects from two chakrams do not stack.

talent_4.name: +6 Max / +1 Hero Attack Reactive Armor Stacks

npc_dota_hero_bristleback.Name: Bristleback
npc_dota_hero_bristleback.Short: Takes reduced damage when facing away from enemies

tooltips.Description: Covers a target in snot, causing it to have reduced armor and movement speed.  Multiple casts stack and refresh the duration.
tooltips.scepter_description: Viscous Nasal Goo becomes a no target area of effect ability, applying to all enemies within range. Increases stack limit.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases stack limit by %bonus_stack_limit%.
tooltips.Lore: Having caught a cold while stuck in the snow, Bristleback turns it to his advantage.

tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard: Access Hairball by toggling auto-cast on Quill Spray.\n\nMust draft Nasal Goo for it to work with Hairball.
tooltips.Description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback.  Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14.0 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
tooltips.Note0: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Quill Spray must be drafted also to release when damage threshold reached.
tooltips.Description: Bristleback takes less damage if hit on the sides or rear.  If Bristleback takes 275 damage from the rear, he releases a Quill Spray of the current level.
tooltips.Lore: Turning his back to a fight might be just the thing.
tooltips.Note0: Bristleback's rear is considered to be within 70 degrees from the back.
tooltips.Note1: Bristleback's side is considered to be within 110 degrees from the back.
tooltips.scepter_description: Adds active ability to Bristleback. Bristleback rotates towards the targeted direction and, after 0.5s, forcefully ejects 6 sequential Quill Sprays in a tight conical pattern out of his back every 0.35s. Bristleback's facing is locked during this time, he is disarmed, and his speed is reduced by -40%.

tooltips.Description: Coughs a quill-packed hairball towards the target location. Erupts at the location, hitting enemies with Viscous Nasal Goo stacks and Quill Spray.
Bristleback works himself up into a fury every time he casts a spell, increasing his movement speed and damage.
tooltips.Lore: 'Temper, temper,' his mum always chided.  But in a fight, a temper can come in handy.
tooltips.Note0: Bristleback's illusions will receive the bonuses.
tooltips.Note1: Items will not trigger Warpath.

npc_dota_hero_tusk.Name: Tusk
npc_dota_hero_tusk.Short: Snowballs into his enemies to stun

tooltips.Description: Tusk compresses shards of ice into a ball of frozen energy that damages all enemies it comes in contact with. When the ball reaches its target destination the shards are released, creating a barrier that lasts for 4 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: In the frozen tundra near the Barrier, after the last sun of autumn has set, ice can form with alarming speed.
tooltips.Note0: Creates an impassable barrier.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases depth of Ice Shards, and enemies trapped within an ice shard are slowed and take damage per second.

tooltips.Description: Tusk begins rolling into a snowball. Allies within a 350 radius can also be added to the snowball by right-clicking on them, even while the snowball is moving. Once launched, any enemies caught in the snowball's path will be stunned and take damage. Each allied Hero in the snowball will add to its damage.
tooltips.Lore: Tales are still told of the wild feat that ended the grand brawl at White Fields.
tooltips.Note0: The snowball will break apart a maximum of 3 seconds after launch.
tooltips.Note1: The snowball can be launched early by pressing using the Launch Snowball ability.
tooltips.Note2: Doesn't carry illusions, but will carry Meepo clones and other units that Tusk controls.
tooltips.Note3: Each Meepo clone added to the snowball will add its own bonus damage.
tooltips.Note4: Allies can click on a snowball to add themselves to it.

tooltips.Description: Passively slows the attack speed of all enemies within 350 radius. Activate to temporarily apply a negative debuff aura around you, causing enemies that are attacked under it to take bonus physical damage and reduced movement speed. Lasts 5 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Even far from Cobalt, Tusk carries the 'Barrier Chill' in his very bones.
tooltips.Note0: Affects attacks from allied heroes, Tusk or any of his units.

tooltips.Description: Kicks the closest enemy unit in the drawn direction, stunning, damaging, and slowing them. Also deals damage to all heroes within 250 radius of its landing area. Cooldown is reduced by 50% if kicking a creep.
tooltips.lore: Tusk may have made his name with his fists, but the wise enemy is wary of any and all limbs.

tooltips.Description: Tusk connects with his mighty Walrus Punch, a critical strike with bonus damage so powerful it launches its victim into the air. The victim is slowed upon landing.
tooltips.Lore: It never matters who throws the first punch, only who throws the last.
tooltips.Note0: Walrus PUNCH has true strike.

npc_dota_hero_skywrath_mage.Name: Skywrath Mage
npc_dota_hero_skywrath_mage.Short: Casts high damage magical spells on a single target

tooltips.Description: Skywrath Mage launches a slow-moving bolt of arcane magic, dealing damage to an enemy unit based on Skywrath Mage's intelligence. Upon impact, leaves a debuff that increases Skywrath Mage's spell lifesteal against the target.
tooltips.Lore: Within the Ghastly Eyrie's endless intrigue, only the clever and calm can hope to survive.
tooltips.Note0: The projectile moves very slowly (500 ms), providing 325 vision around it.  Upon impact, it will reveal the target area for 3.34 seconds.
tooltips.Note1: Arcane Bolt cannot be disjointed.
tooltips.scepter_description: When Skywrath Mage casts Arcane Bolt, +2 bolts are created, one aimed at the original target, and the rest - at random enemies within 700 range of the original target. Heroes will take priority.

tooltips.Description: Skywrath Mage sets off a long range shot that hits the closest hero within a long range.  Upon impact, it deals damage and slows in an area of effect. Deals 75% damage to creeps.
tooltips.Lore: Those who serve the court of the Ghastly Eyrie are ever locked in covert war. One must always know where danger lurks nearest.
tooltips.Note0: If no enemy heroes are in range or they are in fog, Concussive Shot targets the nearest enemy creep.
tooltips.Note1: Damages creeps around the impact area.
tooltips.Note2: Provides 400 vision around the projectile, and reveals the target area for 3.34 seconds upon impact.
tooltips.scepter_description: When Skywrath Mage casts Concussive Shot, a different random target within cast range will be hit with the same ability. Heroes will take priority.

tooltips.Description: Skywrath Mage seals the targeted unit with an ancient rune, silencing it and causing it to take additional damage from spells.
tooltips.shard_description: Ancient Seal debuff now causes other debuffs applied to last 50% longer. Grants vision over the target.
tooltips.Lore: A holy incantation, whosoever finds themselves touched by Avilliva's sigil must suffer in penitent silence.
tooltips.Note0: The magic damage resistance reduction doesn't affect creeps.
tooltips.scepter_description: Anytime Skywrath Mage casts Ancient Seal, a different random target within 700 range will be affected by the same ability. Heroes will take priority.

tooltips.Description: Every time Skywrath Mage deals magic damage to an enemy hero with an ability, he gains a buff that grants bonus Intelligence and Armor. Each charge stacks independently.

Skywrath Mage uses his ultimate magical ability to conjure a precise and violent mystical field that lays waste to his adversaries. Deals massive damage distributed evenly among any Heroes in the area over 2.0 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Only the most practiced of Skywrath sorcerers could hope to shape the skies into such a storm.
tooltips.Note0: Mystic Flare only affects Heroes; it does not damage illusions or creep heroes.
tooltips.Note1: Spell immune enemies do not count toward the damage distribution.
tooltips.Note2: Mystic Flare will damage enemy creeps if no enemy heroes are present.
tooltips.scepter_description: When Skywrath Mage casts Mystic Flare, another Mystic Flare will be created on the position of a different random target enemy within 700 range. Heroes will take priority.

npc_dota_hero_abaddon.Name: Abaddon
npc_dota_hero_abaddon.Short: Shields his allies or himself from attacks

tooltips.Description: Abaddon releases a coil of deathly mist that can damage an enemy unit or heal a friendly unit at the cost of some of Abaddon's health.
tooltips.Lore: A mysterious vapor from the Font of Avernus now infuses the breath of Abaddon, who releases it at will.
tooltips.Note0: Abaddon can not kill himself with this skill.

tooltips.Description: Summons dark energies around an ally unit, creating an all damage barrier that absorbs a set amount of damage before expiring. When the barrier is destroyed it will burst and deal damage equal to the amount it could absorb to an area around it. Removes certain types of negative buffs and stuns on cast.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.Lore: The powers of the black mist rise to absorb attacks like the black mist absorbs light.
tooltips.Note0: The max damage is always dealt whether the barrier is destroyed by expiring or absorbing damage.
tooltips.Note1: The explosion does not damage units hidden by the fog of war.

tooltips.Description: Abaddon strikes an enemy, slowing the target's movement speed. If the target gets hit 4 times, they become affected by a chilling curse causing them to take damage over time, be silenced and slowed, and all attacks against them gain an attack speed boost. Damage over time component to buildings is reduced by 70%.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Mist Coil to deal Abaddon's attack damage on impact. Increases Curse of Avernus base slow.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard upgrade effects require Mist Coil and/or Aphotic Shield to be drafted.
tooltips.Lore: While the baptized draw strength from the Font, the gifts of Avernus are debilitating to the uninitiated.

tooltips.Description: When activated, all damage dealt to you will heal instead of harm. Most negative buffs will also be removed. If the ability is not on cooldown, it will automatically activate if your health falls below 400.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.Lore: The most unnatural of all the gifts of the Font of Avernus, this power defies mortal understanding.  What should hurt, instead heals; and what should kill gives strength anew.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases duration. While Borrowed Time is active, anytime an ally takes more than 525 damage while within 1200 range of Abaddon, an individual Mist Coil will automatically fire towards that ally.
tooltips.Note0: Borrowed Time can be manually activated while Abaddon is disabled, but not while silenced.  The passive activation can still occur while silenced.
tooltips.Note1: Aphotic Shield does not block any damage to Abaddon when Borrowed Time is active, allowing him to heal.

npc_dota_hero_elder_titan.Name: Elder Titan
npc_dota_hero_elder_titan.Short: Damages and disables with his astral spirit

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Elder Titan and his Astral Spirit both stomp the ground, damaging and knocking nearby enemy units unconscious around their locations.  The Elder Titan stomp deals physical damage, while the Spirit stomp deals magical damage.
tooltips.shard_description: Lowers Cooldown. Echo Stomp may be placed on alt-cast to allow Elder Titan to take the place of the Astral Spirit as it completes its stomp.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Echo Stomp will still apply both the physical and magical damage values regardless of Astral Spirit being drafted.
tooltips.Lore: The force of creation still echoes in the stomp of the Titan.
tooltips.Note0: If a unit is hit by Astral Spirit and Elder Titan, they will take both instances of damage.
tooltips.spirit_Description: Elder Titan and his Astral Spirit both stomp the ground, damaging and knocking nearby enemy units unconscious around their locations.  The Elder Titan stomp deals physical damage, while the Spirit stomp deals magical damage.  Unconscious enemies will wake if they take damage.
tooltips.spirit_Lore: The force of creation still echoes in the stomp of the Titan.

tooltips.Description: Elder Titan sends forth his Astral Spirit, damaging any units it passes through.  When the spirit rejoins the Titan, it grants bonus damage, armor, and movement speed for each unit it passed through.\n\nThe Astral Spirit can be controlled and possesses the Echo Stomp, Return Spirit, and Natural Order abilities.
tooltips.Lore: Like the four fundamentals, Elder Titan exists across all planes at once and can draw other aspects of himself to assist in times of need.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Elder Titan to become debuff immune and gain 50% magic resistance for 2 seconds per affected enemy Hero when the spirit returns.

tooltips.Description: Reduces all elements to their basic levels, removing base armor and magic damage resistance from nearby enemy units. The armor reduction is centered around the hero, while the magic armor reduction is centered around Astral Spirit.
tooltips.Lore: As it was at the beginning, Elder Titan makes it so again.
tooltips.Note0: When the Astral Spirit isn't present, both the armor and magic armor reduction is centered around Elder Titan.
tooltips.spirit_Note0: When the Astral Spirit isn't present, both the armor and magic armor reduction is centered around Elder Titan.
tooltips.spirit_Description: Reduces all elements to their basic levels, removing base armor and magic damage resistance from nearby enemy units. The armor reduction is centered around the hero, while the magic armor reduction is centered around Astral Spirit.
tooltips.spirit_Lore: As it was at the beginning, Elder Titan makes it so again.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Magic resist reduction will only apply if Astral Spirit has also been drafted.

abilities.name: Move Astral Spirit
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IMMEDIATE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_POINT | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NOT_LEARNABLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_DONT_RESUME_ATTACK | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_CHANNEL

tooltips.Description: Moves the Astral Spirit to target location.

Sends forth a jagged crack in front of Elder Titan. After 3 seconds, the crack implodes, slowing movement while dealing damage to each enemy based on their maximum life. Half of the damage dealt is Magical damage, while the other half is Physical damage.
tooltips.Lore: That which he created, the titan tears asunder.

talent_1.name: +2% Astral Spirit Move Speed Per Hero

npc_dota_hero_legion_commander.Name: Legion Commander
npc_dota_hero_legion_commander.Short: Increases power with each duel victory

tooltips.Description: Turns the enemies' numbers against them, dealing damage per unit or per hero and granting you bonus attack speed. Deals bonus damage to illusions and summoned units as a percent of their current health. Can be cast during Duel.
tooltips.shard_description: Gives +250 bonus radius when cast during Duel.
tooltips.Lore: The archers of Stonehall are ready at Tresdin's command.

tooltips.Description: Removes debuffs and disables from the target friendly unit, and grants bonus movement speed and health regen for a short time.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.shard_description: Press The Attack targets now gain Debuff Immunity for 1.75 seconds. Reduces cooldown by 2 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: The rallying horn of the Bronze Legion is able to inspire any heart.

tooltips.Description: When attacked, Legion Commander has a chance to immediately counterattack with bonus lifesteal.
tooltips.Lore: Tresdin knows that an enemy's most vulnerable moment often follows their fiercest stroke.

tooltips.Description: Legion Commander and the target enemy hero are forced to attack each other for a short duration.  Neither hero can use items or abilities, with the exception of Legion Commander being able to cast Overwhelming Odds. If either hero dies during the duration, the hero winning the Duel gains permanent bonus damage.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases Duel duration and reduces cooldown.  Legion Commander and her opponent take reduced damage from other sources.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases Duel damage by 8 per win. Applies retroactively.
tooltips.Note0: Duels will end if the units are pushed 2000 units apart.
tooltips.Note1: Winning a Duel automatically casts Press the Attack on yourself.
tooltips.Lore: To face a soldier of Stonehall in single combat is a challenge few can resist.

talent_8.name: Press the Attack grants 1.5s Debuff Immunity

npc_dota_hero_ember_spirit.Name: Ember Spirit
npc_dota_hero_ember_spirit.Short: Rapidly strikes and chains his foes

tooltips.Description: Ember Spirit unleashes fiery bolas that wrap around nearby enemies, anchoring them in place and dealing damage each second.
tooltips.Note0: Targets are chosen randomly around Xin.
tooltips.Note1: Does not affect Debuff Immune or invisible units.
tooltips.Lore: Xin's harshest lessons often employed the use of red-hot chains.

tooltips.Description: Ember Spirit dashes around with blazing speed, attacking all enemies in the targeted area of effect, then returning to his start location.  Deals bonus damage to heroes.
tooltips.Note0: Targets are determined when the spell is cast.
tooltips.Note1: A regular attack is done to each target every %attack_interval% seconds.
tooltips.Note2: Any attack modifier that Xin has (such as Critical Strike, Bash, Cleave, or Orb effects) will be applied normally on these attacks.
tooltips.Note3: Abilities and items can be used while Sleight of Fist is active.
tooltips.Lore: The studied warrior must whip and weave through its enemies, burning each without pause.

tooltips.Description: Ember Spirit surrounds himself with a ring of fire that creates a magic damage barrier, absorbing a percentage of the damage taken.  Flame Guard deals damage per second in an area around Ember Spirit while Flame Guard is active.  If the barrier is broken, the damage is also lost.
tooltips.Note0: Magic damage reduction is calculated before any reductions.
tooltips.Note1: The damage lingers for an additional %linger_duration% seconds after application.
tooltips.Lore: An enemy should never be allowed to approach without difficulty.

tooltips.Description: Select the Fire Remnant to arrive at.
tooltips.Lore: With blazing speed does a spirit fly!

tooltips.Description: Sends a Fire Remnant that runs to the target location at 250% Ember Spirit's speed.  Using Activate Fire Remnant, Ember Spirit will dash out to all active Fire Remnants, destroying them and dealing damage in an area and then moving to the nearest Remnant.  Ember Spirit will end at the Remnant closest to the targeted location.
tooltips.shard_description: Fire Remnants deal damage per second in an area around them. If an enemy hero dies near Ember Spirit, a Fire Remnant charge will be replenished.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases cast range, initial remnant speed, and maximum charges.
tooltips.Note0: Starts with 3 charges (maximum).
tooltips.Lore: By the spirit's power are Xin's teachings spread anew.

tooltips.Description: Earth Spirit smashes the target enemy or ally, sending them in the direction he is facing. If Earth Spirit targets an area, he will smash the nearest unit in a 200 radius, prioritizing Stone Remnants. The travelling unit or Remnant damages all enemy units it hits.  If an enemy is hit by a Stone Remnant, they are also slowed. Stone Remnants travel further than other units. Deals 1.4x damage to creeps.
tooltips.Lore: It is with the power of a mountain that Earth Spirit strikes his enemies.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Stone Remnant combination require drafting Magnetize to get the Stone Remnants.

tooltips.Description: Earth Spirit gathers himself into a boulder and, after a 0.6s delay, rolls toward the target location, dealing 60 + 100% STR damage and stunning enemy units. He will stop if he collides with an enemy hero or is stunned. If he rolls over a Stone Remnant, he will travel further and faster, and stun enemies for longer.
tooltips.Lore: Calling upon his connection to the land, the Earth Spirit draws loose stone to him, which forms a protective ball that he can use to roll short distances.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Stone Remnant combination require drafting Magnetize to get the Stone Remnants.
tooltips.Note0: Rolling over a Stone Remnant will destroy the Remnant.
tooltips.Note1: The boulder has a radius of 160.

tooltips.Description: Earth Spirit pulls the target Stone Remnant. Enemies struck by the gripped target will be silenced and take damage.
tooltips.shard_description: Can now grab allies.
tooltips.Note0: Will not work on a unit inside Chronosphere, Duel, or Black Hole.
tooltips.Note1: Geomagnetic Grip can also target allied creeps.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Requires Magnetize to also be drafted to utilize stone remnants.
tooltips.Lore: Like calls to like. Even the minerals found in the blood and bones of living beings are not immune to the call of the Earth Spirit.

tooltips.Description: Call a Stone Remnant to the target location.  Stone Remnants have no vision and are invulnerable, and can be used with Earth Spirit's abilities.  Calling a Stone Remnant consumes a charge, which recharge over time. Gains additional charges every 5 hero levels.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Stone Remnant to provide ground vision. Increases the amount of remnants by %shard_tooltip%.
tooltips.Lore: Earth Spirit calls forth a remnant of his stone army, long buried with him in the dark embrace of the Earth.

tooltips.Description: Earth Spirit temporarily enchants a hero, granting them the properties of a Stone Remnant. After a short duration the remnant shatters, releasing the hero and damaging nearby enemies. < br>\nCan be cast on Stone Remnants. Has a 5 second cooldown when used that way.\nHas a larger cast range when cast on an ally hero.
tooltips.Lore: Kaolin uses the elemental power of the Earth to temporarily petrify living beings, so that they might be conscripted into his stone funerary army.
tooltips.Note0: Earth Spirit himself can be targeted by Boulder Smash if he is enchanted.

tooltips.Description: Magnetizes units in a small nearby area, causing them to take damage for a short duration. Magnetized heroes cause nearby Stone Remnants to explode, destroying the remnant and refreshing Magnetize's duration on all nearby enemies. This process can repeat multiple times. If an enemy hero is affected by Geomagnetic Grip or Boulder Smash, all magnetized heroes share the effects.
tooltips.Lore: At the Earth Spirit's call, the minerals in the blood and bones of his enemies rebel against the bodies they find themselves in.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Stone Remnant ability. Acquiring Scepter will grant the Enchant Remnant ability.

npc_dota_hero_terrorblade.Name: Terrorblade
npc_dota_hero_terrorblade.Short: Transforms into a powerful ranged demon

tooltips.Description: Terrorblade brings forth an invulnerable dark reflection of all enemy heroes in a target area. Affected enemy heroes have movement and attack speeds slowed and attacked by their reflection.
tooltips.Lore: In the fractal prison of Foulfell, Terrorblade learned the truth of this old tale: you are your own worst enemy.  Now it is a lesson he teaches others.
tooltips.Note0: Reflections are untargetable, invulnerable illusions, that will be destroyed if the slow debuff is removed.
tooltips.Note1: Reflections can only attack their source.

tooltips.Description: Creates an illusion of Terrorblade that deals damage.
tooltips.Lore: There's only one thing more dangerous than facing Terrorblade.  Facing MORE Terrorblades!
tooltips.Note0: Illusions created by Conjure Image are visually different for enemies.

tooltips.Description: Terrorblade transforms into a powerful demon with a ranged attack. Any of Terrorblade's illusions that are within 1200 range will also be transformed by Metamorphosis.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Scepter: Access Terror Wave by toggling auto-cast on Metamorphosis.
tooltips.Lore: Temper, temper. The rage rises up and takes control.  Meet Terrorblade's own worst self.
tooltips.Note0: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Terrorblade was in when the item was used.

tooltips.Description: Costs part of Terrorblade's current HP to cast, providing Terrorblade and nearby illusions bonus movement and attack speed. Reflection illusions gain 50% of the bonuses. Can't be cast while in Metamorphosis and Metamorphosis will remove Demon Zeal
Causes a wave to travel outwards in all directions forcing enemy heroes to become Feared upon impact, and grants Terrorblade Metamorphosis for a short time.
Severs the life from both Terrorblade and a target hero, exchanging a percentage of both units' current health. Some health points must remain.
tooltips.Note0: Debuff Immune enemies don't get their HP modified.
tooltips.Lore: You didn't need that life, did you?  The demon marauder steals that which you hold most dear.

npc_dota_hero_phoenix.Name: Phoenix
npc_dota_hero_phoenix.Short: Heals and damages at the sacrifice of its own health

tooltips.Description: Phoenix dives forward in an arc with a fixed distance in the targeted direction, dealing damage over time and slowing the movement speed of any units it comes into contact with, and then orbiting back to its original position. If Phoenix casts Supernova, the dive ends.
tooltips.Lore: Though no stranger to travelling the cosmic void, soaring within an atmosphere offers unique pleasures.
tooltips.Note0: Icarus Dive has a %dive_duration% second travel duration, and can be cancelled by casting the ability again while in flight.

tooltips.Description: Summons 4 fire spirits that circle around Phoenix. Each spirit can be launched independently at a targeted area of effect. Affected enemy units take damage over time and have their attack speed greatly reduced.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Fire Spirits to become a passive charge-based ability. Has 7 second replenish time.
tooltips.Note0: Fire Spirits reveal the area they strike for 1 second.
tooltips.Lore: The ever-collapsing core of Phoenix often emits short-lived bursts of conscious light.

tooltips.Description: Phoenix expels a beam of light at the cost of its own health. The beam damages enemies and heals allies for a base amount plus a percentage of their health. The percentage increases as the beam continues to fire. Enemies are also blinded and get a miss chance that increases as the beam continues to fire.
tooltips.shard_description: Allows Sun Ray to be cast during Supernova, and slows affected enemies by 10%.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: In Ability Draft, Sun Ray movement is disabled.  The hero can only turn in place while Sun Ray is active.
tooltips.Lore: The vent through which such stellar energy flows is mere atoms wide.
tooltips.Note0: Sun Ray has a width of %radius% units, and a length of 1200 units.
tooltips.Note1: Sun Ray is canceled if Phoenix gets stunned, silenced, cycloned, hexed or slept.
tooltips.Note2: Phoenix can use items and abilities without canceling Sun Ray.
tooltips.toggle_move_Description: Toggles slow forward movement during Sun Ray firing.
tooltips.toggle_move_Note0: Sun Ray allows Phoenix to move over cliffs and trees.

tooltips.Description: Toggles slow forward movement during Sun Ray firing.
tooltips.Note0: Sun Ray allows Phoenix to move over cliffs and trees.
tooltips.Lore: SQAWRK!

tooltips.Description: The Phoenix willingly ends its current life for the chance to be reborn. Transforms into a burning sun that scorches enemies in a huge area. The sun can be destroyed by attacks from enemy Heroes. After 6 seconds the sun explodes, stunning all nearby enemies while restoring Phoenix to full health and mana with refreshed abilities.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases number of attacks to destroy Supernova and allows Phoenix to cast Supernova on an allied hero, bringing both into the sun to be reborn together.
tooltips.Lore: The solar crucible of a Supernova may be fatal, yet from its flames arise new beacons to wander infinity.

npc_dota_hero_oracle.Name: Oracle
npc_dota_hero_oracle.Short: Alters the fates of heroes with his buffs and nukes

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Gathers Oracle's power into a bolt of scouring energy that, when released, damages, roots, and dispels enemies of buffs in an area around the target. If target is an ally it will only dispel debuffs. The root duration is equal to the time spent channeling.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: The astral orb crackles with power while raw energy lances out, temporarily disrupting an enemy's connection to their own body.
tooltips.Note0: Can be cast on invulnerable units.

tooltips.Description: Oracle enraptures a target, disarming them if they are an enemy and granting them 100% magic damage resistance if they are an ally.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Fate's Edict no longer causes allies to be disarmed or enemies to be immune to magic damage.
tooltips.Lore: An unbreakable prophecy resounds: a chosen ally shall briefly suffer no magics.  Other kinds of suffering however...
tooltips.scepter_description: Fate's Edict no longer causes allies to be disarmed or enemies to be immune to magic damage.

tooltips.Description: Burns away impurities, dealing heavy magic damage to the target before causing them to regenerate health over time. The amount of health regenerated over its duration exceeds the amount of initial damage. Can be cast on enemies and allies.
tooltips.Lore: Like a hall of mirrors might amplify the light of a single candle, the shattered walls of the universe can transform the light of prophecy into a burning torch.
tooltips.Note0: The healing from Purifying Flames can be stacked with itself.
tooltips.Note1: The damage from Purifying Flames cannot be lethal to allies.

tooltips.Description: Brings forth rain to the target area. Enemies standing in the area receive damage and have reduced heal amplification. Allies in the area heal and have increased incoming heal amplification.
tooltips.Lore: Through mixture of the astral and the atmospheric, Nerif bends a single reality into paradoxical alignment.

tooltips.Description: Temporarily alters an ally's destiny, delaying any healing or damage taken until False Promise ends. Any healing that is delayed by False Promise is amplified. Removes most negative status effects and disables on initial cast.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes False Promise to have a 0.15 second fade delay invisibility and grants the ally 25% bonus Spell Damage and 0.25 reduced Base Attack Time.
tooltips.Lore: Foes and false prophets oft make lies of men's fates.
tooltips.Note0: Delayed damage and healing will take armor and magic resistance reductions into account when received.
tooltips.Note1: The delayed damage and healing takes effect as soon as the target becomes vulnerable.

talent_3.name: Fortune's End Heals/Damages for 60 Per Effect Dispelled

npc_dota_hero_techies.Name: Techies
npc_dota_hero_techies.Short: Surprises enemies with invisible landmines and explosive attacks

tooltips.Description: Lobs a Sticky Bomb towards the target area. If it lands next to an enemy hero, the bomb will stick to it, slowing its movement speed. After a few seconds the bomb will explode, dealing damage in an area around the detonation and applying a secondary slow for 3 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Such revolutionary brilliance was meant to be shared.

tooltips.shard_description: Reactive Tazer can be cast on allies and deals damage on detonation. Also deals damage to any enemy that attacks the affected ally.
tooltips.Description: Techies trigger an electric charge giving them bonus movement speed for a short period of time. Enemies attacking Techies are temporarily disarmed and get a Basic Dispel. At the end of the effect, the charge explodes, disarming all enemies within the radius.
tooltips.Lore: A steady bomb hand prefers an abundance of personal space.

tooltips.Description: Techies hurtle themselves into the enemy's midst, detonating charges upon impact which deal massive area of effect damage and stun enemies. Upon landing, the assault deals Techies non-lethal damage equal to a percentage of their current health.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases Blast Off! cast range by %shard_bonus_cast_range% and applies a %shard_stun_duration% second stun to affected enemies.
tooltips.Lore: Where we going?
tooltips.Note0: The self-damage Techies receive from this blast is non-lethal.
tooltips.Note1: This ability destroys trees.

tooltips.Description: Detonate Reactive Tazer immediately.
Plant a warning sign, causing mines within its radius to be invulnerable. Only one sign can exist at a time. Lasts 60 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Watch your step!
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases radius and duration of Minefield Sign. When an enemy hero walks within 200 units of a minefield sign, the +500 units area around the sign will become a minefield for 10 seconds, dealing damage to enemy units any time they move within its area. Minefield Sign is destroyed after this effect ends.

tooltips.Lore: The bane of Toterin!
tooltips.Description: Plant an invisible mine that cannot be detected by True Sight, but is visible if an enemy is within the active 500 AoE of the mine. Mines detonate if an enemy is standing within the active AoE for 1.0 seconds dealing damage and temporarily reducing the enemy's Magic Resistance. The explosion deals full damage if the target is within 150 radius and decreases up to 50% on the edge. Deals 30% damage to buildings.
tooltips.Note0: Cannot be placed within %placement_radius% AoE of another Proximity Mine.
tooltips.Note1: Proximity Mines do not block neutral creep camps from spawning.
tooltips.Note2: Mines last until they explode or are destroyed.
tooltips.Note3: Mines are triggered by invisible units.
tooltips.Note4: Grants 30 gold if destroyed by an enemy hero.
tooltips.Note5: Spell immune units will reveal mines, but not trigger detonation.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Minefield Sign ability.

npc_dota_hero_winter_wyvern.Name: Winter Wyvern
npc_dota_hero_winter_wyvern.Short: Able to force her enemies to attack their own ally

tooltips.Description: Winter Wyvern soars upon an arctic wind, granting her unobstructed movement and allowing her to exhale a blistering chill into each attack. While soaring, her attacks travel further and faster, and slow enemies with a magical freeze that strips them of 4% of their current health each second. Her sight is also hardened against night's chill, granting her 400 additional vision range at night while soaring.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Arctic Burn to be a toggle ability, draining mana every second when active. Removes limit on number of attacks per target. Increases Winter Wyvern's movement speed.
tooltips.Lore: The same organ where some dragons stoke their inner flame is, in Auroth, a crucible of unimaginable cold. From deep within her frosty gullet, an exhalation sends enemies into burning agony.
tooltips.Note0: Enemy units can only receive the Arctic Burn debuff once per cast.
tooltips.Note1: This ability does not affect Roshan.
tooltips.Note2: Reduces Winter Wyvern's attack point to %attack_point%.
tooltips.Note3: The damage and slow from Arctic Burn can be dispelled.

tooltips.Description: Launches a ball of brittle ice toward an enemy. The ice shatters on impact, leaving the primary target completely unaffected, while hurling damaging splinters into nearby enemies in a 500 base radius. Enemies struck by these splinters are slowed by 30%.
tooltips.Lore: Produced slowly by specialized vesicles in her frozen gullet, Winter Wyvern blast shards of ice at her enemies.
tooltips.Note0: The primary projectile moves at %projectile_speed% movement speed, or reaches the target in %projectile_max_time% second, whichever is faster.
tooltips.Note1: The primary projectile cannot be disjointed.

tooltips.Description: Encases an ally in an icy cocoon, freezing them solid while healing a base amount as well as a percentage of their maximum health each second. The cocoon blocks all physical damage.
tooltips.shard_description: When Cold Embrace ends, a Splinter Blast goes off at that location, hitting enemies within 1200 range. Reduces cooldown by 4.0 seconds.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Shard upgrade requires also drafting Splinter Blast.
tooltips.Lore: From winter's heart comes a cold, healing embrace. The ice slows the blood and allows the spell to better work its curative magic.

tooltips.Description: Winter Wyvern dispells then freezes an enemy in place while striking those nearby with a maddening curse which causes them to attack their frozen ally with increased attack speed. The frozen ally and those cursed to attack their ally are immune to all damage from their enemies with the exception of magic damage from Winter Wyvern or her controlled units, that is amplified.
tooltips.Lore: The oldest of the bookwurm’s spells, this curse lends truth to the old saw: sometimes the enemy of my enemy is my enemy still.
tooltips.Note0: If the target dies to its allies, Winter Wyvern will receive credit for the kill.
tooltips.Note1: Will only pierce the spell immunity of the primary target, not the target's surrounding allies.
tooltips.Note2: If there are no allies within range of the Cursed enemy for %early_out_timer% seconds the effect will end early.

npc_dota_hero_arc_warden.Name: Arc Warden
npc_dota_hero_arc_warden.Short: Creates a copy of himself to split push

tooltips.Description:
Infuses a lone enemy unit with swirling, volatile energy, dealing damage over time. The damage is not applied if another enemy unit is near the target.

Arc Warden:

Slows the target's movement speed.

Tempest Double:

Movement speed slow is decreased, but damage is increased.
tooltips.Lore: An infinitesimal fraction of the power which imprisoned the Ancients.

tooltips.Description:
Arc Warden:

Generates a circular distortion field of magnetic energy that grants bonus attack speed and protects allied heroes and buildings within it by evading attacks coming from outside the field. \n\n

Tempest Double:

Allies gain bonus attack range and deal bonus damage with their attacks. Duration is increased.
tooltips.shard_description: Magnetic Field pushes enemies out of the area when cast and slows them while they are in it. Also provides allies inside with magic resistance.
tooltips.Lore: Time and space are of little consequence to one as old as Zet.

tooltips.Description:
Arc Warden:

Summons a Spark Wraith that slowly materializes and patrols a targeted area until an enemy comes within its range. Once a target has been found the wraith fuses with them, dealing magical damage and slowing the unit. Non-hero units receive 40% more damage. \n\n

Tempest Double:

Increased Wraith Speed and slow duration, decreased Activation Delay and Damage.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Spark Wraiths to spawn a new Spark Wraith after impacting an enemy, which then starts its 2.0 second activation period. The new Spark Wraiths last 15 seconds and has a radius of 225
tooltips.Lore: Lesser fragments of Zet's original self.
tooltips.Note0: Spark Wraiths can not be disjointed.

tooltips.Description: Briefly refocusing its fractured elements into a single form, the Arc Warden is able to create a perfect electrical duplication of itself. The duplicate can use all of Arc Warden's current items and special Tempest Double versions of his spells, except most consumables and items that drop on death. The duplicate has separate item and ability cooldowns.  The Tempest Double gives bounty gold to enemies when killed. The Tempest Double loses its sense of self if he is too far away from Arc Warden and deals less attack damage.
tooltips.Lore: Warped by the power of its peers, Arc Warden becomes what it despises most: disharmony.
tooltips.Note0: Tempest Double and Refresher Orb cannot be used by the duplicate.

talent_7.name: No Damage Penalty Distance For Tempest Double

npc_dota_hero_abyssal_underlord.Name: Underlord
npc_dota_hero_abyssal_underlord.Short: Teleports his team in and out of battle

tooltips.Description: Calls down waves of fire that damage enemy units in the target area, burning for additional damage over time.
tooltips.shard_description: Firestorm can be allied targeted. When used that way, the Firestorm follows the hero around.  The wave count is increased, and tick rate / duration time occur more quickly.
tooltips.Lore: The flames of conquest blaze forth from the darkest depths of the abyss.

tooltips.Description: A deadly pit is conjured at the target location; any unit that enters will be damaged and rooted. Each enemy unit within the pit are affected by the root only every 3.6 seconds.
tooltips.scepter_description: Increases radius of the Pit of Malice.
tooltips.Lore: Twisting into the seams of reality itself, Vrogros' manifest hatred paralyzes those who defy his will.

tooltips.Description: Nearby enemy units are weakened, losing a portion of their base damage. If an enemy dies while under this effect, Underlord gains temporary bonus damage.
tooltips.Lore: To merely stand in the presence of the Underlord is to feel the conviction of battle sapped from one's soul.

tooltips.scepter_description: Summons a Pit of Malice around each of the portals.
tooltips.Lore: They come without warning, leaving fire and blood where kingdoms once flourished.
tooltips.Description: Opens 2 portals, one next to Underlord and one in the target location. Heroes can channel a portal for 3.5 seconds to teleport to the other side. Allies that pass through the portal temporarily gain Damage Reduction and Movement Speed. Portals have to be at least 2000 away from each other.\n\nDouble-click to teleport to your team's base, in front of your fountain.

npc_dota_hero_monkey_king.Name: Monkey King
npc_dota_hero_monkey_king.Short: Springs from the cover of the tree tops

tooltips.Description: Monkey King enlarges his staff and slams it against the ground, stunning enemies in a line and damaging them with a critical hit based on his attack. Has True Strike.
tooltips.Lore: The legendary Jingu Bang grows to match its master's will, ensuring no enemy can escape the Monkey King's reach.
tooltips.shard_Description: When Boundless Strike is set to alt-cast, Monkey King leaps to the end of his staff as soon as Boundless Strike hits the ground, applying Primal Spring with %spring_channel_pct%% of the max channeling duration power where he lands.
tooltips.Note0: Does not affect spell-immune enemies.
tooltips.shard_description: When Boundless Strike is set to alt-cast, Monkey King leaps to the end of his staff as soon as Boundless Strike hits the ground, applying Primal Spring with 60% of the max channeling duration power where he lands.

tooltips.Description: Monkey King jumps to a tree and perches atop it. While perched, he gains the Primal Spring ability-a channeled leap attack. If Monkey King's tree is destroyed, he falls and is stunned for 4 seconds. Taking damage from player controlled units or Roshan while on the ground puts Tree Dance on cooldown.
tooltips.Lore: Sun Wukong dances nimbly along the treetop canopy, always just out of arm's reach.
tooltips.Note0: Tree Dance cooldown starts upon landing.
tooltips.Note1: Right-clicking the ground will have Monkey King drop from the tree.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: For Ability Draft only, Tree Dance ability swaps with Primal Spring while you are perched on a tree. You can no longer jump to other trees without returning to the ground first.

abilities.name: Primal Spring
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_POINT | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_AOE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_CHANNELLED | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NOT_LEARNABLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_ROOT_DISABLES | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_OVERSHOOT

tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Monkey King springs out from his tree perch, damaging and slowing enemies in the area where he lands. Damage and slow amounts are in proportion to channel duration.
tooltips.Lore: Leaping from the safety of cover into the midst of his enemies, Sun Wukong attacks without mercy.

tooltips.Description: Monkey King's attacks awaken the Jingu Bang's power. Upon the fourth hit on the same enemy hero, Monkey King earns four charged attacks that have bonus damage and lifesteal.
tooltips.Lore: Always sensitive to the moods of its master, the Jingu Bang radiates power when Sun Wukong's combat fervor is on full display.
tooltips.Note0: Hitting an enemy with Boundless Strike adds to the hit counter.
tooltips.Note1: Repeatedly hitting an enemy refreshes the Jingu Mastery debuff duration.
tooltips.Note2: Hit charges on enemies cannot be dispelled.
tooltips.Note3: Jingu Mastery buff on self can be dispelled.

tooltips.shard_description: Mischief has a shorter cooldown, longer invulnerability period, and disjoints projectiles.
tooltips.Description: Changes Monkey King's shape to deceive opponents, using the environment nearby as inspiration for the disguise. Taking damage, attacking, or using any item or ability breaks Monkey King's disguise. Grants damage immunity for 0.2 seconds upon transforming.
tooltips.Lore: Watch out for that tree.

tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Mischief
tooltips.Description: Monkey King creates a circular formation of soldiers that spread out from his position. If Monkey King leaves the area his soldiers disperse. The soldiers have Monkey King's attack and only target heroes. Monkey King is granted bonus armor for the spell's duration.
tooltips.scepter_description: Spawns a monkey soldier near Monkey King at regular intervals. Soldiers do not spawn while invisible or on trees. Soldiers only attack buildings when Monkey King himself is nearby. Soldiers can now gain Jingu Mastery charges independently.
tooltips.Lore: Monkey King rips out a tuft of fur to blow at his enemies, charging each strand to transform into a copy of himself.
tooltips.Note0: Soldiers do not receive Jingu Mastery bonuses.
tooltips.Note1: Soldiers do not copy Basher or Abyssal.

npc_dota_hero_pangolier.Name: Pangolier
npc_dota_hero_pangolier.Short: Dashes and rolls in to disrupt enemy movements

tooltips.Description: Pangolier dashes along the target line, then slashes all enemies in the drawn direction with several quick swipes.\n\nLucky Shot has a chance to activate from this damage.
tooltips.Lore: The Pangolier's blade is even nimbler than his tongue.
tooltips.Note0: Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on Swashbuckle attacks.
tooltips.Note1: Casting Swashbuckle during Rolling Thunder ends Rolling Thunder.

tooltips.Description:
Pangolier jumps in the air and slams back to the ground in front of his current position, damaging and slowing all enemies in a radius. For each enemy hero hit, he gains an all damage shield for a short time.

Forward movement is maintained if Shield Crash is used while Rolling Thunder is active, and allows Rolling Thunder to clear walls or cliffs.

 Shield Crash cooldown during Rolling Thunder is decreased.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Shield Crash to cast a 2-attack Swashbuckle every 90 degrees around your hero.
tooltips.Lore: Only in the midst of his enemies does the Pangolier truly thrive.

tooltips.Description: Pangolier rolls the dice and lets fate decide the outcome for his enemies. Grants a chance to drastically slow their attack speed and reduce armor on any damage dealt by Pangolier's attacks or abilities.
tooltips.Lore: The Pangolier's blade is guided more often by whim than reason.

tooltips.Description: Pangolier curls into an immobile protective ball, gaining debuff immunity, 50% magic resistance, and allowing him to turn. Can be cast during Rolling Thunder to temporarily hit the brakes. Can cast Rolling Thunder and Shield Crash during Roll Up. If enemies attack Pangolier during this, he will roll away from the attacker, applying Rolling Thunder damage/stun if there are enemies in the way.
Ends Pangolier's Roll Up early.

Pangolier curls into a debuff immune ball with 50% additional magic resistance and rolls out. When rolling, he moves at an increased speed and can move through trees, but has a decreased ability to turn. Striking enemies knocks them back, inflicting damage and stunning them when they land. 

Colliding with walls or cliffs will cause a temporary pause while Pangolier reverses in direction.

 During Rolling Thunder, Shield Crash cooldown is reduced.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Where his ancestors sought only refuge, the Pangolier saw opportunity...
tooltips.Note0: Enemies can be stunned multiple times per use, but cannot be affected a subsequent time until the previous stun duration ends.
tooltips.Note1: If Pangolier is disabled while rolling, he will continue to stun and knock enemies that come within range.
tooltips.stop_lore: Donté Panlin stops when he pleases.

npc_dota_hero_dark_willow.Name: Dark Willow
npc_dota_hero_dark_willow.Short: Has an arsenal of disables at her disposal

tooltips.Description: Dark Willow creates a maze of brambles that grow in the target area after 0.3 seconds.  Enemies that walk into a bramble are rooted and take damage over time.
tooltips.Lore: The fae realm exists all around you, merely waiting to draw you in...
tooltips.Note0: Does not interrupt channeling spells upon rooting.

tooltips.Description: Dark Willow recedes into the shadows, becoming untargetable.  Her next attack has increased attack range and deals bonus magic damage, and will end Shadow Realm. Damage scales based on how long she remains under the effects of Shadow Realm, the maximum being reached after 3.0 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: What you can't see will most definitely hurt you.
tooltips.scepter_description: Attacking no longer takes Dark Willow out of Shadow Realm. Each attack still has bonus damage based on the duration of the buff.
tooltips.Note0: Disjoints projectiles upon cast.
tooltips.Note1: Grants phased movement.
tooltips.Note2: Spells which require vision cannot affect Dark Willow in the Shadow Realm.

tooltips.Description: Dark Willow casts an ancient fae curse on the target. After a delay, the target and nearby enemies are stunned.
tooltips.shard_description: Cursed Crown creates 4 brambles in a 175 radius around the target after the counter ends. Triggers even upon dispel. Reduces stun delay by 1 second.
tooltips.Lore: Didn't anyone ever tell you? Never strike a deal with a fairy...

tooltips.Description: Dark Willow sends her pet wisp to roam around an ally for the duration, rapidly attacking nearby enemies.  Bedlam cannot be used while Terrorize is active.
tooltips.Lore: You'll have to excuse my friend Jex. He's really into murder.

tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Also grants Bedlam ability.
tooltips.Description: Dark Willow releases her pet wisp to terrorize her enemies. After a short delay, all enemies in the target area become fearful and run toward their home fountain. Terrorize cannot be used while Bedlam is active.
tooltips.Lore: You think you know the first thing about fear? Jex'll show you what that word truly means...
tooltips.Note0: Terrorize provides vision on affected units.

npc_dota_hero_grimstroke.Name: Grimstroke
npc_dota_hero_grimstroke.Short: Disables enemies with a swipe of his brush

tooltips.Description: Grimstroke paints a path of ink with his brush, damaging and slowing enemies. The damage is increased with each enemy the ink hits.
tooltips.Lore: The corruptive force of Grimstroke's ink, drawn from the reservoir of his fallen people, consumes any enemy caught in its path.

tooltips.Description: Summons a phantom that moves quickly towards the target, latching to it when she arrives. Once latched, the phantom damages and silences. If she survives the full latch duration she rends her victim for heavy damage and refreshes Phantom's Embrace's cooldown.\n\nHero attacks against the phantom count as 3 attacks each.
tooltips.Note0: The phantom falls off if the target becomes invisible or spell immune.
tooltips.Note1: The phantom will return if the target dies during the latch.
tooltips.Lore: Grimstroke holds no sorrow for the downfall of his people. Only for Yaovhi, she who was most dear to him, does he feel even a semblance of longing.

tooltips.Description: Grimstroke shrouds an allied unit in ink, increasing its movement speed. Enemies in range of the allied unit are damaged with inky tendrils over time. After 5 seconds, or when manually triggered, it applies damage and stun in an area around the unit in proportion to how long ink tendril was near any hero.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Ink Swell to deal 30% more damage and heal the target for 30% of the damage Ink Swell deals. Upon expiration, the target will receive a strong dispel.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Now that the rise of the ink tide no longer threatens to overwhelm Grimstroke, its tendrils of power are never far from his hand.

tooltips.description: Creates an ink illusion of a target enemy hero. Illusion is debuff immune, has 95% magic resistance, and has bonus movement speed and attack damage.
tooltips.Lore: No dark creation is beyond the skill of the master's hand.
tooltips.Description: Creates an ink illusion of a target enemy hero. Illusion is debuff immune, has 95% magic resistance, and has bonus movement speed and attack damage.
Triggers an existing Ink Swell.

Binds a targeted enemy hero to its nearest allied hero within the bind radius, preventing both from moving away from each other. Any unit-targeted ability that either bound hero receives also gets cast on the other hero. If the bind is broken before the duration expires, the initial target will be bound to its nearest allied hero in the radius.
tooltips.Note0: If bound to another unit, affected units are leashed and prevented from blinking.
tooltips.Note1: Provides vision of both leashed units.
tooltips.Lore: The Ascended were chosen sons of Ashkavor, granted immense power by the bonds forged between their own souls and those they were charged with protecting. In the years that followed the ruination of his kin, Grimstroke discovered much more sinister applications for the binding rituals...

npc_dota_hero_mars.Name: Mars
npc_dota_hero_mars.Short: Traps his foes in an inescapable arena

tooltips.Description: Mars throws his legendary Spear with deadly precision, damaging each enemy unit it strikes. The first enemy hero it hits is skewered on the spear, pushing it back. If a skewered hero hits a tree, building, or cliff, they will be impaled to it and stunned.
tooltips.shard_description: Spear of Mars impales up to two units and leaves a fire trail behind that deals damage over time and slows movement speed.
tooltips.Lore: The legendary Spear of Mars still glows with the heat of the forge god's fires.
tooltips.Note0: Spear of Mars can hit invisible units and reveals them if they are stunned.
tooltips.Note1: Spear of Mars will only pin a unit to cliffs onto elevated areas, otherwise it will push them off onto lower ground.

tooltips.Description: Mars smashes enemies in front of him with his shield, knocking them back and damaging them with a critical hit based on his attack. Bonus damage is added when hitting heroes. Has True Strike.
tooltips.Lore: There isn't a warrior alive who can stand unmoved by the sting of Mars' rebuke.
tooltips.Note0: Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on God's Rebuke attacks.

tooltips.Description: Mars wields his massive shield to block a portion of each physical attack when hit from the front or sides.\n\n Can be toggled, granting phased movement, removing Mars's ability to attack, and locking the direction he is facing. When active, reduces movement speed and re-directs 70% of the attack projectiles aimed at Mars's allies towards Mars instead.
tooltips.scepter_description: Creates 4 invulnerable soldiers on both sides of Mars front while Bulwark is toggled on. Soldiers move alongside Mars, dealing his attacks that have bonus damage, knock back and slow approaching enemies. An enemy can only be attacked by one soldier at a time.
tooltips.Lore: Only the very foolish dare to fight fair with the god of war.
tooltips.Note0: Redirect only works if the projectile targets are in a cone behind Mars or within 100 range of him.

tooltips.Description: After a short formation time, Mars summons an arena lined with the undead warriors of the Ash Legion, who block enemy attacks and movement. Enemy heroes near the inside edge of the arena will be attacked by spears, dealing damage and knocking them back.
tooltips.Lore: The long-dead members of the Ash Legion, assembled from the finest warriors to ever test the might of Mars, still revel in the thrill of combat, gladly beholden to the hand that fell them for as long as he so commands.

talent_8.name: Arena Of Blood Grants Team +180 HP Regen

npc_dota_hero_void_spirit.Name: Void Spirit
npc_dota_hero_void_spirit.Short: Steps in and out of the mortal plane to strike his foes

tooltips.Description: Void Spirit dispatches a remnant to the target location. The remnant stands watch over the region, facing the direction of his vector. When a unit crosses its gaze, the remnant pulls it in and damages it.
tooltips.shard_Description: Increases Aether Remnant watch range and only pulls enemy hero units. Other units take %creep_damage_pct%% damage every %damage_tick_rate%s that they are in the remnant's path, but the remnant is not destroyed. Decreases cooldown to %AbilityCooldown%s.
tooltips.Lore: Inai exists far beyond the scope of a single point in space and time.
tooltips.set_target_Description: Allows Void Spirit to assign a leash target to his remnants.
tooltips.shard_description: Increases Aether Remnant watch range and only pulls enemy hero units. Other units take +30% damage every +1s that they are in the remnant's path, but the remnant is not destroyed. Decreases cooldown to -2s.

tooltips.Description: Void Spirit temporarily fades into the aether, creating a number of portals through which he can reassemble himself. Upon exiting a portal, he damages all enemies in the area.
tooltips.shard_description: Adds a partial outer ring to Dissimilate. Increases damage by %shard_bonus_damage%.
tooltips.Lore: Inai much prefers to observe our plane free from the confines of corporeal form.

tooltips.Description: Void Spirit wraps himself in a physical attack damage barrier and emits a single damaging pulse around him. The barrier gains increased damage absorption for each enemy hero the pulse hits. The barrier only protects against attacks.
tooltips.scepter_description: Causes Resonant Pulse to silence and gain 2 charges.
tooltips.Lore: Inai never hesitates to shroud himself in the essence of his true self when forced to interact with the mortal plane.

tooltips.Description: Void Spirit tears a rift through the astral plane to appear at the target location, attacking all enemies along the path. This attack inflicts a void mark that slows for 1.25 seconds and then detonates.
tooltips.shard_Description: Void Spirits attacks have a %attack_chance_pct%% Chance, and Non-Ult Spells a %ability_chance_pct%% Chance to put a Void Mark on the Enemy.
tooltips.Note0: Astral Step attacks do not cleave.
tooltips.Lore: A small step for Inai creates great devastation on the mortal plane.
tooltips.shard_description: Void Spirits attacks have a 0% Chance, and Non-Ult Spells a 0% Chance to put a Void Mark on the Enemy.

npc_dota_hero_snapfire.Name: Snapfire
npc_dota_hero_snapfire.Short: Mows down her enemies with heavy artillery and trusty lizard

tooltips.Description: Snapfire unloads with a wide blast that damages and slows enemies in a cone. Damage, Movement Slow, Attack Slow and Slow Duration are increased by 50.0% for enemies caught at point-blank range.
tooltips.shard_description: Causes Scatterblast to deal extra damage as well as stun and knockback enemy units in the point blank range.
tooltips.Lore: A favorite from her collection, Beadie crafted Ol' Rackatee as her first line of defense when she ventured into the Outlands.

tooltips.Description: Snapfire feeds a potent cookie to Mortimer or an ally, causing them to hop a short distance. The hopping unit stuns and damages enemies in the landing zone.
tooltips.shard_description: Firesnap cookies become even more potent, getting increased jump range and launching a Mortimer Kiss that does 50% impact damage to the landing destination.
tooltips.Note0: The cookie projectile has a speed of %projectile_speed%.
tooltips.Lore: With the help of a secret mixture that pairs Beadie's baking skills with her passion for black powder, these battle biscuits pack a punch.

tooltips.Description: Snapfire heats up her mounted turret to rapidly fire 6 fixed-damage attacks. Each attack reduces the enemy's armor. Provides bonus attack range for the duration.
tooltips.Note0: Sets base attack time to %base_attack_time%s for the duration.
tooltips.Note1: Attack modifiers have a chance to proc on Lil' Shredder attacks.
tooltips.Lore: Beadie constantly tinkers with a design she first dreamed up plotting an exodus from her old gang.

tooltips.Description: Mortimer gobbles up a creep or an allied hero, which he can then spit towards enemies. The unit stays in his belly up to 3.0 seconds.
tooltips.Note0: Snapfire earns the creep's bounty after it has been spat out and died.

tooltips.Description: Mortimer spits out the unit that's in his mouth, causing impact damage and stun in a large area. The glob leaves a pool of firespit that slows and applies damage over time. Spit Out has a no minimum launch range.

Snapfire's friend launches a barrage of firespit globs over 5.5 seconds. Globs cause impact damage and create pools of firespit, which slow and apply damage over time. Snapfire has a reduced turn rate for the duration and a minimum launch range of 600. Each glob can be targeted with a right click.
tooltips.Note0: Can be cancelled by pressing Stop, Hold Position, or using another ability.
tooltips.Note1: Has a minimum travel time of %min_lob_travel_time% and maximum travel time of %max_lob_travel_time%.
tooltips.Lore: Little did Beadie know when she adopted Mortimer, dragon toads--which aren't even toads at all--share more than just a name with their distant draconic cousins.

talent_7.name: Lil' Shredder Uses 100% of Your Attack Damage

tooltips.Description: Fires Hoodwink's attack with an acorn at the target unit.  The acorn bounces to nearby targets, slowing them and dealing a percentage of Hoodwink's attack with bonus damage.\nIf point targeted, a tree is created at the target position and the acorn will bounce to nearby targets.  The ability may be placed on alt-cast to force this behavior.
tooltips.Lore: Though she'll make do with almost anything, Oak and Ironwood acorns make the most effective projectiles -- and the bulk of Hoodwink's stash.
tooltips.Note0: The same target can be hit more than once.
tooltips.Note1: Bounces will seek units in the fog of war in a 525 radius, but not invisible units.
tooltips.Note2: The planted tree lasts for 20 seconds.
tooltips.Note3: Acorn Shot benefits from attack range bonuses.

tooltips.Description: Tosses a net trap that stuns enemies if they are near a tree in the area.  Affected enemies take damage over time and are pulled towards the tree nearest to them within the target area, and have their vision reduced to 0 for the duration of the stun.
tooltips.Lore: Hoodwink favors Ironwood groves for ambushes, but the wary step carefully in all areas of the mistwoods.
tooltips.Note0: Units can be freed from the stun by destroying the tree.
tooltips.Note1: Bushwhack does not hit invisible units.

tooltips.Description: Hoodwink passively has a chance to evade physical attacks while near trees.  When activated, Hoodwink gains bonus movement speed, attack and cast range, phased movement, and tree-walking for a brief time.
tooltips.Lore: There's not a nook or cranny in the Wood Tomo'kan out of reach of Hoodwink's paws.

tooltips.Description: Hoodwink turns invisible, increasing her movement speed, and creates a decoy illusion that starts aiming a decreased damage Sharpshooter at the nearest enemy hero. If the illusion is attacked or hit by a targeted ability, it is destroyed and it throws a lesser bushwhack towards the enemy.
tooltips.abilitydraft_note: Does not requires Bushwhack to be drafted for full effect.

tooltips.Description: Tosses a boomerang in an arc. Upon contact, it returns to Hoodwink.  The boomerang will deal damage as it passes through or hits enemies, and apply a Hunter's Mark that causes affected enemies to be slowed and be more vulnerable to spell damage.

Hoodwink charges up and fires a deadly bolt from her crossbow, dealing heavy damage, break and slow to an enemy Hero.  The damage and debuff duration scale up to max after 3.0 seconds, and the bolt is fired automatically after 5.0 seconds.\nHoodwink is knocked backwards for a distance of 350 from the force of the shot. Creeps hit by the bolt are damaged for half the values.
tooltips.Scepter_Description: Decreases wind-up time and increases arrow speed.
tooltips.Lore: While her first arbalest was a chance discovery, Hoodwink now takes great care in carving and caring for her own -- of course with some necessary components pilfered or otherwise cleverly procured.
tooltips.release_Description: Release the charged up shot, regain ability to move and attack.

npc_dota_hero_dawnbreaker.Name: Dawnbreaker
npc_dota_hero_dawnbreaker.Short: Leaps to aid her allies, wherever they are on the map

tooltips.Lore: Across the vast lineage of star progeny, there were multitudes unwilling to align with the aims of the Children of Light. To those who dared organize defiance, the Children would dispatch Valora and her hammer to show a measure of their power--to leave the rebels either shattered or set back to rights.
tooltips.Description: Dawnbreaker whirls her hammer around 3 times, damaging enemies with her attack plus bonus damage. On the final strike, she smashes her hammer down, stunning and damaging enemies in front of her.
tooltips.Note0: Dawnbreaker travels at a rate of %movement_speed% for the duration of the ability and takes a brief %self_stun_duration%s to recover after the final strike.
tooltips.Note1: Celestial Hammer or Solar Guardian cannot be cast during the combo.
tooltips.Note2: Cleave does not work with this ability.
tooltips.Note3: Can be self-cast to move forward
tooltips.shard_description: Dawnbreaker gains debuff immunity, 50% magic resistance, and free movement during Starbreaker. Dawnbreaker is slowed by +25% down to a minimum of 215.

tooltips.Lore: The Brightmaul is Valora's oldest companion and sole remaining connection to the glow of her creators.
tooltips.Description: Dawnbreaker hurls her weapon at a target, damaging enemies struck along the way. The hammer pauses for 2 seconds at the destination before flying back to her, leaving a trail of fire that slows enemies. Dawnbreaker can recall the hammer at any time, pulling her towards it so they meet in the middle.
tooltips.Note0: The hammer damages enemies both when thrown and when returning to Dawnbreaker.
tooltips.Note1: Dawnbreaker's Converge movement distance is capped at the ability's cast range.
tooltips.Note2: Starbreaker or Solar Guardian cannot be cast while the Hammer is out.

tooltips.Lore: Diminished in power without access to the Children's replenishing light, Valora can still recharge herself and her allies by creating order from the chaos which resides within each fight.
tooltips.Description: After a number of attacks, Dawnbreaker powers up, charging her next attack with a critical hit that heals all allied heroes within 650 units around her for a portion of attack damage dealt. Creeps and neutral enemies provide less healing. Allies are healed for 50% of the amount.
tooltips.Note0: Luminosity Heal is considered a lifesteal and increased by sources of Lifesteal Amplification.

tooltips.Description: Dawnbreaker recalls her hammer, pulling them together so they meet in the middle.

tooltips.Lore: Only in defense of an ally will Valora relent to call upon the last reserves of her old powers that still allow cosmic flight.
tooltips.Description: CHANNELED - Dawnbreaker creates a pulsing effect at a location within 350 units of an allied hero anywhere on the map, damaging enemies and healing allies with each pulse. After a short duration, she flies to the target location, dealing additional damage and stunning enemies upon landing. Once channeled, Dawnbreaker cannot stop the ability.
tooltips.Note0: Pulse interval is %pulse_interval%s.
tooltips.Note1: Total duration flight duration is 1 seconds of channel time + %airtime_duration% of flight time.
tooltips.Note2: Cannot be cast without the Hammer.
tooltips.Note3: Healing does not affect Dawnbreaker herself.
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces the channel time and increases the healing and total duration of Solar Guardian's air time. Causes allies in the destination area to have evasion while Dawnbreaker is airborne. Solar Guardian can be cast again after take off to land early. While airborne, the landing point of Solar Guardian can be moved at a speed of 200.

npc_dota_hero_marci.Name: Marci
npc_dota_hero_marci.Short: Dashes around pummeling enemies with rapid attacks

tooltips.Description: Marci grabs an allied or enemy target and throws it effortlessly behind her, damaging and slowing the unit if it's an enemy. Any enemy units in the landing area will also be damaged and slowed.
tooltips.Lore: Marci excels at removing obstacles from Princess Mirana's path.

tooltips.Description: Marci bounds to the targeted allied unit, choosing a direction and distance she will spring away from it. Upon reaching the unit, Marci lunges to her final destination, damaging and stunning enemies where she lands.\n\n The ally receives 25% bonus movement speed for 5.0s.
tooltips.shard_Description: Decreases the cooldown of Rebound, it can be cast on enemies, and causes Marci to also get the speed boost when she casts it.
tooltips.Lore: With a friendly or brazen boost, Marci can find her way into the midst of any fight.
tooltips.Note0: Has %min_jump_distance% minimum jump distance.
tooltips.Note1: Marci's initial run to her target unit can be disjointed.
tooltips.shard_description: Decreases the cooldown of Rebound, it can be cast on enemies, and causes Marci to also get the speed boost when she casts it.

tooltips.Description: Marci's loyalty helps ensure survival, imbuing a chosen allied hero and herself with shared lifesteal and attack damage. If Marci and her ally are further apart from each other than 2500, the ally receives no bonuses and Marci only gets 50% until they get close again. Marci's lifesteal also heals her ally and the ally lifesteal also heals Marci.
tooltips.Note0: Marci cannot cast Sidekick on herself.
tooltips.Note1: Lifesteal effectiveness gets a %creep_lifesteal_reduction_pct%% penalty against creeps.
tooltips.Lore: Marci learned at a young age that the best asset in a scrap is a steady companion.

tooltips.Description: Marci taps a hidden power, gaining Fury charges that allow her to deliver a rapid sequence of strikes that slow movement and attack speed of the target for 2.0s. The last strike in every Fury combo creates a damaging pulse around the target. In between Fury combos, Marci is unable to attack for 1.5s.\n\nMarci gains 15% movement speed when Unleash is cast.
tooltips.scepter_Description: Reduces Unleash cooldown by %scepter_cooldown_reduction% seconds and causes Unleash to apply a basic dispel on Marci. While Unleash is Active, all of Marci's abilities unleash pulses when cast. All of Marci's unleash pulses will silence units for %pulse_silence_duration% seconds.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Note0: Once a Fury combo is started, each attack must be delivered within 1s or the Fury combo expires.
tooltips.Note1: Removes attack speed limit.
tooltips.Lore: Though some have sought to understand its origins, Marci rebuffs all attempts to divine the source of her power.
tooltips.scepter_description: Reduces Unleash cooldown by 10.0 seconds and causes Unleash to apply a basic dispel on Marci. While Unleash is Active, all of Marci's abilities unleash pulses when cast. All of Marci's unleash pulses will silence units for +1 seconds.\n\nDISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

npc_dota_hero_primal_beast.Name: Primal Beast
npc_dota_hero_primal_beast.Short: Stomps over everything and smashes enemies into messy bits

tooltips.Description: Primal Beast charges up and then runs in the chosen direction, knocking back enemies and allies alike. Enemy units are damaged and stunned on impact. The longer the charge duration, the farther Primal Beast's momentum will carry him. \n\n Can be cancelled at any time with the Stop command.
tooltips.Lore: The Beast's single-minded focus on chosen prey leaves all other considerations scattered in his ruinous wake.
tooltips.release_Description: Begins the rush to the specified location.
