tooltips.Description: Primal Beast stomps over everything. For every 140 units traveled, all enemies around the Beast receive damage. Deals base damage plus a multiplier of Primal Beast's attack damage. Primal Beast is disarmed for the duration of the ability.
tooltips.Lore: As the only member of his species to arrive on this world, locals can only speculate on the Beast's size relative to his kin. Such observation would prove easier of course if the subject didn't eat everything it sees and destroy most of what it doesn't.

tooltips.Description: The Beast's temper passively provides bonus damage. Additionally, for every instance of 50 damage or more Primal Beast takes from enemy heroes, he accumulates stacks of Uproar. \n\n When activated, Primal Beast releases a roar that slows surrounding enemies and grants the Beast additional attack damage and armor for 7 seconds based on his current stacks of Uproar.
tooltips.Lore: Already draped in a broken patchwork of barding and chains upon appearing in the mistwoods, the Beast tolerates no further attempts at subjugation.
tooltips.scepter_Description: When Primal Beast activates Uproar, he releases %projectile_waves% waves of %projectiles_per_stack% projectiles per stack of uproar each in a circle around him. Projectiles deal damage and Break enemies hit. After a short delay, each projectile splinters in two.
tooltips.scepter_description: When Primal Beast activates Uproar, he releases 3 waves of 2 projectiles per stack of uproar each in a circle around him. Projectiles deal damage and Break enemies hit. After a short delay, each projectile splinters in two.

tooltips.Description: Primal Beast throws a rock at the target location that stuns and damages enemies. The rock cannot be thrown within a minimum range of Primal Beast. After landing, the rock splits into 3 additional fragments that land behind the initial target location.\n\n Rock Throw increases stacks of Uproar for each hero hit.
tooltips.Lore: AGAIN WITH THE ROCKS!

abilities.name: Begin Onslaught
abilities.AbilityBehavior: DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IMMEDIATE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NO_TARGET | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_BACKSWING | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_NOT_LEARNABLE | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_HIDDEN | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_DONT_RESUME_ATTACK | DOTA_ABILITY_BEHAVIOR_IGNORE_CHANNEL

tooltips.Description: Begins the rush to the specified location.

CHANNELED - Primal Beast channels his rage, grabbing the target enemy and slamming them into the ground repeatedly, damaging and mini-stunning any enemies caught in the AoE. Each consecutive hit deals bonus damage. Lasts 2.3 seconds.
tooltips.Lore: Though none are certain whether his utterances have true meaning, most concede the Beast's powerful grip and tendency to smash his enemies into naught but pulp and pieces communicates his intent well enough.

talent_4.name: Beast dispels himself when activating Uproar

talent_7.name: Cannot be slowed or rooted during Trample

npc_dota_hero_muerta.Name: Muerta
npc_dota_hero_muerta.Short: Blasts fearsome trickshots and unleashes ethereal ruin

tooltips.Description: Muerta fires a ghostly trickshot at an enemy unit or tree. When the bullet strikes, it damages and briefly slows, then ricochets in the targeted direction.\n\nThe ricochet damages all units that it passes through, stopping when it hits a hero. Heroes hit by the ricochet are feared away from the impact.
tooltips.Note0: Feared enemies are phased and unslowable.
tooltips.Note1: The ricochet will travel %ricochet_distance_multiplier%x Dead Shot's cast range.
tooltips.Note2: Can ricochet off of magic immune targets.
tooltips.Lore: A steady gunhand and an eternity of practice produce trickshots that defy the mortal mind.
Muerta's family are forever beyond the spirit veil, but her deal with Death allows her to briefly call on them in times of want or need.
tooltips.Description: Summons a group of 4 revenants that slowly circle the targeted location. Enemies within the area are slowed and have reduced attack speed. Revenants deal damage and silence enemies as they pass through them. \n\nEnemy heroes killed inside the Calling refresh its duration and create another Revenant.
Toggleable. When toggled on, Muerta's attacks have a chance to fire a second shot at another target.
tooltips.Note0: If no other units are in range, she fires both guns at the original target.
tooltips.Note1: Secondary shots can hit units within Muerta's attack range plus %target_search_bonus_range%.
tooltips.Note2: The secondary shot can trigger attack modifiers.
tooltips.Lore: Muerta offers all of her victims Mercy. Some are fortunate enough to also earn Grace.

tooltips.Description:
Muerta precisely shoots a hero in their soul, separating it from their physical body and knocking it 150 units away.
The soul is untargetable, muted, disarmed, and invulnerable for 4 seconds.
The body is stunned and has 35% damage reduction for this duration.

After the effect ends the hero's soul is forcefully returned to their body applying a strong dispel. The soul will survive until the end of the effect even if the hero is killed.
tooltips.Note0: Debuff Immune units will take the damage from the shot but not be separated from their body.
tooltips.Note1: Allied heroes hit with Parting Shot will not be damaged.

tooltips.Description:
Muerta transforms, becoming immune to physical damage. All of her attack damage is dealt as magical damage. Muerta gains bonus attack damage and phased movement.

Muerta can attack ethereal units, but deals no damage to Magic Immune targets.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
tooltips.Lore: Muerta sheds her corporeal form, crossing the spirit veil and striking her enemies with the fury of the damned.
tooltips.shard_description: Muerta gains 30% Spell Lifesteal during Pierce the Veil.\nWhile Pierce the Veil is active Muerta permanently gains 2% spell amplification each time she kills an enemy Hero or they die in her vicinity. Bonus applies retroactively.
tooltips.Note0: Muerta will dodge projectiles upon transformation.
tooltips.Note1: Muerta cannot attack buildings while transformed.
tooltips.Note2: Other ethereal effects will not stop Muerta from being able to attack.
